en: A survey conducted by Child Rights International has revealed that 55% out of 11, 288 children between the ages of 12 and 17 sampled want to leave Ghana for greener pastures abroad.
twi: Nhwehwɛmu a Child Rights International yɛɛeɛ kyerɛ sɛ mmɔfra 11,288 mu ɔha nkyɛm aduonum num a wadi mfeɛ firi du mmienu kɔsi du nson na wɔpɛ sɛ wɔfiri ɔman no mu kɔ aburokyire kɔpɛ adwuma papa bi yɛ.
mt0: <pad> 55% of 11, 288 children between the ages of 12 and 17 sampled want to leave Ghana for greener pastures abroad.</s>

en: Eleven percent said they were not certain about staying or leaving the country.
twi: Nnipa no mu ɔha mu nkyɛ mu du-baako de too dwa sɛ wɔnnim sɛ wɔbɛtena anaasɛ wɔbɛfiri ɔman no mu.
mt0: <pad> Ɔha mu du kyerɛɛ sɛ wɔnnim sɛ wɔbɛkɔ anaa wɔbɛfi ɔman no.</s>

en: “55% of the respondents say they wish to migrate to another country, while 11% would either stay in the country or leave. A majority of the respondents cited greener pastures, education and better standard of living as reasons why they would leave the country when there is a chance,” the survey said.
twi: Nhwehwɛmu no kyerɛ sɛ, wɔn a wɔne wɔn dii nkitaho no mu ɔha mu nkyɛ mu aduonum-num kyerɛ sɛ wɔbɛnya sɛ wɔbɛkɔ ɔman foforɔ mu; ɛmu ɔha mu nkyɛ mu du-baako deɛ ne sɛ wɔpɛ sɛ wɔkɔ pɛ adwuma papa bi yɛ, anaa wɔkɔ sukuu anaasɛ abrabɔ mu asetena pa nti na wɔpɛ sɛ wɔfiri ɔman no mu.
mt0: <pad> 55% of the respondents say they wish to migrate to another country, while 11% would either stay in the country or leave. A majority of the respondents cite greener pastures, education and better standard of living as reasons why they would leave the country when there is a chance,” the survey said.</s>

en: On whether they are optimistic in the future of the nation, the survey said: “Nearly 80% of the respondents say they are optimistic about Ghana in the next 20 years. More than two in ten (22%) see the country’s future as bleak”.On Education and opportunities, the survey said: “Over half of the children (53%) say they are optimistic. 47% of the respondents paint a bleak picture as to how the country’s current educational system would help them find jobs in the next 20 years”.
twi: Sɛ ɔman no daakye bɛkɔ yie anaa ɛnkɔ yie ho asɛm no, nhwehwɛmu no kyerɛ sɛ, “ anoyifoɔ no mu no bɛyɛ 80% kyerɛ sɛ mfeɛ aduonu a ɛdi yɛn anim no, na ɔman no afa ne ntoma pa afira. Anoyifoɔ no mu bɛyɛ 20% se wɔnhunu ɔman no daakye yie. Sɛ ɛba nwomasua ne adwumayɛ nso a, nhwehwɛmu no kyerɛ sɛ: “Mmɔfra no mu fa na wɔse ɔman no wɔ daakye. Wɔn mu 47% se sɛ ɛba wɔnhunu sɛdeɛ sukuu mu adesua bɛboa wɔn ama wɔanya adwuma ayɛ wɔ ɔman no mu wɔ mfeɛ aduonu a ɛdi wɔn anim no.”
mt0: <pad> Ɛho nhwehwɛmu no kaa sɛ: "Nnipa 80% kyerɛ sɛ wɔn anigye ho wɔ amansan no abɛyɛ mu wɔ 20 afe a edi akyi. Nnipa 47% kyerɛ sɛ wɔn anigye ho wɔ Ghana abɛyɛ mu wɔ 20 afe a edi akyi".</s>

en: Some youth groups in the Ashanti region have threatened to shut down branches of the Lighthouse Chapel International in the region over a critical sermon delivered by the leader of the church Bishop Dag Heward-Mills which appeared to attack the Ashanti Monarch Otumfuo Osei Tutu.
twi: Mmabunu kuo bi a wɔwɔ Asante Mantam trɛnee sɛ wɔbɛtoto Lighthouse ɔhapel International nsɔresɔre a ɛwɔ mantam no mu ɛnam nsɛm a wɔn panin, Bishop Dag Heward-Mills a ɔda asɔre no ano ka faa Asantehene, Otumfoɔ Osei Tutu ho berɛ na ɔreka Nyamesɛm.
mt0: <pad> Youth groups in the Ashanti region have threatened to shut down Lighthouse Chapel International branches in the region over a critical sermon delivered by the leader of the church Bishop Dag Heward-Mills which appeared to attack the Ashanti Monarch Otumfuo Osei Tutu.</s>

en: The said sermon, which has found its way onto social media, is said to be questioning the impact of the influential king on his subjects and community.
twi: Asɛm a ɔdi too dwa berɛ na ɔreka Nyamesɛm no atrɛ wɔn abɛɛfo ntentanfidie no so; na asɛm no rebisa nsunsuansoɔ a ahemfo akɛseɛ no anya wɔ wɔn a wɔdi wɔn so wɔ mpɔtam no mu.
mt0: <pad> Ɔkyerɛkyerɛ no, a ɛkɔɔ so wɔ social media, kyerɛ sɛ ɔbɛyɛ nsɛm a ɔkyerɛkyerɛfoɔ no tumi de kɔɔ so wɔ ɔman no mu ne ɔman no mu.</s>

en: According to the group, the popular televangelist has slighted the revered traditional leader and must go beyond an apology to atone for his sins.
twi: Mmabunu yi kyerɛ sɛ, ɔsɛmpakani a wagye din yi abu Otumfoɔ animtia enti ɛwɔ sɛ ɔyɛ biribi a ɔso sene akywɛpa sɛdeɛ wɔde ne bɔne bɛkyɛ no.
mt0: <pad> According to the group, the popular televangelist has slighted the revered traditional leader and must go beyond an apology to atone for his sins.</s>

en: “We are calling on Bishop Dag to seek wise counsel within 48 hours. Otherwise, none of his churches in the Asanteman enclave will be allowed to operate. Also, we are warning all and sundry who hide behind religion and politics to push this evil agenda against Asanteman and his royal majesty Otumfuo Osei Tutu. We will let them know that we will meet them up with brute force” the General Secretary of one of the groups Kwabena Frimpong said.
twi: ɔtwerɛtwerɛfoɔ panin a ɛda kuo yi ano, Kwabena Frimpong de too dwa sɛ: “Yɛama ɔsɔfo panin Dag Heward dɔnhwere mmienu sɛ ɔmmɛpa akyɛw anyɛ saa yɛbɛtoto ne nsɔre nyinaa a ɛwɔ Asanteman mu. en: In an apology, the Preacher said: “I am deeply saddened that a message I shared at a conference, nearly 20 years ago, has been taken out of its context and circulated by persons who have previously declared that they will maliciously cause our churches in Kumasi to be closed down.
twi: ɔsɛmpakafoɔ no akyɛwpa mu no, ɔde too dwa sɛ, “Me werɛ aho sɛ nsɛm a mede too dwa mfeɛ aduonu nie na nkorɔfoɔ bi a wɔse wɔbɛfa kwan biara so ama wɔatoto yɛn nsɔre a ɛwɔ Kumasi mu afa adane ani.
mt0: <pad> Ɔkyerɛkyerɛfoɔ no kaa sɛ: "Me ho dwiriw me sɛ m'adwene a ɛwɔ me mu a ɛkɔɔ so wɔ nwoma a ɛyɛ 20 afe a atwam no, na wɔde ato ne ho firi context na wɔde kɔɔ so kyerɛkyerɛɛ nnipa a wɔbɛka sɛ wɔbɛma yɛn asɔre no akɔ Kumasi akɔtwea."</s>

en: “I wish to apologize to His Majesty Otumfuo Nana Osei Tutu II for any disrespect, insult or harm caused him or his royal court. Please accept my profound apologies for the statements I made”.
twi: “Mɛsra mepa ɔtekɔkɔɔsoɔ, Otumfoɔ Nana Osei Tutu II akyɛw wɔ animtia ne ɔhaw biara mede aka n’akonnwa. Mesrɛ sɛ ɔbɛgye m’akyɛwwpa yi ato mu.”
mt0: <pad> 'I want to apologize to His Majesty Otumfuo Nana Osei Tutu II for any disrespect, insult or harm caused him or his royal court. Please accept my profound apologies for the statements I made.</s>

en: The National Democratic Congress has slammed Chief Justice Kwasi Anin-Yeboah, describing his petition to the General Legal Council against lawmaker, Dominic Ayine, as an attempt to suppress free speech.
twi: Amanyɔkuo a yɛfrɛ wɔn National Democratic Congress atwe ɔtemmuafoɔ panin paa, Kwasi Anin-Yeboah anim wɔ pɛtihyin a ɔde ato General Legal Council anim a ɛfa mmaranimfoɔ Dominic Ayine ho. Wɔse saa pɛtihyin yi tia Dominic Ayine kasa fahodie so.
mt0: <pad> National Democratic Congress no asɛe Chief Justice Kwasi Anin-Yeboah, a ɔde ne petition kɔɔ General Legal Council sɛ ɔbɛyɛ nsɛm a wɔde kyerɛ sɛ ɔbɛtwe free speech no.</s>

en: Dr Ayine is reported to have said the Supreme Court failed to apply the rules of procedure during the trial. He is also believed to have raised concerns over the regular dismissal of the petitioners’ applications during the case.
twi: Dr Ayine de too dwa sɛ kɔɔto peemu amfa mmara a ɛda nhyehyɛeɛ ho anni dwuma berɛ a wɔreka asɛm no. ɔsan nso nte aseɛ sɛ na wɔbɔ pɛtihyina no pɛtinhyin no gu.
mt0: <pad> Dr Ayine a wɔkyerɛ no kae sɛ Supreme Court no antumi amfa mmara a ɛwɔ ɔkwan so no mu bere a wɔreyɛ ɔmmoa no. Wɔkyerɛ no sɛ ɔde ne ho too gua sɛ petitioners no kɔmputa no bɛyɛɛ adeɛ a wɔde bɛyɛɛ ɔmmoa no.</s>

en: He made the comments at an event organised by the Centre for Democratic Development (CDD) and the KNUST.
twi: ɔde saa nsɛm yi too dwa wɔ dwumadie a Centre for Democratic Development (CDD) ne KNUST hyehyɛeɛ ase.
mt0: <pad> Ɔkaa saa nsɛm yi wɔ dwumadie a CDD ne KNUST no yɛɛ.</s>

en: The petition by the Chief Justice urged the GLC to probe the lawmaker over the comments and apply the necessary sanctions.
twi: ɔtemmuafoɔ panin paa pɛtihyin maa GLC kwan sɛ wɔbɛfrɛ mmarahyɛbɛdwani yi na ɔbɛyiyi nsɛm ano fa nsɛm a ɔde too dwa no ho na sɛ asotwee bi wɔ hɔ a, wɔde ama no.
mt0: <pad> Ɔsahene no de nsɛm a wɔde too gua no kaa sɛ ɔbɛyɛ nhwehwɛmu sɛ ɔmanpanin no kyerɛɛ nsɛm no ho na ɔbɛhyɛ nsakrae a ɛho hia.</s>

en: Addressing a Press Conference on Monday, the General Secretary of the NDC, Johnson Asiedu Nketia called on the Chief Justice to immediately the petition against the MP for Bolgatanga East.
twi: ɔne nsɛntwerɛfoɔ retwetwe nkɔmmɔ da Dwoada no, NDC twerɛtwerɛfoɔ panin, Johnson Asiedu Nketia de too ɔtemmuafoɔ panin paa anim sɛ ɔntwe kwaadu a ɔde abɔ Bolgatanga East mmarahyɛbɛdwani no nsan.
mt0: <pad> Ɔmanpanin no General Secretary, Johnson Asiedu Nketia called on the Chief Justice to immediately dismiss the petition against the MP for Bolgatanga East.</s>

en: “Public confidence in the judiciary must be earned and not forced on us. How many times have you heard any court telling anybody that I’m going to give a judgment but I’m warning you not to talk about it?” Mr Asiedu Nketia popularly known as General Mosquito said.
twi: Mr Asiedu Nketia a nnipa dodoɔ no ara frɛ no General Mosquito de too dwa sɛ, “ɛwɔ sɛ ɔmanmma no ankasa nya gyidie wɔ aban mmara dwuma no mu na mmom ɛnni kwan sɛ ɛyɛ nhyɛ. Mmerɛ dodoɔ sɛn na woate sɛ kɔɔto reka akyerɛ obi sɛ mede m’atemmuo reba nanso merebɔ wo kɔkɔ sɛ ɛnka ho asɛm?”
mt0: <pad> “Nnipa a wɔwɔ ɔman no mu gyidi ɛsɛ sɛ wɔnya yɛn ho ansa na wɔbɛkyere yɛn. Mɛni bere a woahunu ɔman no mu ɔmanfoɔ kaa sɛ ɔrekɔ ma ɔmmoa nnipa bi sɛ ɔnka nsɛm no?</s>

en: He added that “The judiciary, like parliament or executive, is not above criticism…Our laws and constitution protect the integrity and independence of the judiciary and not the sensibility of a judge. The notion that the judicial arm of gov’t is beyond reproach is a fantasy that can’t be sustained.”
twi: ɔde kaa ho sɛ, “Te sɛ mmarahyɛbadwa ne aban mu baamfoɔ, saa ara nso na aban mmara adwuma no nso sene animka. Yɛn mmara ne yɛn mmara kunini no bɔ aban mmara adwuma no fahodie ho ban na ɛnyɛ ɛnsosɔ deɛ ɔtemmuafoɔ baako pɛ bi pɛ so. Saa adwene a nnipa bi dwene sɛ wɔntumi ntwi aban mmara adwuma no anim sɛ wɔyɛ biribi a nyɛ no yɛ nnaadaa a wɔnsosɔ koraa.”
mt0: <pad> Ɔkaa sɛ, "Adwumayɛfoɔ no, te sɛ parliament anaa executive, ɛnyɛ adehyeɛ a ɛho nkɔmmɔ...Yɛn mmara ne constitution gyina adwumayɛfoɔ no ho nanso ɛnyɛ judge no nsakraeɛ. Notion a adwumayɛfoɔ no tumi bɛgyina a ɛho nkɔmmɔ no yɛ fantasy a ɛmfa nsunsuansoɔ nni hɔ.</s>

en: Mr Asiedu Nketia also accused the Chief Justice of targeting NDC affiliated lawyers and called on him to stop the witch-hunt.
twi: Mr Asiedu Nketia san nso de kwaadu bɔɔ ɔtemmuafoɔ panin paa sɛ wɔde n’ani asi wɔn a wɔyɛ NDC alɔyafoɔ no so, na ɔde ato n’anim sɛ ɔnnyae saa.
mt0: <pad> Mr Asiedu Nketia nso accused the Chief Justice of targeting NDC affiliated lawyers and called on him to stop the witch-hunt.</s>

en: “It’s no coincidence that virtually all the lawyers who have been reported to the disciplinary committee of the General Legal council by the Chief Justice, Justice Kwasi Anin Yeboah in recent times are aligned to the NDC. What is the Chief Justice’s personal interest in the punishment of NDC affiliated lawyers that his he’s so keen to initiate unwarranted actions against them”
twi: ɛnyɛ nwanwa sɛ alɔyafoɔ a ɔtemmuafoɔ panin paa, Justice Kwasi Anin Yeboah de kwaadu abɔ wɔn ama wɔakɔ asotwee kɔmitee no anim no nyinaa ne NDC wɔ twaka. Adɛn nti na ɔtemmuafoɔ panin paa ani di alɔyafoɔ a wɔne NDC wɔ twaka akyi sɛ wɔbɛtwe wɔn aso a ɔpɛ sɛ ɔyɛ deɛ ɔyɛ biara ma wɔn ho kyire wɔn?”

What is the Chief Justice's personal interest in the punishment of NDC affiliated lawyers that he’s so keen to initiate unwarranted actions against them?</s>

en: Ghana has been ranked the second most peaceful country in Africa behind Mauritius in the 2021 Global Peace Index report by the Institute for Economics and Peace (IEP).
twi: Ghanaman tɔ so mmienu wɔ Abibiman mu sɛ ɔman a asomdwoeɛ wɔ mu berɛ Mauritius dii kan wɔ 2021 Global peace Index amanebɔ a Institute for Economics and peace de too dwa no.
mt0: <pad> Ghana ayɛ aman a ɛwɔ asomdwoe paa wɔ Africa sɛ ɔtɔ so mmienu wɔ 2021 Global Peace Index no mu.</s>

en: The Global Peace Index is the world’s leading measure of global peacefulness. The index ranks 163 independent states and territories according to their level of peacefulness. This report presents the most comprehensive data-driven analysis to date on trends in peace, its economic value, and how to develop peaceful societies.
twi: Sɛ ɛba sɛ yɛrekari amansan asomdwoeɛ a, Global peace Index na ɛdi kan. Saa akyerɛkyerɛkwan yi na wɔde kari aman ɔha ne aduosia mmiɛnsa ma wɔhunu sɛdeɛ wɔn man no mu si dwo si fa. Saa nhwehwɛmu yi yɛ nhwehwɛmu mapa a akɔ so bɛsi nnɛ wɔ asomdwoeɛ, ne sikasɛm ho mfasoɔ a ɛwɔ ho ne kwan a wɔfa so ma asomdwoeɛ da adi wɔ mpɔtam mu.
mt0: <pad> Global Peace Index yɛ wiase aman a wɔn ho yɛ adwuma no mu ɔkwan a wɔde hwɛ sɛ ɔman no bɛdi asomdwoe. Index no ranks 163 independent states and territories according to their level of peacefulness. Saa nhoma yi de kɔmputa a ɛwɔ hɔ a wɔde kyerɛ sɛ ɔkwan a wɔde bɛyɛ asomdwoe, ne sɛ yɛbɛyɛ asomdwoe kuw no ayɛ papa.</s>

en: In the latest rankings, Ghana ranked 38th in the world out of a total of 163 countries reviewed. Ghana scored 1.715 which represents a two-point move upwards from the country’s previous position.
twi: Sɛ yɛfa aman ɔha ne aduosia mmiɛnsa no a, nhwehwɛmu a ɛbaa no da no adi sɛ Ghana tɔ so aduasa-wɔtwe. Ghana nyaa aba no 1.715 a ɛde wɔn baa wɔn anim mmienu sene kane deɛ no.
mt0: <pad> Ghana kɔɔ 38th wɔ wiase nyinaa mu wɔ 163 aman a wɔhwɛɛ no mu. Ghana scored 1.715 a ɛkyerɛ sɛ ɛkɔɔ so mmienu firi Ghana a na ɛwɔ nnipa bɛyɛ 1,600.</s>

en: Mauritius, the most peaceful country in Africa ranked 28th globally, while Botswana ranked third place in Africa and 41st in the world. Nigeria ranked 146 globally behind Togo, Uganda, Kenya, The Republic of Congo and Cameroon.
twi: Wiase mu nyinaa, Mauritius a ɔdii kan wɔ Abibiman mu no tɔɔ so aduonu-wɔtwe, ɛnna Botswana a ɔtɔɔ so mmiɛnsa wɔ Abibiman mu no tɔɔ so aduanan baako wɔ wiase nyinaa. Wiase mu nyinaa Nigeria tɔɔ so ɔha ne aduanan nsia a Togo, Uganda, Kenya, RePublic of ɔongo ne Cameroon nyinaa sann ne ho.
mt0: <pad> Mauritius, Africa man a ɛyɛ asomdwoe paa no kɔɔ 28th globally, na Botswana kɔɔ 41st in the world. Nigeria kɔɔ 146 globally behind Togo, Uganda, Kenya, The Republic of Congo and Cameroon.</s>

en: Iceland remains the most peaceful country in the world, a position it has held since 2008. It is joined at the top of the index by New Zealand, Denmark, Portugal, and Slovenia.
twi: Iɔeland da so di kan sɛ ɔman a asomdwoeɛ wɔ mu wɔ wiase nyinaa. Wɔada kan firi 2008. Wɔn a wɔka wɔn ho wɔn soro hɔ ne New Zealand, Denmark, Portugal ne Slovenia.
mt0: <pad> Iceland kɔ so sɛ ɔman a ɛyɛ asomdwoe paa wɔ wiase, a ɛwɔ 2008 mu. New Zealand, Denmark, Portugal, and Slovenia nso kɔ so sɛ ɔman a ɛyɛ asomdwoe paa wɔ wiase.</s>

en: Afghanistan is the least peaceful country in the world for the fourth consecutive year, followed by Yemen, Syria, South Sudan, and Iraq. Burkina Faso recorded the largest deterioration in the Global Peace Index 2021.
twi: Afghanistan ni ɔman a asomdwoeɛ nni mu koraa (wɔada hɔ mfeɛ nan niɔ. Wɔn a wɔdi n’akyi ne Yemen, Syria, South Sudan ne Iraq. Global peace Index 2021 no kyerɛ sɛ, Burkina Faso ne ɔman a asomdwoeɛ akɔ fam koraa wɔ hɔ.
mt0: <pad> Afghanistan yɛ aman a ɛho nni asomdwoe wɔ wiase no mu mfeɛ nnan, ɛno akyi Yemen, Syria, South Sudan, ne Iraq. Burkina Faso kɔɔ so sɛ ɛbɛyɛɛ den paa wɔ Global Peace Index 2021.</s>

en: According to the report, half of the population in Sub-Saharan Africa had a recent experience of violence. Those living in Namibia had the highest experience of violence in the world at 6 per cent.
twi: Nhwehwɛmu ma yɛhu sɛ, basabasaeɛ wɔ aman ahodoɔ a wɔwɔ Sub-Saharan Africa. Namibia na basabasaeɛ wɔ pa ara a sɛ ɛba asomdwoeɛ a, wɔwɔ ɔha mu nkyɛ mu nsia.

en: The largest deterioration in peacefulness in the region occurred in Burkina Faso. This was also the single largest deterioration of any country. The government’s decision to fund and arm civilian auxiliary groups in its fight against insurgents drove the plunge.
twi: ɔman a wɔwɔ saa beaeɛ hɔ a asomdwoeɛ akɔ fam koraa wɔ mu ne Burkina Faso, na wɔsene ɔman biara. Aban no de tuo hyɛɛ amanfoɔ nsam sɛ wɔne atuatedɔm no mfa mmɔ ani na asɛe nnoɔma.
mt0: <pad> Ɔman no mu ɔhaw kɛseɛ a ɛkɔɔ so wɔ aman no mu no sii wɔ Burkina Faso. Wei yɛ ɔman no mu ɔhaw kɛseɛ a ɛkɔɔ so wɔ aman biara mu. Adwumayɛfoɔ no nhyehyɛe a ɛde sika ne nnipa a wɔboa ɔman no mu kɔɔ so wɔ ɔko no mu de kɔɔ so kɔɔ fam no maa ɔhaw kɛseɛ no kɔɔ so.</s>

en: The report highlighted that civil unrest rose 10 per cent globally, driven by the coronavirus pandemic. There were 14,871 violent demonstrations, protests and riots recorded globally in 2020.
twi: Nhwehwɛmu no kyerɛ sɛ, na nnipa nyinaa ho nnwo wɔ wiase mu nyinaa. Wei kɔɔ n’anim ɔha mu nkyɛ mu du ɛsiane Coronavirus kodiawuo no. ɔyɛkyerɛ a ɛsɛe nnoɔma 14,871 na ɛkɔɔ so wɔ wiase mu nyinaa wɔ afe 2020 mu.
mt0: <pad> Ɔkyerɛwde no kyerɛ sɛ ɔmanfo nsuo ayɛ den bɛyɛ 10% wɔ wiase afanan nyinaa, a coronavirus pandemic no de kɔɔ so.</s>

en: The report said Covid was a “multiplying force” in future political instability and civil unrest. It added the level of this unrest going forward is likely to hinge on the speed and effectiveness of economic recovery. Countries with less debt and higher levels of positive peace were more likely to recover faster.
twi: Nhwehwɛmu no de too dwa sɛ, ɔovid maa amanyɔsɛm ne nnipa asetenam nyinaa yɛɛ basaa; saa adeɛ yi nso bɛnya nsunsuansoɔ wɔ ɔman no sikasɛm so, sɛ ɛbɛkɔ yie anaa ɛnk yie. Aman a wɔnni ka kɛseɛ na asomdwoeɛ nso wɔ so pa ara no sikasɛm bɛsi ne dadaa mu akyɛn wɔn a ɛnte saa wɔ wɔn man mu no.
mt0: <pad> Ɛbɔɔ aman a ɛwɔ nsuo mu no ho ban ne ɔmanfoɔ a wɔn ho yɛ hu no ho mmɔden sɛ wɔbɛkɔ so ayɛ adeɛ a ɛbɛyɛ den.</s>

en: Despite this, overall three-quarters of people globally feel as safe or safer today than they did five years ago. Some indicators of violence have recorded significant improvements since the start of the index, and 123 countries have seen murder rates fall since 2008.
twi: Wei nyinaa akyi no, nnipa wɔwɔ wiase mu nyinaa mu abunan mu mmiɛnsa ho tɔ wɔn nnɛ kyɛn sɛdeɛ na ɛteɛ mfeɛ num a atwam no. Nsesaeɛ mapa aba mmeaeɛ a na basabasaeɛ rekɔ so wɔ hɔ pa ara no, na ɛfiri 2008 reba no, nnipa a wɔkumkum wɔn wɔ aman ɔha ne aduonu mmiɛnsa so ate aba fam koraa.
mt0: <pad> Deɛ ɛwɔ hɔ no, nnipa bɛyɛ nkyekyɛmu aduasa a wɔwɔ wiase nyinaa no ara kɔ so sɛdeɛ wɔtee wɔ afe a atwam mu.</s>

en: The Index also revealed that “the average level of global peacefulness deteriorated by 0.07 per cent in the 2021 Global Peace Index. Although a relatively small deterioration, this is the ninth time in the last 13 years that global peacefulness has deteriorated”.
twi: Amannebɔ yi san nso da no adi sɛ, “Wiase mu nyinaa asomdwoeɛ so teɛ 0.07% wɔ 2021 Global peace Index no so. ɛmfa ho ne ɛso te a ɛteɛ no, wei ne deɛ nkron wɔ mfeɛ du-mmiɛnsa a amansan asomdwoeɛ ho ateɛ.”
mt0: <pad> Ɛho nhwɛsoɔ no kyerɛɛ sɛ "asekyerɛkyerɛ a ɛwɔ wiase nyinaa mu yɛ adwumayɛ no kɔɔ so wɔ 2021 Global Peace Index. Sɛ ɛyɛ nsutɔɔdeɛ a ɛyɛ ketewa, ɛno ne mfeɛ 13 a atwam mu a ɛyɛ ninth bere a wiase nyinaa nyinaa yɛ adwumayɛ no kɔɔ so".</s>

en: The report added that “in the past year, 87 countries recorded an improvement in peacefulness, while 73 countries recorded a deterioration. Three countries recorded no change in their overall score. The Middle East and North Africa (MENA) region remained the world’s least peaceful region. It is home to three of the five least peaceful countries in the world. However, it recorded the largest regional improvement over the past year”.
twi: Amannebɔ yi de pii so sɛ, “Afe a ɛtwaa mu no, sɛ ɛba asomdwoeɛ mu a, aman aduowɔtwe nson na wɔkɔɔ wɔn anim, ɛnna aman aduoson mmiɛnsa deɛ kɔɔ wɔn akyi. Aman mmiɛnsa bi deɛ, hwee ansesa wɔ hɔ. Middle East ne North Africa (MENAɔ da so yɛ beaeɛ a asomdwoeɛ nni hɔ koraa. Wiase mu nyinaa, ɛhɔ na aman num a asomdwoeɛ nni no mu mmiɛnsa wɔ. Mmom, ɛhɔ ne beaeɛ a wɔkɔɔ wɔn anim wɔ asomdwoeɛ mpontuo mu wɔ afe a ɛtwaa mu no.”
mt0: <pad> Ɛkaa sɛ, "wɔ afe a atwam no, aman 87 kyerɛɛ nteaseɛ wɔ aman ahodoɔ mu, na aman 73 kyerɛɛ nteaseɛ wɔ aman ahodoɔ mu. Middle East and North Africa (MENA) kɔɔ so yɛɛ aman a ɛnyɛ ahodoɔ wɔ wiase nyinaa. Nanso, ɛkɔɔ so kyerɛɛ nteaseɛ wɔ aman ahodoɔ mu a ɛyɛ kɛseɛ paa wɔ wiase nyinaa.</s>

en: “Europe…remains the most peaceful region in the world. The region is home to eight of the ten most peaceful countries, and no country in Europe is ranked outside the top half of the index”.
twi: Europe da so yɛ beaeɛ a asomdwoeɛ wɔ pa ara wɔ wiase nyinaa. Aman du a asomdwoeɛ wɔ mu pa ara wiase yi mu nyinaa mu nwɔtwe na ɛwɔ saa beaeɛ yi mu, na sɛ yɛkyɛ akyerɛkyerɛkwan no mu ha a, ɔman biara nni Europe a ɛwɔ fam deɛ no mu.”

en: President-elect Nana Addo Dankwa Akufo-Addo has assured Ghanaians that they will see an improvement in the standard of living under his presidency.
twi: ɔmampanin a wɔyi no, Nana Addo Dankwa Akufo-Addo de ato Ghanafoɔ anim sɛ wɔnya awerɛhyɛmu sɛ wɔn asetenam mu nsɛm bɛkɔ nkan wɔ n’amammuo mu.
mt0: <pad> President-elect Nana Addo Dankwa Akufo-Addo asɛm Ghanafoɔ sɛ wɔbɛhu nnipa a wɔte Ghana no nkwadaa yɛɛ papa wɔ ne aban mu.</s>

en: According to him, the next four years must have a positive impact on the life of the ordinary Ghanaian.
twi: ɔde too dwa sɛ, mfeɛ nan a ɛda yɛn anim yi deɛ, biribiara bɛkɔ so kamakama wɔ Ghanani biara asetenam.
mt0: <pad> Ghanafoɔ no bɛyɛ sɛ wɔn ho bɛkɔ so ayɛ papa wɔ afe nnan a edi anim no mu.</s>

en: “I am extremely concerned, that the next four years will see a marked improvement in the living standards of the people of Ghana,” the president-elect made the comments during his official tour to Nigeria after he won the presidential elections.
twi: “Me dadwenee kɛseɛ ne sɛ, mfeɛ nan a ɛda yɛn anim no bɛma yɛhunu nkankɔ wɔ Ghanafoɔ biara abrabɔ mu”. ɔmampanin de saa nsɛm yi too dwa berɛ na ɔbɔ aporɔ wɔ Nigeria man mu.
mt0: <pad> “Me ho yɛ me, sɛ mfeɛ nnan a edi akyi no bɛma Ghanafoɔ no nkwadaa ahodoɔ bɛkɔ anim yiye,” Ghana manpanin-a ɔdi kan no kaa wɔ Nigeria bere a ɔrekɔ so nsrahwɛ wɔ Nigeria awieeɛ.</s>

en: Mr. Akufo-Addo addressing the Governor of the Imo State in Nigeria Owelle Rochas Anayo Okorocha, Monday added: “the Ghanaian economy has taken a hit in these last three or four years but we believe with discipline, with hard work and correct set of policies we should be able to bring the country back to prosperity.”
twi: Owura Akufo-Addo ne amrado a ɛda Imo State ano wɔ Nigeria, Owelle Roɔhas Anayo Okoroɔha retwetwe nkɔmmɔ no da Dwoada no, ɔde kaa ho sɛ: “Mfeɛ mmiɛnsa anaa nan a atwa mu no, Ghana sikasɛm ho ntotoeɛ aba fam nso yɛgye di sɛ sɛ yɛhyɛ yɛn ho so, na yɛyɛ adwuma den na yɛde nhyehyɛeɛ mapa gu akwan mu a, ɔman no bɛfa ne yiedie ntoma asan afira.”
mt0: <pad> Ghanaian economy took a hit in the last three or four years but we believe with discipline, with hard work and correct set of policies we should be able to bring the country back to prosperity.</s>

en: The president-elect who beat Incumbent President, John Dramani Mahama in the just ended presidential election is on a three-day visit to Nigeria where he will have discussions with the oil producing country’s leader, Muhammudu Buhari.
twi: ɔmampanin a ɔtuu ɔmampanin a na ɔte akonnwa so, John Dramani Mahama wɔ abatoɔ a ɛtwaa mu de nan mmiɛnsa rebɔ aporɔ wɔ Nigeria, na ɔne Nigeria mampanin Muhammudu Buhari bɛtwetwe nkɔmmɔ.
mt0: <pad> Ɔman panin-a wɔbɛgyina a ɔdii nkonim no, John Dramani Mahama, wɔ ɔman panin abatoɔ a atwam no mu no, ɛwɔ Nigeria sɛ ɔbɛka asɛm a ɛfa ɔman no a ɛyɛ oil producer, Muhammudu Buhari ho.</s>

en: Mr. Akufo-Addo also assured the Imo State governor that relationship between the two West African countries will be strengthened under his presidency.
twi: ɔmampanin Akufo Addo san nso hyɛɛ Imo State amrado no bɔ sɛ ayɔnkofa a ɛda Ghana ne Nigeria man ntɛm no, ɔbɛhyɛ mu kena.
mt0: <pad> Mr. Akufo-Addo nso kaa sɛ ɔmanpanin a ɔyɛ Imo State no sɛ nkitahodie a ɛwɔ West African man no ne Nigeria no bɛkɔ so wɔ ɔmanpanin a ɔdii ase no mu no.</s>

en: “We value the historic relationship between the two countries. It is important that such links are established between our people and our leaders. They give confidence to our populations that we are working to try and resolve their problems and help them progress with their lives…the stronger the relationship between the two countries is, the better it is for the West Africa Region and the continent large,” he added.
twi: ɔde toa so sɛ, “Yɛn ani sɔ ayɔnkofa a ɛda aman mmienu yi ntam. ɛho hia sɛ saa ayɔnkofa yi da aman mma ne wɔn mpaninfoɔ ntam. ɛma aman mma no h=nya awerɛhyɛmu sɛ yɛreyɛ adwuma aboa ma wɔn haw nyinaa to atwa na wɔn abrabɔ atu mpɔn... ayankofa a ɛda aman mmienu yi mu yɛ den a, ɛso bɛba mfasoɔ ama West Africa ne Abibiman nyinaa.
mt0: <pad> “Yɛnnsusu sɛ yɛbɛgye akɔmmɔ a ɛwɔ nsuo mu a ɛda nsuo mu no ho. Sɛ yɛbɛgye akɔmmɔ a ɛda nsuo mu no ho a, ɛbɛyɛ papa ma West Africa Region ne asasetam no nyinaa,” ɔkaa ho.</s>

en: President John Dramani Mahama has confirmed Joseph Whittal as the new Commissioner for the Commission on Human Rights and Administrative Justice (CHRAJ).
twi: ɔmampanin John Dramani Mahama apaw Joseph Whittal sɛ ɔnyɛ kɔmisa mma Commission on Human Rights and Administrative Justice (CHRAJ)
mt0: <pad> President John Dramani Mahama ayɛ Joseph Whittal sɛ Commissioner a ɔbɛdi Human Rights ne Administrative Justice (CHRAJ) no anim.</s>

en: Mr. Whittal was sworn-in at a short ceremony at the Flagstaff House Tuesday afternoon.
twi: Wɔde Owura Whittal kaa ntam da Benada awia wɔ Flagstaff House hyɛɛ ne dwumadie ase.
mt0: <pad> Mr. Whittal a wɔde no bɛkyerɛɛ no wɔ afahyɛ ketewa bi wɔ Flagstaff House Benada anadwo.</s>

en: Mr. Whittal has been acting as the head for CHRAJ since the former commissioner, Lauretta Vivian Lamptey was removed by the President after causing financial loss to the state.
twi: Owura Whittal na ayɛ kɔmisa ma ɔHRAɛ firi berɛ a ɔmampanin yii kɔmisa dadaa, Lauretta Vivian Lamptey firii so ɛsiane ɛka a ɔbɔɔ ɔman no.
mt0: <pad> Mr. Whittal ayɛ CHRAJ no ɔmanpanin firi sɛ ɔmanpanin a na ɔyɛ ɔmanpanin, Lauretta Vivian Lamptey a wɔde kɔɔ so no, a wɔkyeree no ɛfirii sɛ ɔmanpanin no de sika bɛma ɔman no.</s>

en: The President has appointed Ms. Josephine Nkrumah as the substantive head of the National Commission for Civic Education (NCCE).
twi: ɔmampanin ayi Awuraa Josephine Nkrumah sɛ ɔpanin ɔmmɛda National Commission for Civic Education (NCCE) ano.
mt0: <pad> President no de Ms. Josephine Nkrumah ayɛ ɔman panin a ɔbɛdi National Commission for Civic Education (NCCE) anim.</s>

en: Ms. Nkrumah who was a deputy chairman for the commission replaces Mrs. Charlotte Osei, wdho was as the head of the country’s Electoral Commission by the President in July last year.
twi: Awuraa Nkrumah a na ɔyɛ ɔtitenani abadiakyire ma kɔmisa no abɛhyɛ Awuraa Charlotte Osei a ɔmampanin no yii no sɛ ɔmmɛda ɔman no abatoɔ kɔmisa ano wɔ Kitawonsa bosome no mu wɔ afe a ɛtwaa mu no anan.
mt0: <pad> Ms. Nkrumah a na ɔyɛ adwumakuw no mu panin no, bɛsanee Charlotte Osei a wɔde too gua sɛ ɔman no Electoral Commission chairman no wɔ Ɔpɛpɔn afe a atwam no.</s>

en: The appointments come few weeks after the President lost the presidential election to opposition NPP leader Nana Addo Dankwa Akufo-Addo.
twi: Saa dwumadie yi a aban de amma nkorɔfoɔ yi baa nnawɔtwe akyi ansa na NPP kandifoɔ Nana Addo Dankwa Akufo-Addo reyi ɔmampanin a na ɔte akonnwa no so afiri akonnwa no so.
mt0: <pad> Ɔmanpanin no ayɛ adwuma no bɛduru nnɔnhwere bi akyi bere a ɔdii ɔmanpanin abatoɔ no kɔɔ opposition NPP leader Nana Addo Dankwa Akufo-Addo.</s>

en: The president-elect will be sworn-in on January 7, 2017.
twi: Wɔde ɔmampanin yɛyi no bɛtena akonnwa so wɔ ɔpɛpɔn a ɛtɔ so nson wɔ 2017 mu.
mt0: <pad> Ɔmanpanin a wɔahyɛ no bɛsɔre January 7, 2017</s>

en: GN Health Insurance Company Ltd, one of the 75 companies of Groupe Nduom has begun operating Ambulance Services in Ghana.
twi: GN Health Insurance companyLtd a ɛyɛ Groupe Nduom dwumakuo aduoson num no mu baako ahyɛ ambolans adwuma ase wɔ ɔman Ghana mu.
mt0: <pad> GN Health Insurance Company Ltd, a ɛyɛ Groupe Nduom's 75 nnwumakuw no mu baako, bɛyɛɛ Ambulance Services wɔ Ghana.</s>

en: It is expected to among other tasks offer emergency medical service and administer emergency care to those with acute medical problems.
twi: Wɔrehwɛ sɛ wɔbɛboa ama wɔn a wɔhia ayarehwɛ ntɛm pa ara anya ayarehwɛ a wɔhia no.
mt0: <pad> Ɛsɛ sɛ wɔbɛma emergency medical service ne administer emergency care to those with acute medical problems.</s>

en: The GN Health Ambulance Service shall also provide a 24-hour response to medical and trauma related emergencies and interventions.
twi: GN Health Ambulance Service yi bɛyɛ adwuma dnɔhwere aduonu nan a wɔbɛhwɛ sɛ wɔn a wɔhia ayarehwɛ nsa bɛka wɔn ayarehwɛ.
mt0: <pad> GN Health Ambulance Service no nso bɛma nnipa a wɔwɔ ayaresa ho ne trauma ho ɔhaw ahorow a ɛkɔ so 24 hours no nsa aka.</s>

en: The chairman of GN Health Issah Adam noted “once again the President and CEO of Groupe Nduom, Dr Papa Kwesi Nduom, as well as the Senior Vice President, Mrs Yvonne Nduom and all the Directors are once more setting the pace in terms of providing improved welfare services to employees of the Group”.
twi: ɔtitenani ma GN Health, Issah Adam de too dwa sɛ, “Bio, yɛn panin a ɛyɛ yɛn krakye panin paa ma Groupe Nduom, Dr Papa Kwesi Nduom ne n’abadiakyire Mrs Yvonne Nduom ne kwankyerɛfoɔ a wɔwɔ adwumakuo no mu nyinaa resan ayɛ biribi aboa ama wɔn adwumayɛfoɔ apɔmmɔden nsɛm atu mpɔn.”
mt0: <pad> GN Health chairman Issah Adam noted “once again the President and CEO of Groupe Nduom, Dr Papa Kwesi Nduom, as well as the Senior Vice President, Mrs Yvonne Nduom and all the Directors are setting the pace in terms of providing improved welfare services to employees of the Group”.</s>

en: He told the gathering of health professionals “this marks yet another milestone in the annals of Groupe Nduom. In addition to providing free medical services, they are adding this Ambulance Service to complete the bouquet of Medical Services for the benefit of employees of the group in Greater Accra and Central Regions”.
twi: ɔde too adɔkotafoɔ a na wɔwɔ nhyiamu no anim sɛ, “wei nso yɛ ade kɛseɛ a Groupe Nduom ahyɛ aseɛ. Wɔde ambolans dwumadie yi abɛka ayaresa nhyehyɛeɛ a ɛwɔ hɔ no ho sɛdeɛ ɛbɛboa ama adwumayɛfoɔ a wɔwɔ Greater Accra ne Mfimfini Mantam no ho.”

en: Over 60% of deaths in Ghana, according to available statistics, are as a result of unavailable ambulance service to transport women in labour and accident victims to the appropriate medical facility. Experts believe the conditions leading to deaths can be addressed by appropriate and timely emergency care like what GN Health Ambulance Service seeks to achieve.
twi: Nhwehwɛmu kyerɛ sɛ mmaa a wɔhwere wɔn nkwa sɛ wɔkɔ awoo so anaasɛ wɔfiri mu ɛnam kaa akwanhyia no mu ɔha nkyɛ mu aduosia so gyina sɛ wɔntumi mfa wɔn nkɔ ayaresabea. Animdefoɔ kyerɛ sɛ wɔbɛtumi asi saa adeɛ a ɛma nnipa dodoɔ no ara hwere wɔn nkwa no sɛ wɔbɛyɛ lɔɔre de wɔn akɔ ayaresabea a, na wei na GN Health Ambulance Service pɛ sɛ wɔyɛ.
mt0: <pad> Ghanafoɔ a wɔn ho yɛ hu no mu 60%, sɛ yɛbɛka no, ɛfiri ambulance service a ɛnwɔ hɔ a ɛkɔ mmaa a wɔreyɛ adwuma ne akwanhyia nnipa a wɔn ho yɛ hu no.</s>

en: “GN Health will make sure that we have well trained EMTs (Emergency Medical Technicians) and Ambulance Drivers who are well trained and know exactly what to do in emergency situations.
twi: “GN Health bɛhwɛ sɛ yɛwɔ adɔkotafoɔ a wɔnya nteteeɛ mapa ne adrɔbafoɔ a wɔnim de a sɛ ɔhaw bi fom wɔn mu a, wɔnim deɛ ɛwɔ sɛ wɔyɛ si ɔhaw no ano.”
mt0: <pad> “GN Health bɛma yɛn EMTs (Emergency Medical Technicians) ne Ambulance Driver a wɔwɔ nhomasua a wɔnim sɛ ɛsɛ sɛ wɔyɛ deɛ wɔbɛyɛ wɔ emergency situations.</s>

en: “The Ford 350 ambulances, are well equipped with modern equipment and consumables needed for emergency situations and pre-hospital care to patients. Please take note that these are not just ambulances to provide transport services that cannot provide proper pre-hospital care,” he added.
twi: ɔde kaa ho sɛ, Ford ambolans 350 no wɔ nnoɔma biara a ɛhia sɛ wɔde hwɛ wɔn a wɔhia ayaresa ansa na wɔde wɔn aduru ayaresabea. Monhyɛ no nso sɛ, ɛnyɛ kaa kɛkɛ a ɛde nkorɔfoɔ bɛkɔ ayaresabea a ɛntumi nhwɛ wɔn a wɔhia ayarehwɛ no kɔpem sɛ wɔbɛduru ayaresabea.”
mt0: <pad> “The Ford 350 ambulances, a wɔde ma nnipa no kɔ ayaresabea no mu no, wɔ adeɛ a ɛho hia wɔ emergency situations ne pre-hospital care to patients. Sɛ wobɛkae sɛ ɛnyɛ nnipa no kɔ ayaresabea no mu na wɔde nkitahodie a ɛho hia kɔ ayaresabea no mu no nko ara na mmom ɛyɛ nnipa no kɔ ayaresabea no mu no,” ɔkaa ho.</s>

en: The Ambulances have a more robust set of equipment for pre-hospital care. They are equipped with tools necessary for multiple types of emergencies, from respiratory assistance machines and defibrillators to items as simple as bandages and disinfectant solution.
twi: Ambolans no wɔ akadeɛ biara a ɛhia sɛ wɔde bɛhwɛ obi ansa na waduru ayaresabea. Wɔwɔ akadeɛ a wɔde hwɛ nnoɔma bebree te sɛ wɔn a wɔwɔ home mu haw ne nnoɔm a wɔde papa san nso mia koro.
mt0: <pad> Amɛnman no wɔ adeɛ a ɛyɛ den paa ma ayaresabea kɔɔ. Wɔde nneɛma a ɛho hia ma akwanhyia ahorow, fi respiratory assistance machines ne defibrillators kɔsi adeɛ a ɛyɛ den te sɛ bandages ne disinfectant solution.</s>

en: Government has promised to absorb the costs of treatment for injured victims of Thursday’s gas explosion at La.
twi: Aban no se ɔbɛfa kaa wɔn a wɔpiraa wɔ La atowerɛkyɛm da Yawoada no ho nyinaa.

en: Six people have been confirmed dead in the gas explosion that occurred near the Trade Fair Centre in Accra while over 20 people have sustained various degrees of injuries.

en: The Health Minister Alex Segbefia visiting victims at the La General, Police and 37 Military hospitals where some of the victims were receiving treatment, commended medical officers for their professionalism in caring for the victims.

en: “The president has indicated clearly that all the costs of the burn victims from this incident will be covered by the state, so we’ve made it clear to the management and the Brigadier General-in-charge, the commandant, that they should quickly put together all the logistics and costs of caring for these patients.
twi: “ɔmampanin kyerɛ sɛ ɔman no bɛfa ɛka biara a ɛbɛba wɔ wɔn a wɔpiraa wɔ atowerɛkyɛm yi ho no, nti momma no nto wɔn a wɔda ayaresabea ahodoɔ no ano sɛ wɔmmoammoa ɛka no nyinaa ano.”

en: “As you know with burn victims, there is the need to constantly wash, constantly change dressing, and put them on antibiotics and very strong pain killers, so there is for each patient a cost. en: A gas station near the Ghana International Trade Fair Centre in Accra has exploded with five people burnt to death.
twi: Egya atɔ beaeɛ a wɔtɔn fango a ɛbɛn Ghana International Trade Fair Centre wɔ Accra ama nnipa baanum ahwere wɔn nkwa.
mt0: <pad> Ghana International Trade Fair Centre wɔ Accra no ɛbɛn gas station no exploded, a nnipa baasa na wɔpirae kɔɔwuu.</s>

en: The fire, according to an eyewitness also affected parts of the national exhibition and trade centre.
twi: Wɔn a na wɔwɔ hɔ no kyerɛ sɛ, egya no nso sɛe dwumadie a na ɛrekɔ so wɔ hɔ no.
mt0: <pad> Ɔsɛe no, sɛ ɔkyerɛkyerɛfoɔ kaa no, ɛkaa nnipa bebree kɔɔ exhibition and trade center no mu.</s>

en: According to Veronica Koomson, an ambulance and fire tenders at the scene managed to fight the intense blaze which has sent people running helter-skelter.
twi: Veroniɔa Koomson kyerɛ sɛ, ambolans ne gyadumfoɔ a wɔbaa beaeɛ hɔ boa ma ogya no baa fam.
mt0: <pad> Veronica Koomson kaa sɛ, ambulances ne fire tenders wɔ hɔ no bɔɔ mmɔden sɛ wɔbɛgyina ɔhyew a ɛyɛ den no so a ɛde nkurɔfo kɔɔ helter-skelter.</s>

en: “The fire is blazing and we are doing everything possible to quench it. The Armed Forces fire fighters are here too and doing everything possible to ensure this fire is actually extinguished,” the spokesperson of the Ghana National Fire Service (GNFS) Prince Billy-Anaglatey told Starr News’ Kemini Amanor on Thursday.
twi: Ghana National Fire Service (GNFS) kasamafoɔ, Prince Billy-Anaglatey de too Starr News amannebɔfoɔ Kemini Amanor anim Dawoada no sɛ, “ Yɛrebɔ yɛn ho mmɔden sɛ yɛbɛma egya no aba fam. Armed Forɔes gyadumfoɔ nso wɔ ha sɛ wɔreyɛ deɛ wɔbɛyɛ biara ama egya no adum.”
mt0: <pad> “Asɛe no bɛyɛ ɔhaw na yɛreyɛ biribiara sɛ yɛbɛtumi de asɛe no. Asɛe a wɔde kɔ Ghana nsuo mu no nso bɛyɛ biribiara sɛ wɔbɛtumi de asɛe no,” GNFS spokesman Prince Billy-Anaglatey told Starr News’ Kemini Amanor on Thursday.</s>

en: Koomson said another gas station which is situated near the burning one is likely to go up in flames if the fire fighters do not put up measures to salvage the situation.
twi: Koomson de too dwa sɛ wɔanhɛ annum gya no a, egya nso bɛtɔn beaeɛ a wɔtɔn fango a ɛbɛn baabi a egya atɔ no.
mt0: <pad> Koomson kaa sɛ ɔkwan a wɔde bɔ ogya no mu no betumi asɛe sɛ ɛyɛ a, ɛbɛyɛ sɛ ɛtɔ da a ɛbɛkɔ so sɛ ɛho yɛ hu sɛ ɛhɔ a ɛwɔ ɔkwan a wɔde bɔ ogya no mu no bɛsɛe.</s>

en: However, Billy-Anaglatey said he cannot confirm any casualty, adding “our concern now is to confine the fire” so it does not catch up with the other.”
twi: Billy-Anaglatey kyerɛ sɛ ɔntumi nka sɛ obi foforɔ bi ho aka. Na ɔde kaa ho sɛ, deɛ ɛhia wɔn seisei ne sɛ wɔbɛdum egya no na amma egya antɔ baabi foforɔ.
mt0: <pad> Billy-Anaglatey kaa sɛ ɔbɛtumi aka no sɛ obiara nni hɔ, akɔde sɛ “yɛn asɛm ne sɛ yɛbɛbɔ ɔhyew no mu” na ɛno nti ɛmma ɔhyew no nka ho.</s>

en: The cause of the explosion is not known. There is total blackout at the area as electricity cables also caught fire in the melee.
twi: Wɔnnim deɛ ɛmaa egya no tɔɔ hɔ. Beaeɛ hɔ ayɛ sum kabee ɛsiane sɛ gya no asɛe anyinam kanea a ɛwɔ beaeɛ hɔ nyinaa.
mt0: <pad> Ɔhaw a ɛkɔɔ so no nyɛ yɛnnim. Electricity cables a wɔde bɛka ade no nso bɛtɔɔ ogya wɔ ɔhaw no mu.</s>

en: One person has died in a ghastly accident which occurred last night at Ekumfi Akoti in the Ekumfi district of the Central region.
twi: Onipa baako ahwere ne kwa wɔ kaa akwanhyia a ɛsii nnora anadwo wɔ Ekumfi Akoti a ɛwɔ Ekumfi mansini a ɛwɔ Mfimfini Mantam mu.

en: The deceased, a Nigerian, lost his life when the truck he was driving veered off the road and caught fire.
twi: Nigeriani a wahwere ne kwa yi kaa firii kwan no so na egya tɔɔ ne kaa no mu.
mt0: <pad> Ɔsɛe, Nigerian, piraa ne nkwa bere a ɔde kaa a na ɔrekɔkyerɛ no firii kwan no mu na ɛbɛyɛɛ ogya.</s>

en: The truck which was loaded with Cola was on its way to Nigeria from Mankessim.
twi: Na kɔla na na ɛwɔ kaa yi mu a na ɛfiri Mankessim rekɔ Nigeria.
mt0: <pad> Ɔkwan a na wɔde Cola ayɛ no rekɔ Nigeria firi Mankessim.</s>

en: According to eyewitnesses, the vehicle veered into a nearby bush when the deceased lost control.

mt0: <pad> According to eyewitnesses, the vehicle veered into a nearby bush when the deceased lost control.</s>

en: However, bystanders managed to save two other passengers who were in the vehicle before it caught fire, and burnt the driver to death on the spot.
twi: Wɔn a na wɔwɔ hɔ no bɔɔ wɔn ho mmɔden yii nnipa baanu a na wɔte kaa no mu ansa na egya no retɔ mu ama drɔba no ahwere ne nkwa.

en: The two are currently receiving treatment at the Cape Coast regional hospital.

en: Officers of the Ghana Fire Service later arrived at the scene to control the inferno.

en: The accident brings to two, the number of terrible accidents that have occurred in the area over the last two weeks.

mt0: <pad> Accident no de ɔha bɛyɛ mmienu, sɛdeɛ ɛkɔɔ so wɔ nkuro no mu wɔ awɔw bere a atwam no.</s>

en: A fortnight ago, 15 people died on the same stretch of road in a crash between a Yutong bus and a Sprinter.
twi: Nnawɔtwe mmienu a ɛtwaa mu no, nnipa du-num na wɔhweree wɔn nkwa wɔ saa kwan yi so aberɛ Yutong ne Sprinter bi de bɔɔ mu.

en: Some chiefs in the Ga traditional area have given the Gbese mantse, Nii Ayibonte, a seven-day ultimatum to relinquish his throne.
twi: Ahemfo bi a wɔwɔ Ga traditional mpɔtam no ama Gbese mantse, Nii Ayibonte nnawɔtwe sɛ ɔmfa mfiri akonnwa no so.
mt0: <pad> Ɔman no mu mpanimfoɔ bi wɔ Ga traditional area de Ɔhene Gbese, Nii Ayibonte, a ɛyɛ ɔman no mantse, a nnwɔtwe da ultimatum sɛ ɔbɛgye ne adehye no.</s>

en: The Chiefs are angry with the Gbese Chief over claims he made prior to the 2016 general elections.
twi: Ahemfo yi bo afo Gbese hene yi ɛnam nsɛm a ɔde too dwa ansa na 2016 abatoɔ no rebɛkɔ so.
mt0: <pad> Chiefs no yɛ nkuran ma Gbese Chief no esiane sɛ ɔkaeɛ a ɔde kaeɛ wɔ 2016 general elections no mu.</s>

en: Nii Ayibonte promised to abdicate his throne if president John Mahama loses the presidential election.
twi: Nii Ayibonte hyɛɛ bɔ sɛ ɔmampanin John Mahama di nkukuo a, ɔbɛfiri n’akonnwa no so.
mt0: <pad> Ɔhene Nii Ayibonte ahyɛ ase sɛ ɔbɛgyina ne tumi no so sɛ ɔman panin John Mahama akɔ gyinaeɛ no mu.</s>

en: Nii Ayibonte told his subjects before the election that he had no doubt Mahama would win the election based on the numerous infrastructural projects.
twi: Nii Ayibonte de too n’ahemfo anim sɛ ɔwɔ gyidie sɛ Mahama bɛdi nkonim wɔ abatɔo no mu ɛnam asetanam ahiadeɛ bebree wayɛ nti.
mt0: <pad> Ɔmanpanin Nii Ayibonte kaa ne nkurɔfo no ansa na wɔbɛgyinae no sɛ ɔwɔ nsunsuansoɔ sɛ Mahama bɛgyinae no esiane sɛ ɔyɛɛ adwuma a ɛkɔ so wɔ infrastructure projects no mu.</s>

en: But luck eluded the former Chairman of Accra Hearts of Oak after he gambled with his seat.
twi: Na mmom Accra Heart of Oak titenani dadaa yi ti anyɛ yie aberɛ ɔde n’akonnwa no too atɔprɛ.
mt0: <pad> Nanso ɔhweree nteaseɛ no sɛ ɔbɛgyinaa ne ti no so bere a ɔde ne ti no yɛɛ adwuma wɔ Accra Hearts of Oak.</s>

en: Nii Ayibonte has not whispered a word about what he intends to do after the massive victory of Nana Akufo-Addo.
twi: Nii Ayibonte nkaa hwee faa deɛ ɛbɛyɛ ho aberɛ Nana Akufo-Addo dii nkonim no.
mt0: <pad> Ɔmanpanin Nii Ayibonte nni nsɛm biara a ɔbɛka sɛ ɔbɛyɛ bere a Nana Akufo-Addo nyaa nkonim no.</s>

en: The Ga Chiefs who are demanding he abdicates his throne have also pricked old wounds. They are also challenging his eligibility as the Gbese chief.
twi: Ga ahemfo a wɔrehyɛ no sɛ ɔmfiri akonnwa no so nso wɔn nsɛm hyehyɛ wɔn ho. Wɔkyerɛ sɛ ɔnni ho kwan sɛ ɔdi adeɛ.

en: Two women were killed and more than 12 others injured, after a car lost control on the abandoned Daboya- Busunu road in the Northern region and rammed into a gutter Tuesday evening, police have confirmed.
twi: Apolisifoɔ de ato dwa sɛ, mmaa baanu na wɔhweree wɔn nkwa ɛnna nnipa a wɔboro du-mmienu nso apirapira aberɛ kaa akwanhyia ɛsiiɛ Beenada wɔ Daboya-Busumu kwan no so wɔ Atifi mantam mu.
mt0: <pad> Ɔmanfoɔ mmienu na wɔwui ne nnipa 12 na wɔpiraeɛ, bere a kaa no firi control wɔ Daboya-Busunu road wɔ North Region no na ɛkɔtweeɛ gutter.</s>

en: The car, a mini van had 14 passengers who were being transported to Daboya from Sawla to attend an Islamic wedding ceremony.
twi: Na nnipa du-nan a na wɔrekɔ ayeforɔ na na wɔte kaa na ɛfiri Daboya rekɔ Sawla no mu.
mt0: <pad> Ɔkwan no, a ɛyɛ mini van, na nnipa 14 wɔmu a wɔrekɔ Daboya firi Sawla sɛ wɔbɛkɔ Islamic afahyɛ dwumadie a wɔdekɔ.</s>

en: The West Gonja district police commander ASP Seidu Wemeh said the car with registration number AS 2304-15 upon reaching a community near Daboya suddenly veered off the road and summer saulted into a gutter killing the two instantly .
twi: Polisi panin a ɔwɔ West Gonɛa mansini mu, ASP Seidu Wemeh kyerɛ sɛ kaa a ne nɔɔma yɛ AS 2304-15 duruu Daboya mpɔtam mu no, kaa no kɔhyɛɛ nwura mu na ɛmunimuni maa nnipa baanu no hweree wɔn nkwa amono mu hɔ ara.
mt0: <pad> Ɔsahene West Gonja district ASP Seidu Wemeh kaa no sɛ bere a ɛkɔɔ nkuro a ɛbɛn Daboya no, ɛhyɛɛ asase so na ɛkɔtɔɔ gutter no mu, ɛmaa nnipa mmienu no wui.</s>

en: The deceased were female adults between the ages of 42- 45 respectively.
twi: Mmaa baanu a wɔfirii mu no yɛ mmaa mpaninfoɔ a na wɔadi mfeɛ aduanan mmienu ne aduanan num.
mt0: <pad> Ɔmanfoɔ no nyinaa yɛ mmaa a wɔadi mfeɛ 42- 45.</s>

en: It is still undetermined what caused the crash but according to ASP Seidu, police will technically investigate the mental state of the driver and whether alcohol was involved.
twi: Wɔntumi nhunuu deɛ ɛde akwanhyia yi baeɛ nso ASP Seidu kyerɛ sɛ apolisifoɔ bɛyɛ nhwehwɛmu ahwɛ sɛ na drɔbani no anom nsa anaa.
mt0: <pad> Ɛnyɛ sɛ ɛbɛyɛ a wɔbɛhunuu deɛ ɛkɔɔ so no, nanso ASP Seidu kae sɛ, apolisifoↄ bɛhwɛ sɛ drɔba no nni ne adwene mu ne sɛ nsa a ɛwɔ hɔ no kɔɔ so.</s>

en: He added most of the injured were transported to the regional hospital in Tamale with only one being treated at Damongo.
twi: ɔde kaa ho sɛ wɔde wɔn a na wɔpirapira no kɔɔ mantam no asopiti a ɛwɔ Tamale, na nipa baako pɛ na wɔde no kɔɔ Damongo.

en: Accident on the Daboya-Busunu road are uncommon despite its bad nature.

en: Community members have denied the report saying this is the first time in the year an accident is recorded on the neglected road.

en: The Minister of Energy, Dr Matthew Opoku Prempeh, has said the Government is working towards boosting Ghana's industrialisation with clean and reliable energy systems, such as nuclear and renewables.
twi: ɔsoafoɔ a ɔhwɛ ogyahoɔden so, Dr. Matthew Opoku Prempeh de ato dwa sɛ aban no reyɛ deɛ ɛwɔ sɛ ɔyɛ biara sɛdeɛ mfididwuma a ɛwɔ Ghana anya anyinam kanea de ayɛ wɔn nnwuma na wɔatu mpɔn.
mt0: <pad> Ghana Energy Minister Dr Matthew Opoku Prempeh, has said the Government is working towards boosting Ghana's industrialisation with clean and reliable energy systems, such as nuclear and renewables.</s>

en: He said there was a growing consensus that nuclear energy had an important role in decarbonising electricity generation for accelerated industrial development.
twi: ɔde too dwa sɛ nnipa dodoɔ no ara gye tom sɛ owiagyahoɔden ho hia sɛdeɛ ɛbɛyɛ a mfididwuma bɛtu mpɔn.
mt0: <pad> Ɔkaeɛ sɛ nuclear energy no bɛyɛ adwuma a ɛho hia wɔ decarbonising electricity generation sɛ ɛbɛboa ama nnɔnhweree kɔkɔɔ akɔ so.</s>

en: “While renewable energy sources are expected to continue to grow significantly, nuclear power, an important part of today’s clear energy, is also the largest source of lower-carbon electricity generation in advanced economies, providing approximately 40 percent of all low carbon generations,” he said.
twi: ɔde kaa sɛ, “Owiagyahoɔden yɛ anyinam ahoɔden a ɛmma kaabɔn a ɛho hia pa ara, na ɛno na aman a wɔakɔ wɔn anim no de di dwuma wɔ wɔn man mu a ɛreboa ma wɔn sikasɛm kɔ soro.”
mt0: <pad> nuclear power, a ɛyɛ adeɛ a ɛho hia paa no, yɛ adeɛ a ɛho hia paa wɔ nnɛ a ɛbɛkɔ so akɔ anim, nanso ɛyɛ adeɛ a ɛma lower-carbon electricity generation wɔ advanced economies, ɛma bɛyɛ 40% a ɛwɔ low carbon generations no mu,” ɔkaeɛ.</s>

en: He referred to an International Energy Agency report on clean energy system asserting that without nuclear investment, achieving a sustainable energy system would be much harder with implications to emissions, cost and energy security.
twi: ɔgyinaa International Energy Agency nhwehwɛmu a ɛfa anyinam ahoɔden mapa so de too dwa sɛ, sɛ wɔmfa sika ahyɛ owiagyahoɔden mu a, ɛbɛyɛ den sɛ wɔbɛnya anyinam ahoɔden mapa a ɛso nsunsuansoɔ no nyɛ papa.
mt0: <pad> Ɔkaa sɛ International Energy Agency report a ɛfa clean energy system no ho kyerɛɛ sɛ sɛ nuclear investment nni hɔ a, ɛbɛyɛ den sɛ yɛbɛnya sustainable energy system a ɛbɛyɛ den a ɛbɛyɛ den sɛ yɛbɛnya emissions, cost ne energy security.</s>

en: Dr Opoku Prempeh stated this, in a speech read on his behalf, at a Stakeholders Forum on Ghana’s Nuclear Power Programme in Accra.

en: The affixing of tax stamps on alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages has grown exponentially since its introduction about four years ago.
twi: Mfeɛ nan akyi a wɔde ɛtoɔ nhyɛnso a wɔde tare nsa a ɛborɔ ne deɛ ɛmmorɔ ho baeɛ no, saa nhyehyɛeɛ yi akɔ n’anim yie.
mt0: <pad> Ɛfiri sɛ wɔde tax stamps ayɛ wɔ alcoholic ne non-alcoholic beverages no mu no, ɛkɔɔ so exponentially ɛfiri sɛ wɔde too gua afei bɛyɛ mfeɛ nnan a atwam no.</s>

en: From an initial 28.5 million tax stams affixed in 2018, the number increased to 38.5 million the following year and 70.2 million in 2020, with managers of the project projecting to affix some 90 million stamps in 2021.
twi: Ahyɛaseɛ no wɔde ahyɛnso ɔpepem 28.5 na ɛfamm nnoɔma hɔ; nɔɔma no kɔɔ 38.5 wɔ afe a ɛdi anim no; ɛkɔɔ 70.2 wɔ 2020 mu, na wɔn a wɔda dwumadie yi ano kyerɛ sɛ wɔde ahyɛnso ɔpepem aduonkron na ɛbɛdi dwuma wɔ 2021 mu.
mt0: <pad> Ɔkwan a wɔde bɛka sɛ ɔyɛɛ 28.5 million tax stamps affixed in 2018, na ɔkɔɔ so kɔɔ 38.5 million the following year and 70.2 million in 2020, with project managers predicting to affix 90 million stamps in 2021.</s>

en: The Ghana Revenue Authority (GRA) said it was also engaging the Food and Beverages Association of Ghana (FABAG) and local manufacturers to pay for the affixing of the stamps on their beverage products at the stamping facilities.
twi: Ghana Revenue Authority (GRA) se wɔne Food and Beverages Associationof Ghana (FABAG) ne adwumakuo ahodoɔ ɛrekasa sɛ wɔntua sika a ɛwɔ sɛ wɔtua na wɔde ahyɛnso no bɔ wɔn nsa ho.
mt0: <pad> Ghana Revenue Authority (GRA) kaa sɛ wɔrekɔgyina Food and Beverages Association of Ghana (FABAG) ne Ghanafoɔ a wɔyɛ nsa ade no so sɛ wɔbɛtua sika a wɔde kyerɛw nsuo nsa a wɔde di dwuma no so wɔ stamping facilities.</s>

en: The Ghanaian printing company, Buck Press, and its partner, DelaRue, a British security printing company, are responsible for printing the tax stamps on behalf of the GRA, while Streamline Resources, which is located at the Tema Port, assists companies without the technical capacity to fix the stamps on individual products.
twi: Buɔk Press, adwumakuo a ɛyɛ prenten adwumakuo wɔ Ghana ne DelaRue a ɛyɛ British sikiriti kɔmpɛne na wɔreprete ahyɛnso no ma GRA, ɛnna Streamline Resourɔes a ɛwɔ Tema Port nso reboa kɔmpanes ahodoɔ a wɔne mfidie a ɛde ahyɛnso no bɛtaretare wɔn nsa no ho.

en: The Project Manager of Excise Tax Stamp at the GRA, Mr Kwabena Apau Awuah Anto, who disclosed this, said the move would reduce the incidence of product fraud and piracy, where importers and manufacturers applied for the stamps for specific products but affixed them on pirated products that had no approval and safety certification from the Food and Drugs Authority (FDA).

en: Speaking during a tour of the tax stamp facilities at the Tema Port by a team from the Graphic Communications Group Limited (GCGL) last Thursday, Mr Anto noted that the Commissioner General of the GRA had already granted authorisation to some 34 large importers and manufacturers, including Guinness Ghana Limited and the Coca-Cola Bottling Company, to undertake the affixing of the stamps at their factories at their own cost.

en: The team was in Tema to have firsthand appreciation of progress of the excise tax stamp policy and also explore collaboration with the GRA on how to further advance the initiative.

en: Mr Anto said the excise stamp policy would reduce product fraud and ensure that only wholesome products were allowed into the market space to ensure public health and safety..
twi: Mr Anto de too twa sɛ ahyɛnso toɔ nhyehyɛeɛ no bɛma apoobɔ a ɛkɔ so nnoɔmatɔ ho akɔ fam na aboa ama nnoɔma papa nko ara aba dwaman no, na ama ɔman no mu nnipa apɔmmuden nso awie pɛyɛ.

en: Similarly, he said, the policy would ensure revenue assurance and further level the playing field for importers and manufacturers to compete fairly on the market through the payment of appropriate taxes.

en: Mr Anto said: “What we do here at the Tema facilities and 13 other stations across the country where we have affixing facilities is at no cost to importers.”
twi: Mr Anto de too dwa sɛ, “Dwumadie a yɛdi no wɔ Tema ha ne mmeaeɛ du mmiɛnsa a ɛwɔ ɔman no mu no a yɛde ahyɛnso taretare nnoɔma ho no, yɛnnye wɔn a wɔkra nnoɔma ba nnoɔma no mu sika.”
mt0: <pad> Mr Anto kaa sɛ: "Deɛ yɛyɛ wɔ Tema ne 13 station a yɛwɔ affixing facilities no mu no, ɛno nyɛ den ma importers.</s>

en: Operating the facilities, he said, came with headline costs such as the procurement of the stamps, utility, labour, operational cost and materials such as shrink wraps
twi: ɛka a wɔbɔ wɔn dwuma no ho bi ne sika a wɔde tɔ ahyɛnso no, sika a wɔde tua adwumayɛfoɔ no ka ne akadeɛ nso ho ka.
mt0: <pad> Ɔkaa sɛ, ɔde sika bɛyɛ ɔpepem nnum na ɛkɔɔ so wɔ adehye no mu, sɛ ɔde stamps, utility, labour, operational cost and materials sɛ shrink wraps.</s>

en: He indicated that when the project took off in 2018, the government decided to give a six-month window to supply the stamps for free, but that had continued till date, hence the Commissioner General's directive for the stakeholders to be engaged and sensitised to the need for them to pay.
twi: ɔkyerɛ sɛ berɛ dwumadie yi hyɛɛ aseɛ wɔ 2018 no, aban yɛɛ sɛ obiara ntua hwee wɔ ahyɛnso no ho na saa toaa so bɛsi nnɛ. Wei nti na Kɔmisa panin de nhyehyɛeɛ sɛ wɔnhyia ɔman no na wɔkyerɛ wɔ sɛnti a ɛwɔ sɛ wɔtua ahyɛnso no sika no.
mt0: <pad> Ɔkaa sɛ wɔn a wɔwɔ adwuma no mu no, wɔde ɔkwan ma wɔn a wɔbɛtwerɛ sika kɔkɔɔ no yɛ ade a wɔn ho hia nanso ɛkɔɔ so kosii nnɛ, nti ɔhyɛɛ aseɛ sɛ ɔkyerɛɛ sɛ ɛsɛ sɛ nnipa a wɔwɔ adwuma no mu no bɛyɛ adwene ne sɛ ɛsɛ sɛ wɔtua sika kɔkɔɔ no.</s>

en: The engagements, Mr Anto said, would determine whether the GRA would charge the full cost or there would be cost sharing between it and the stakeholders.
twi: Mr Anto kyerɛ sɛ nhyiamudie yi bɛkyerɛ sɛ GRA bɛma ɔman no nnipa bɛtua sika no nyinaa anaasɛ wɔne ɔman no mu nnipa no bɛkyɛ ka no atua.

en: “In countries such as Kenya, importers pay for the stamps or they get the products stamped at the point of export.
twi: Aman bi te Kenya mu no, wɔn a wɔkra nnoɔma no tua ahyɛnso no ka anaasɛ wɔmma wɔde ahyɛnso no fam wɔn nnoɔma no ho ansa na abɛduru ɔman no mu.
mt0: <pad> “Wɔ aman te sɛ Kenya no, importers no na wɔtua stamps no anaa wɔnya nneɛma no stamped wɔ export point no.</s>

en: Ghana's policy on the tax stamp policy places the responsibility on the affected excise product on the importer or the manufacturer.
twi: Ghana ahyɛnso toɔ nhyehyɛeɛ no de asodie no to deɛ wɔrekra nnoɔma no reba no so anaasɛ adwumakuo no so.
mt0: <pad> Ghana's tax stamp policy places the responsibility on the affected excise product on the importer or the manufacturer.</s>

en: In many countries where similar policies are implemented, manufacturers have affixing facilities at their production units,” Mr Anto said.
twi: Aman ahodoɔ a saa wɔdi saa nhyehyɛeɛ yi nso di dwuma no mu no, adwumakuo ahodoɔ no ara na wɔde ahyɛnso no tare wɔn nnoɔma ho.
mt0: <pad> Ɔkaa sɛ, "wɔ aman pii a saa mmara no wɔ hɔ no, nnipa a wɔyɛ ade no wɔ affixing facilities wɔ wɔn production units," Mr Anto kaa.</s>

en: On the recent challenges that saw delays and congestion at the facility, which led to an outcry among importers, Mr Anto explained that the Tema facilities were not meant for large volume importers but for people who only imported occasionally.
twi: Mr Anto kyerɛɛ n’adwene faa ɔhaw a na Tema beaeɛ no rekɔ mu sɛ wɔntumi mfa ahyɛnso no mma berɛ ano berɛ ano. ɔde too dwa sɛ, Tema hɔ deɛ, dwumadie a wɔdi no kɔma wɔn a mmerɛ bi wɔ hɔ na wɔkra nnoɔma na mmom wɔanyɛ ama wɔn a daa ne daa nyinaa na wɔrekra nnoɔma no.
mt0: <pad> Ɛho nhyehyɛe a ɛkɔɔ so no mu a ɛde delays ne congestion bɛkɔɔ so, a ɛmaa importers nsɛe wɔn ho, Mr Anto kyerɛɛ sɛ Tema adehye no ɛnyɛ nnipa a wɔde nnuru bɛbaa hɔ no nanso nnipa a wɔde nnuru bɛbaa hɔ no.</s>

en: However, he said, large volume importers, in their attempt to avoid associated costs that came with the affixing, often sent their products to the facilities for stamping, a situation which resulted in congestion and delays.
twi: Bio, ɔde toaa so sɛ, wɔn a wɔkra nnoɔma dodoɔ no mpɛ sɛ wɔbɔ ka foforɔ biara bio nti wɔde wɔn nnoɔma kɔ Tema beaeɛ hɔ sɛ wɔmfa ahyɛnso no mmɔ wɔn nnoɔma ho, na wei na ɛmaa nnoɔma twetwɛn ase kakra.
mt0: <pad> Nanso, ɔkaeɛ, importers a wɔde nnuru bɛboro ɔpepem no, wɔn ɔpɛ sɛ wɔbɛgye sika a ɛkɔɔ so a ɛwɔ affixing no ho no, de wɔn ade kɔɔ mmeae a wɔde yɛ nnubɔne no sɛ wɔbɛtwerɛ, a ɛmaa ɛhyɛɛ nsuo mu ne mmerɛ mu.</s>

en: Similarly, challenges with the stamps after a change in the service provider also resulted in some delays, he noted.
twi: Sɛ wɔn a wɔma wɔn ahyɛnso no nso nsesa a, ɛma nnoɔma twetwɛn ase.
mt0: <pad> Ɛno nti, ɔde nsɛm a wɔde kyerɛw no kɔɔ so no kɔɔ so a, ɛho nso yɛɛ den, ɔkaeɛ.</s>

en: However, engineers worked on the machines to be able to pick the new stamps.
twi: Engyiniafoɔ siesiee mfidie no maa ɛmaa kwan maa wɔyɛɛ ahyɛnso no ho adwuma.
mt0: <pad> Nanso, engineers yɛɛ adwuma wɔ kɔmputa no so sɛ ɛbɛtumi anya nwoma a ɛbɛtumi anya stamps a ɛyɛ foforo no.</s>

en: In his remarks, Mr Asmah called on the GRA to intensify education on policies that were periodically introduced into the trade space.
twi: Ne nsɛnkaeɛ mu no, Mr Asmah de too GRA anim sɛ wɔmma wɔn nhyehyɛeɛ no ho dawubɔ nkɔ n’anim.
mt0: <pad> Ɔkaa no, Asmah de n'ano kyerɛɛ GRA sɛ ɛbɛyɛ papa sɛ wɔbɛkyerɛ adeɛ a wɔde kɔɔ so wɔ ahiadeɛ mu.</s>

en: Tax education, he said, was important, since it would ensure compliance at all levels and also ensure that people did not short-change the system.
twi: ɔde too dwa sɛ, ɛtoɔ ho dawubɔ ho hia ɛsiane sɛ ɛbɛboa ama nnipa a wɔwɔ ɔman no mu nyinaa adi nhyehyɛeɛ no so, na afei nso ɛbɛboa ama nnipa nkwati nhyehyɛeɛ no.
mt0: <pad> Tax education, ɔkaeɛ, na ɛho hia, esiane sɛ ɛbɛma wɔn ayɛ ade wɔ ɔkwan biara so na ɛbɛma nkurɔfoɔ nso anya tumi sɛ wɔbɛyɛ ade wɔ ɔkwan biara so.</s>

en: He commended officials of the GRA and the service provider, Streamline Resources, for taking steps to address the challenges.
twi: ɔbɔɔ GRA ne Streamline Resourɔes mpaninfoɔ aba sɛ wɔde nhyehyɛeɛ guu akwan mu sɔɔ ɔhaw no ano.

en: The GCGL, he said, would collaborate with the GRA to scale up its sensitisation efforts, having had an insight into the operations of the excise tax stamp policy.
twi: ɛsiane sɛ wɔahunu sɛdeɛ ahyɛnso toɔ nhyehyɛeɛ bɛsi adi dwuma asi afa nti, ɔde too dwa sɛ GɔGL ne GRA bɛka wɔn ho abɔm aboa ma nhyehyɛeɛ no ho dawurobɔ akɔ n’anim.
mt0: <pad> GCGL no, ɔkaeɛ, bɛkɔ so ayɛ adwuma ne GRA no sɛ ɛbɛyɛ adeɛ a wɔde bɛkyerɛ nnipa a wɔwɔ ahiadeɛ ho no, ɛfiri sɛ ɔnyaa nimdeɛ a ɛfa excise tax stamp policy no ho.</s>

en: “I believe this is the right time for the GCGL and the GRA to deepen collaboration for the purpose of public sensitisation, so that we can get a buy-in from the public,” Mr Asmah said.
twi: Mr Asmah de too dwa sɛ, “Megye di sɛ mmerɛ no ara nie sɛ GɔGL ne GRA ka wɔn ho bɔm boa ma nhyehyɛeɛ hi ho dawubɔ kɔ nkan sɛdeɛ ɛbɛyɛ a amansan bɛte nhyehyɛeɛ yi ase.”

en: The Institute of Energy Security (IES) has said prices of fuel will appreciate marginally at the pumps. A statement issued by IES indicated that the price of fuel on the local market increased within the window under review.
twi: Institute of Energy Security (IES) kyerɛ sɛ fango boɔ bɛkɔ soro kakra. IES asɛm a wɔde too dwa yi kyerɛ sɛ wɔbɛtoto fango boɔ wɔ dwaman so.

en: Within the first pricing window of June 2021, majority of the oil marketing companies (OMCs) increased their prices of petroleum products by 3% at the pump. Based on this increase, the current national average price of fuel per litre at the pump is pegged at GHS5.97 for both gasoline and gasoil.
twi: Mmerɛ a wɔdii kan toto fango boɔ mu Kɔtɔnima mu wɔ 2021 mu no, Oil Marketing ɔompanies (OMɔsɔ too fango boɔ no mu ɔha nkyɛ mu mmiɛnsa (3%ɔ. Ne saa nti mprɛnprɛn yi wɔtɔ fango galɔn baako GH¢5.97. Sei ara na wɔtɔn gasoline ne gasoil.

en: For this pricing window, Zen Petroleum, Benab Oil, Cash Oil, Goodness Oil, Top Oil and Frimps Oil sold the least-priced fuel on the local market, according to IES’ market scan.

en: For the window under assessment, international benchmark Brent crude price averaged $73.98 per barrel, representing a 4.05% increase from the previous window's average price of $71.10 per barrel.

en: This window’s increase in price has been largely in response to the rise in COVID-19 cases propelled by the Delta variant in parts of Europe and amid warnings of a dense outbreak in the United States.
twi: ɛnam sɛ wɔn a wɔanya COVID-19 Europe akɔ soro, na yareɛ no ate atese wɔ United States nti na ama fango boɔ a akɔ soro.

en: For the first time in two years, the price of Brent reached the $75-mark at the end of the pricing window. The global crude demand is rebounding as the summer driving season begins and economies reopen from restrictions in mobility.
twi: Mmerɛ a ɛdi kan wɔ mfeɛ mmienu no mu ni a Brent buo aduro $75 ni. ɛnam sɛ yɛwura samma mu na afei nso ɛsiane sɛ wɔama kwan sɛ obiara tumi tu kwan baabi biara wɔpɛ nti, sɛdeɛ wɔde fango gyeeɛ wɔ wiase nyinaa rekɔ soro.

en: This is particularly the case, as road and airline travel continue to increase.

en: South Africa has been added to Nigeria’s ‘red list’ of countries for arriving passengers. Nigeria took the decision because of the covid19 Delta variant in South Africa.
