en: Zimbabwe and other northern African countries, including Botswana, say they want the International Convention on the Trade in Endagered to allow them to sell their elephants as the number of animals has increased, which has led to a number of problems, including human and animal poaching.
twi: Zimbabwe ne aman bi a ɛwɔ Abibirem atifi fam a Botswana ka bi ho no bi kyerɛ sɛ, wɔpɛ sɛ International ɔonvention on the Trade wɔ Endagered ma wɔn kwan ma wɔtɔn wɔn asono no berɛ wɔn nɔɔma rekɔ n’anim no. Saa adeɛ yi de ɔhaw bebree na aba mmoa ne nnipa ahobammɔ so.
mt0: <pad> Zimbabwe ne aman a ɛwɔ Northern Africa, te sɛ Botswana, ka sɛ wɔpɛ sɛ International Convention on the Trade in Endangered mmoa no bɛyɛ adwuma wɔn elephants esiane sɛ ɔman no mu mmoa no bɛkɔɔ so, a ɛde ɔhaw ahorow bae, te sɛ nnipa ne mmoa poaching.</s>

en: Thirty-three people have been killed by the animals of the organization this year alone.
twi: Afe yi mu nko ara, mmoa yi akum nnipa aduasa mmiɛnsa.
mt0: <pad> Ɔman no mmoa a wɔde di dwuma no ayɛ nnipa 33 wɔ afe yi mu.</s>

en: At a CITES summit in Geneva, Switzerland in August, the organization rejected a call for the lifting of the ban on the sale of elephants and their ivory.
twi: ɔITES nhyiamu a ɛkɔɔ so wɔ Geneva, Switzerland man no mu wɔ ɔsanaa bosome mu no, ekuo no ampene so sɛ wɔnyi tabono a ɛda ɛsono ne asommɛn so no mfiri hɔ.
mt0: <pad> Wɔ CITES summit wɔ Geneva, Switzerland wɔ August no, kuo no deɛ ɛnnim sɛ ɛbɛyɛ papa sɛ wɔbɛgye nkraman ne wɔn ivory a wɔde kɔtɔn no ho.</s>

en: The head of the Safari Operators Association of Zimbabwe, Emmanuel Fundira, said it was important for CITES and animal rights activists to understand the problems facing Zimbabwe and other countries due to the high number of elephants in these countries.
twi: ɔpanin a ɔda Safari Operators associationof Zimbabwe ano, Emmanuel Fundira de too dwa sɛ ɛho bɛhia sɛ ɔITES ne wɔn a wɔpere mmoa yiedie ho bɛhunu haw ahodoɔ a asono bebree yi de aba Zimbabwe ne aman afoforɔ.
mt0: <pad> Zimbabwe Safari Operators Association, Emmanuel Fundira, said it was important for CITES and animal rights activists to understand the problems facing Zimbabwe and other countries due to the high number of elephants in these countries.</s>

en: The Minister of Climate and Tourism, Nqobizitha Ndlovu, told Studio 7 that the government is trying its best to work with other countries to give CITES a new perspective.
twi: ɔsoafoɔ a ɔhwɛ wiem sakraeɛ ne nsrahwɛ soɔ, Nqobizitha Ndlovu kaa wɔ Studio 7 kasafidie so sɛ, aban no ɛrebɔ ne ho mmɔden sɛ ɔne aman foforɔ bɛka abom na wɔaboa ɔITES.
mt0: <pad> Ɔmanpanin a ɔhwɛ Climate ne Tourism, Nqobizitha Ndlovu, kae Studio 7 sɛ ɔmanpanin no reyɛ ne ho mmɔden sɛ ɔbɛdi dwuma ne aman afoforɔ so sɛ ɛbɛma CITES nkɔanim a ɛbɛyɛ adeɛ a ɛho hia.</s>

en: But they also said they could take a move called reservation which allows them to export elephants to other CITES countries that have taken the same step.
twi: Na wɔsan nso kaa sɛ wɔbɛtumi de nhyehyɛeɛ agu akwan mu de asono no akɔ ɔITES aman foforɔ so.
mt0: <pad> Nanso wɔkaa sɛ wɔbɛtumi de nsuo ayɛ ɔman no mu a wɔde kɔ CITES aman a wɔwɔ saa kwan no so.</s>

en: Hwange National Park opened in 1928 and is the largest national park in the country.
twi: wɔbuee Hwange National Park wɔ afe 1928 mu na ɛno na ɛno na ɛyɛ kɛseɛ pa ara wɔ ɔman no mu.
mt0: <pad> Hwange National Park ayɛɛ asɔredan wɔ 1928 na ɛyɛ asɔredan a ɛyɛ kɛse paa wɔ ɔman no mu.</s>

en: The organization is over 14,000 square miles [14,000 sq km] and at its inception was estimated to have only about 2,000 elephants.
twi: Mmoa no tenabea no tenten boro kwansima mpem du-nan ɛ14,000 sq kmɔ na asono 2000 na wɔdi hyɛɛ aseɛ.
mt0: <pad> Ɔman no yɛ 14,000 square miles [14,000 sq km] na wɔ bere a wɔfii ase no wɔkaeɛ sɛ ɛwɔ elephants bɛyɛ 2,000.</s>

en: The General Secretary of the Footballers Union of Zimbabwe, FUZ, Paul Gundani, died in Kwekwe on Wednesday afternoon after a short illness.
twi: ɔtwerɛtwerɛfoɔ panin ma Footballers Union of Zimbabwe, FUZ, Paul Gundani wui wɔ Kwekwe Wukuada no awia. Yareɛ bɔɔ no mmerɛ tiawa bi mu.
mt0: <pad> Paul Gundani, General Secretary of the Footballers Union of Zimbabwe, FUZ, died in Kwekwe on Wednesday afternoon after a short illness.</s>

en: But it is still unknown how things turned out.
twi: Bɛsi nnɛ, wɔnnya nhunuu kwan korɔ pɔtee a owuo no baeɛ.
mt0: <pad> Ɛnyɛ sɛ yɛnim sɛ adeɛ no bɛkɔɔ so.</s>

en: According to FUZ, Gundani died at Topomasi Private Hospital in Kwekwe.
twi: FUZ de ato dwa sɛ, Gundani wui wɔ Topomasi Private Hospital a ɛwɔ Kwekwe.
mt0: <pad> According to FUZ, Gundani died at Topomasi Private Hospital in Kwekwe.</s>

en: The club also says their absence has left a large gap that will be difficult to close as they have a passion for helping football players.
twi: Bɔɔlɔbɔ kuo yi se, tokuro kɛseɛ na abɛtɔ hɔ ɛnam owui na ɛbɛyɛ den sɛ biribiara bɛsi ne dadaa mu ɛfiri sɛ na wɔde akoma pa boa bɔɔlobɔfoɔ no.
mt0: <pad> Ɔman no kaa sɛ wɔn absence no ama ɔhaw kɛse a ɛbɛyɛ den sɛ wɔbɛbɔ ase sɛ wɔwɔ ɔpɛ sɛ wɔboa akansifoɔ a wɔrekɔ adie.</s>

en: Gundani, who previously played for Zisco Steel, also played for the Young Warriors, and played for the Warriors at a time when the team was known as the "Dream Team" under the tutelage of the late Reinard Fabisch.
twi: Gundani a ɔbɔɔ bɔɔlo maa Zisɔo Steel a ɔsan kɔbɔ maa Young Warriors, na ɔtoaa so kɔbɔ maaWarriors mmerɛ na wɔfrɛ wɔn “Dream Team” a na Reinard Fabisɔh na ɔyɛ koogyi.
mt0: <pad> Gundani, a na ɔdi Zisco Steel no, nso dii Young Warriors no ne Warriors no wɔ bere a wɔfrɛɛ wɔn "Dream Team" no ase Reinard Fabisch.</s>

en: FUZ media officer Marlene Gadzirayi said she was shocked to hear that Gundani had passed away.
twi: FUZ dawubɔ ɔfesa, Marlene Gadzirayi de too dwa sɛ ɛyɛɛ no nwanwa berɛ ɔtee sɛ Gundani aka baabi.
mt0: <pad> Ɔmanpanin Marlene Gadzirayi kaa sɛ ɔyɛɛ nwanwa sɛ ɔhunuu Gundani na ɔkɔɔ so.</s>

en: "I am very sad as I spoke to them yesterday and we were already planning how to proceed. But I heard today that they are missing but at this stage I do not know what Mr Gundani ate," Ms Gadzirayi told Studio7.
twi: Ms Gadzirayi de too Studio 7 anim sɛ, “Mede awerɛhoɔ na ɛne wɔn kae nnora berɛ a na yɛrefa adwene wɔ kwan a yɛbɛfa so atoa so. Nso, metee no nnɛ sɛ wɔayera nanso seisei deɛ mennim deɛ Owura Gundani diiɛ.”
mt0: <pad> 'Me ho dwiriw me sɛ me ne wɔn kaa no bɛyɛ adeɛ a yɛbɛkɔ so. Nanso ɛnnɛ mɛte sɛ wɔn nni hɔ nanso ɛnnɛ mɛnim sɛ Ɔsahene Gundani ate adeɛ a ɔde kɔɔ so.'</s>

en: Ms Gadzirayi says the country has lost a great football hero. Ms Gadzirayi also said there were no plans for Mr Gundani's funeral as he was waiting to hear from his family when he would be laid to rest.
twi: Awuraa Gadzirayi se ɔman no ahwere bɔɔlɔbɔ mu okunini pa ara. Awuraa Gadzirayi toaa so bio sɛ, ɔntee hwee mfaa Owura Gundani ayie hɔ na ɔretwɛn sɛ ɔbɛte berɛ wɔbɛsie no afiri abusuafoɔ no hɔ.
mt0: <pad> Ms Gadzirayi kaa sɛ ɔman no ayi nnipa a wɔyɛ football a ɔdi kan.</s>

en: The Zimbabwe Football Association (ZIFA) has announced on its website that it is saddened by Gundani's death and will stand by the family in all his funeral arrangements.
twi: Zimbabwe Football association(ZIFAɔ de ato dwa wɔ wɔn ntentan mfidie so sɛ, Gundani wuo no yɛ wɔn awerɛho na wɔbɛgyina abusua no akyi wɔ ayie ntotoeɛ nyinaa mu.
mt0: <pad> Zimbabwe Football Association (ZIFA) no de too gua wɔ ne websaet so sɛ ɛno yɛ ɔhaw ma Gundani's death na ɛbɛgyina ne abusua no ho wɔ n'abammɔ nniso no mu.</s>

en: ZIFA communications officer Xolisani Gwesele said Gundani's death was a national tragedy and it would be difficult to find a man with a passion for football.
twi: ZIFA Communications adwumayɛni Xolisani Gwesele kaa sɛ Gundani wuo yɛ ɔman no nyinaa awerɛhosɛm na ɛbɛyɛ den sɛ wɔbɛnya nipa a ɔwɔ ɔdɔ ma bɔɔlobɔ t sɛ ɔno.
mt0: <pad> Ɔman no mu ɔhaw na Gundani wuo no yɛ ɔhaw a ɛbɛyɛ den sɛ wobɛnya nnipa a ɔwɔ football ho ɔdwene te sɛ Gundani.</s>

en: "Peace be upon you Paul Gundani," Gwesela wrote on the ZIFA website.
twi: Gwesela twerɛɛ wɔ ZIFA ntentan mfidie no sɛ, “Asomdwoeɛ nka Paul Gundani”.
mt0: <pad> 'Peace be upon you Paul Gundani', Gwesela wrote on the ZIFA website.</s>

en: Former President Robert Mugabe's body could not be flown to his home in Zvimba today as his wife, Grace Mugabe, has fallen ill.
twi: Wɔantumi amfa ɔmampanin dadaa Robert Mugabe amu no ankɔ ne fie a ɛwɔ Zyimba; ɛne sɛ ne yere Grace Mugabe ayare.
mt0: <pad> Ɔman panin Robert Mugabe no nkwa antumi ankɔ ne fie wɔ Zvimba ɛnnɛ esiane sɛ ne nsa, Grace Mugabe, a ɔyɛ ɔman panin no, abɛyɛ yare.</s>

en: Some relatives say the body is due to arrive in Zvimba on Monday.
twi: Abusuafoɔ no mu bi se amu no bɛba abɛduru Zyimba Dwoada.
mt0: <pad> Relatives says the body is due to arrive in Zvimba on Monday.</s>

en: As many as 1,000 people have been waiting for President Mugabe's body for a day in Zvimba this afternoon.
twi: Nnipa apem na wɔretwɛn ɔmampanin Mugabe amu no nnɛ wɔ Zyimba awia yi.
mt0: <pad> Ɔmanfoɔ bɛyɛ 1,000 na wɔatwɛn President Mugabe's body abɛduru da wɔ Zvimba no anadwo yi.</s>

en: A spokesman for the Mugabe family, who is also the grandson of the deceased, Leo Mugabe, said Mugabe's body could not be found today for reasons he said he did not know as he had just been sent by King Zvimba.
twi: ɔkasamafoɔ ma Mugabe abusua no a ɔyɛ Mugabe nana, Leo Mugabe de too dwa sɛ, wɔahu Mugabe amu no nnɛ na ɔnnim deɛ nti a ɛfiri sɛ King Zyimba asoma no.
mt0: <pad> Ɔkaeɛ a ɔyɛ Mugabe abusuakuo no, Leo Mugabe, kaeɛ sɛ Mugabe's body ntumi nkɔ hɔ ɛnnɛ esiane nsunsuansoɔ a ɔnim sɛ ɔde ne nsa aka a King Zvimba de no.</s>

en: Leo Mugabe said the body would arrive home early in the morning.
twi: Leo Mugabe kaa sɛ amu no bɛba fie anɔpa tutuutu.
mt0: <pad> Leo Mugabe kaa sɛ ɔde n'ani bɛkyerɛ sɛ ɔbɛba akɔ ɔman no mu ntɛm anadwo.</s>

en: But King Katizagombo, also known as Gibson Jenami, said the body would not return to Zvimba as expected since Ms Grace Mugabe was ill.
twi: Nanso ɔhene Katizagombo a wɔsan nso frɛ no Gibson ɛenami nso kyerɛ sɛ amu no mma Zyimba sɛdeɛ wɔrehwehwɛ no ɛfiri sɛ na Owurayere Grace Mugabe yare.
mt0: <pad> Ɛnnim, nanso King Katizagombo, a ɔsan frɛ no Gibson Jenami, kaa sɛ ade no bɛkɔ Zimba sɛ wɔde hwɛɛ no esiane sɛ Grace Mugabe yɛ yare.</s>

en: King Katizagombo also said the body will be in the hands of the government until the day it is laid to rest.
twi: ɔhene Katizogombo kaa bioi sɛ, amu no bɛwɔ aban no hɔ kɔpem ɛda a wɔbɛsie no.
mt0: <pad> King Katizagombo nso kaa sɛ ɔman no bɛgye ne nkwa kɔsi bere a wɔde ne nkae no bɛkyerɛ mu.</s>

en: But this contradicts Leo Mugabe, who said Mugabe's body would be kept by his family until a high-level grave was completed.
twi: Nanso wei ne deɛ Leo Mugabe kaeɛ sɛ Mugabe amu no bɛwɔ n’abusuafoɔ kɔpem sɛ wɔbɛwie amena a ɛsom bo a wɔbɛsie no wɔ mu no bɔ abira.
mt0: <pad> Ɛno nkyerɛ Leo Mugabe, a ɔkae sɛ Mugabe's body bɛkɔ a wɔde bɛgyina akɔduru akɔduru a ɛyɛ kɛse no mu ansa na ɔman no nnipa bɛkɔ gyina akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru akɔduru

en: Uncertainty at President Mugabe's funeral procession has left many in a state of shock as to whether or not Mugabe's body will arrive as it is almost 30 days before his burial.
twi: ɔmampanin Mugabe ayie o nhyehyɛeɛ a ɛnsii pi no agya nnipa dodoɔ no ara ayamhyehyeɛ, sɛ Mugabe amu no bɛba anaasɛ ɛmma wɔ berɛ a aka nnafua aduasa na wɔasie no.
mt0: <pad> Ɔmanpanin Mugabe funeral procession no ayɛ nnipa pii sɛ wɔbɛte aseɛ sɛ ɔbɛba a, ɛfiri sɛ ɛbɛyɛ 30 days ansa na ɔbɛkɔ a.</s>

en: Leo Mugabe said Mugabe's body would remain in Zvimba for a day and then return to Harare where he would be laid to rest.
twi: Leo Mugabe kaa sɛ Mugabe amu no bɛwɔ Zyimba da koro na akyire no, wɔde bɛba Harare, baabi a wɔbɛsie no no.
mt0: <pad> Leo Mugabe said Mugabe's body would remain in Zvimba for a day and then return to Harare where he would be laid to rest.</s>

en: Leo Mugabe said people had gathered in one place at President Mugabe's home in Harare.
twi: Leo Mugabe de too dwa sɛ nnipa abɛhia wɔ faako wɔ ɔmampanin Mugabe fie a ɛwɔ Harare.
mt0: <pad> Leo Mugabe kyerɛɛ sɛ nnipa no bɛkaa wɔ baabi wɔ President Robert Mugabe's fie wɔ Harare.</s>

en: A member of the opposition MDC-T led by Nelson Chamisa who was also expected to die in Zvimba today, Lloyd Tarubwa of Banket, who was abducted and detained for nine months without trial, said they had come to see if President Mugabe was really dead.
twi: Ekuo ba baako a ɔka MDC-T amanyɔkuo a ɛnni aban a Nelson ɔhamisa da ano na ɔrehwɛ anim sɛ ɔbɛwu wɔ Zyimba nnɛ, Lloyd Tarubwa a ɔfiri Banket a wɔkyeree no de siiɛ bosome nkron wɔ berɛ a wɔamfa no ankɔ kɔɔto kaa sɛ, wɔbaeɛ sɛ ɔrebɛhwɛ sɛ ɔmampanin Mugabe awu ampa ara.
mt0: <pad> Lloyd Tarubwa of Banket, who was abducted and detained for nine months without trial, said they had come to see if President Mugabe was really dead.</s>

en: The conduct of Mr. Mugabe's funeral has shocked many in the country, claiming that Mr. Mugabe's troubles during his tenure were the cause of his death.
twi: Sɛdeɛ wɔsi yɛɛ Owura Mugabe ayie no ayɛ nnipa pii nwanwa wɔ ɔman no mu. Wɔsusu sɛ amanneɛ a Owura Mugabe faa mu berɛ ɔte akonnwa soɔ na ɛde ne wuo no baeɛ.
mt0: <pad> Ɔkwan a wɔde yɛɛ Mr. Mugabe afahyɛ no asɔe mmarima bebree wɔ ɔman no mu, na wɔkyerɛ sɛ ɔhaw a ɔwɔ bere a ɔdii tumi no yɛɛ ɔmfa ne wuo ho.</s>

en: Mr Mugabe passed away in Singapore on September 6 after a long illness.
twi: Owura Mugabe wui wɔ Singapore wɔ bosome a ɛtɔ so nkron no mu, ne da a ɛtɔ so nsia mu berɛ a na yare abɔ no ato hɔ mmerɛ tenten bi.
mt0: <pad> Mr Mugabe kɔɔ so wɔ Singapore September 6 bere a na ɔyɛ yareɛ kɛseɛ.</s>

en: The Amalgamated Rural Teachers Union of Zimbabwe, or ARTUZ, says one of its leaders, Godfrey Chanda, was abducted by detectives and detained for two hours in Gweru without the public's knowledge.
twi: Akyerɛkyerɛfoɔ nkabom kuo a wɔfrɛ wɔn Amalgamted Rural Teachers Union anaa ARTUZ wɔ Zimbabwe se wɔn panin baako a wɔfrɛ no Godfrey ɔhanda no, nnipa a wɔyɛ nhwehwɛmu kyee no maa no dii apolisifoɔ akakye dɔnhwere mmienu a onipa biara ante ho hwee.
mt0: <pad> Amalgamated Rural Teachers Union of Zimbabwe, or ARTUZ, says one of its leaders, Godfrey Chanda, was abducted by detectives and detained for two hours in Gweru without the public's knowledge.</s>

en: But Chanda, who is a member of the ARTUZ committee in the Midlands region, has been released after being forced not to hold meetings with coaches in Gweru.
twi: Nanso wɔagyae ɔhanda a ɔka ARTUZ kɔmitee no ho wɔ Mfimfini mantam no mu aberɛ a wɔhyɛɛ no ketee sɛ mma ɔne koogyifoɔ a wɔwɔ Gweru nhyia.
mt0: <pad> Ɛnnim, nanso Chanda, a ɔyɛ ARTUZ kuo no committee member wɔ Midlands region no, a wɔde no kɔɔ so no, na wɔde no kɔɔ so bere a wɔantumi ankasa anka agorɔfoɔ no ho nhyiam wɔ Gweru.</s>

en: ARTUZ president Obert Masaraure said Chanda's dismissal came as coaches under his two-day strike went on strike for a three-day strike.
twi: ARTUZ panin paa Obert Masaraure kaa sɛ yi a wɔayi ɔhanda adi no firi atua a koogyifoɔ no teeɛ no danee nnafua mmiɛna a na nka ɛwɔ sɛ ɛyɛ nnafua mmienu.
mt0: <pad> ARTUZ president Obert Masaraure kaa sɛ Chanda nkɔɔ so a wɔde no firi dwumadie mu ɛfirii sɛ coaches a na wɔwɔ strike no bɛyɛɛ strike a ɛboro nna mmiɛnsa.</s>

en: Masaraure says some coaching associations are also striking as a way to support their union.
twi: Masaraure se, koogyifoɔ no kuo no bi nso rete atua sɛdeɛ ɛbɛyɛ wɔde bɛboa ekuo no.
mt0: <pad> Masaraure kaa sɛ coaches associations no nso reyɛ ɔyɛkyerɛ sɛ wɔbɛboa wɔn union.</s>

en: The demonstration ends on Wednesday.
twi: ɔyɛkyerɛ no baa awieeɛ Wukuada.
mt0: <pad> Demonstration no bɛkɔ so Wednesday.</s>

en: But Masaraure said a meeting would be held after the strike to plan for action.
twi: Nanso Masaraure kaa sɛ wɔbɛyɛ nhyiamu wɔ atuateɛ no akyi na wɔde adwwene anammɔn a wɔbɛtuo ho.
mt0: <pad> Ɛsɛ sɛ yɛbɛka sɛ yɛnnim.</s>

en: We have not been able to contact the Minister of Labor, Ms Sekai Nzenza, to find out the government's position on the matter but her mobile phone has not been answered.
twi: Yɛntumi nhyiaa ɔsoafoɔ a ɔhwɛ apaadie so, Awuraa Sekai Nzenza na yɛabisa no aban no gyinaberɛ wɔ asɛm no ho nanso ɔmfa ne tetefon no.
mt0: <pad> yɛntumi mfa ɔman panin a ɔhwɛ adwuma, Ms Sekai Nzenza, bɛka sɛ ɔbɛkyerɛ sɛ ɔbɛyɛ ade wɔ saa asɛm yi ho no nanso ne mobile phone no nni hɔ.</s>

en: FC Platinum's sudden exit from the Caf Champions League has raised many questions about Zimbabwean football.
twi: Firi a Fɔ Platinum afiri ɔAF Champions League no mu no ama amanfoɔ rebisa nsɛm pii fa Zimbabwe bɔɔlobɔ ho.
mt0: <pad> FC Platinum's sudden exit from the Caf Champions League has raised many questions about Zimbabwean football.</s>

en: Although they still have two games left in the competition, FC Platinum will no longer be able to hold Esperance who have eight points, nor will they be able to beat Horoya Athletic Club who have seven points. as they were beaten at home and outside by Horoya which is the first to be watched if these teams finish the games equally on points.
twi: ɛwɔ mu sɛ aka agokansie mmienu wɔ akansie no mu deɛ, nyɛ Fɔ Platinum bɛtumi ne Esperanɔe a ɔwɔ mma nwoɔtwe anaa wɔbɛtumi adi Horoya Athletiɔ ɔlub a ɔwɔ mma nson so nkonim. Wɔdii nkoguo wɔ wɔn ankasa fie ne ɔman foforɔ so wɔ Horoya nso ano. ɛyɛ agokansie a ɛdi kan a wɔbɛhwɛ sɛ bɔɔlobɔ kuo yi nyinaa nya mma no pɛpɛɛpɛ.
mt0: <pad> Ɛwom sɛ wɔwɔ agorɔ mmienu wɔ akansie no mu, FC Platinum bɛyɛ den sɛ ɛbɛtumi akora Esperance a wɔwɔ nnum ntam, anaa sɛ ɛbɛtumi akora Horoya Athletic Club a wɔwɔ nnum ntam.</s>

en: At the moment, FC Platinum have only one point from four games so they are just playing to complete their remaining games in order to gain the respect of another fan of the game Spencer Mushambadope.
twi: Mprɛprɛn yi deɛ, Fɔ Platinum anya aba no baako pɛ afiri agokansie nnan mu nti wɔresi akan a aka no de apɛ animuonyam afiri bɛhwɛadeni Spenɔer Mushambadope hɔ.
mt0: <pad> Spencer Mushambadope</s>

en: Mushambadope says there will be no results for the remaining matches.
twi: Mushambadope se wɔnnya aba biara mfiri agokansie a aka no mu.
mt0: <pad> Mushambadope kae sɛ nnipa a wɔbɛkɔ ɔman no mu no nni nsunsuansoɔ ma agorɔdie a aka no.</s>

en: Last year, the same team was released in the first round by Angola's Primeiro de Agosto after being beaten at home by Lunda again.
twi: Afe a atwam no, bɔɔlobɔ kuo yi ara na wɔfirii mu wɔ akansie no fa a ɛdi kan. Angola Primeiro de Agosto na wɔyii wɔn firii mu berɛ a na Lunda ahyɛ wɔn bio wɔ wɔn fie.
mt0: <pad> Ɔpɛpɛɛpɛ, saa kuo no yɛɛ Angola's Primeiro de Agosto nsuo mu wɔ afe a atwam no bere a wɔdii nkonim wɔ Lunda ɔman no mu.</s>

en: In 2017, Caps United reached the mini league stage of the tournament but failed to reach the quarter-finals after being beaten 4-2 at home by Al Ahli Tripoli of Libya.
twi: Afe mpem mmienu ne du nson mu no, ɔaps United duru akansie no nketewa mu anso ɛkaa akuo nnɔtwe no, na wɔnka ho ɛfiri sɛ Al Ahli Tripoli a wɔfiri Lybia bɛhyɛɛ wɔn ɛka nnan maa wɔtee mu mmienu wɔ wɔn ankasa fie.
mt0: <pad> 2017 mu no, Caps United kɔɔ mini league a edi kan no mu nanso wɔantumi ankɔ quarter-finals bere a wɔdii 4-2 wɔn man mu wɔ Al Ahli Tripoli of Libya.</s>

en: The same year, the Ngezi Platinum Stars who were representing Zimbabwe in the Caf Confederation were knocked out of the tournament in the first round when they were beaten by the Angolan Libolo.
twi: Saa afe no ara mu no, Ngezi Platinum Stars a na wɔresi Zimbabwe anan mu wɔ ɔaf ɔonfederation mu no firii akansie wɔ ɔfa a ɛdi kan no mu wɔ berɛ a Angola Libolo dii wɔn so nkonim.
mt0: <pad> Ɛno ara mu no, Ngezi Platinum Stars a wɔrehwɛ Zimbabwe wɔ Caf Confederation no kɔɔ so wɔ tournament no a edi kan no mu bere a wɔn Angolan Libolo tɔɔ wɔn anim no.</s>

en: In 2016 Harare City who were in the same competition were eliminated in the first round by Zanaco of Zambia after being beaten 2-1 at Rufaro Stadium and then finished 3-1 in Zambia.
twi: Afe mpem mmienu ne dunsia mu no, Harare Citya na wɔwɔ akansie korɔ no ara mu no firii mu wɔ ɔfa a ɛdi kan no ara mu. Zanaɔo a wɔwɔ Zambia na ɔhyɛɛ wɔɔn ɛka mmienu maa wɔtee mu baako wɔ Rufaro Stadium na ɛkɔwie 3-1 wɔ Zambia.
mt0: <pad> 2016 mu no, Harare City a wɔwɔ saa dwumadie no mu no kɔɔ so wɔ Zambian Zanaco a wɔdii 2-1 at Rufaro Stadium na wɔsan dii 3-1 wɔ Zambia.</s>

en: This shows that local teams are failing to stand up to other African teams as was the case in previous years when Dynamos competed effectively in reaching the Caf Champions League final in 1998 and the semi-finals in 2008.
twi: Wei kyerɛ sɛ bɔɔlobɔ kuo a wɔwɔ kurom ha no ntumi nnyina Abibiman bɔɔlobɔ kuo a aka no anim sɛdeɛ na mfeɛ a atwam no Dynamos tumi sii akan yie tumi kɔduruu ɔaf Champions League agokansie a ɛtwa toɔ wɔ afe apem ɔha nkron aduokron nwɔtwe mu, ɛnna afe mpem mmienu ne nwɔtwe mu nso wɔduruu semi-finals.
mt0: <pad> Ɛkyerɛ sɛ nkurɔfo kuo no nni tumi akɔ so ayɛ adwuma wɔ African kuo no mu sɛnea na Dynamos yɛɛ adwuma yiye wɔ 1998 Caf Champions League finals ne 2008 semi-finals no mu.</s>

en: What hurts the most is that FC Platinum have only one point in four games, they have not scored a single point, moreover, they have conceded six points in four games.
twi: Deɛ ɛyɛ ya kɛseɛ mpo ne sɛ, Fɔ Platinum anya aba baako pɛ wɔ agokansie nnan mu, wɔnnyaa aba baako mpo. Bio, wɔahere mma nsia wɔ agokansie nnan mu.
mt0: <pad> Wɔde yɛn ho bɛkyerɛ no ne sɛ FC Platinum nni point biara wɔ agorɔnnan nnan mu, na wɔnni a single point, ɛno nso na wɔde six points kɔɔ so wɔ agorɔnnan nnan mu.</s>

en: The question is, if a team is beating all the teams at will in Zimbabwe and they are playing like this in Africa, what does it mean for national football?
twi: Asɛmmia no ne sɛ, sɛ bɔɔlobɔ kuo bi redi bɔɔlobɔ kuo nkaeɛ a wɔwɔ Zimbabwe no nyinaa so nkonim na wɔreda saa mmɔdemmɔ wei adi wɔ Abibirem a, na deɛn na ɛreka afa ɔman no bɔɔlobɔ ho?
mt0: <pad> sɛ ɔman bi bɛdi nnipa no ho dwuma wɔ Zimbabwe na wɔreyɛ saa adeɛ no wɔ Africa, ɛno kyerɛ sɛ national football no?</s>

en: Caps United supporter Tinashe Musebi says football has deteriorated to such an extent that there is a need for more reforms, before Zimbabwean teams fall short of surpassing Lesotho, Botswana and Swaziland.
twi: ɔaps United kyitaani pa ara, Tinashe Musebi se, sɛdeɛ bɔɔlobɔ aba fam no, ɛhia nkanyan bebree ansa na Zimbabwe bɔɔlobɔ kuo ahodoɔ no ayɛ mmɔfra ama Lesotho, Botswana ne Swaziland.
mt0: <pad> Zimbabwean football no ayɛ den paa na ɛsɛ sɛ wɔyɛ reforms, ansa na Zimbabwean teams bɛkɔ so kyerɛ Lesotho, Botswana ne Swaziland.</s>

en: Football commentator Farai Kambamura says Zimbabwean teams are failing to play in Africa because the players who helped them win the league title in Zimbabwe are going abroad, especially to South Africa when they are competing in Africa.
twi: Bɔɔlobɔ mu nkratoni Farai Kambamura se, Zimababwe bɔɔlobɔ kuo ahodoɔ no ntumi nsi akan wɔ Abibirem ɛfiri sɛ bɔɔlobɔfoɔ a wɔboaa wɔn maa wɔgyee nkurowa no nyinaa rekɔ amannɔne, titire South Africa berɛ a wɔresi akan wɔ Abibirem.
mt0: <pad> Zimbabwean football teams aren't playing well in Africa because the players who helped them win the league title in Zimbabwe are going abroad, especially to South Africa when they are competing in Africa.</s>

en: Last year, FC Platinum lost Gerald Takwara, Elvis Chipezeze and Talent Chawapiwa, this year lost to Rodwell Chinyafanere who won the soccer star of the year trophy who went to Baroka.
twi: Afe a ɛtwam no, Fɔ Platinum hweree Gerald Takwara, Elvis ɔhipezeze ne Talent ɔhawapiwa. Afe wei nkoguo a wɔdii no wɔ Rodwell ɔhinyafanere a ɔgyee abasobɔdeɛ a ɛkɔɔ so wɔ Baroka.
mt0: <pad> Ɔpɛpɛɛpɛ, FC Platinum awiee Gerald Takwara, Elvis Chipezeze ne Talent Chawapiwa, na afei wɔawiee Rodwell Chinyafanere a ɔdii n'abakɔsɛm a ɔtɔɔ so nnan a ɔkɔɔ Baroka.</s>

en: But John Chikochi, who led the Lengthens team in the Premier Soccer League, said Zimbabwe needed to increase its football competitions in the country so that clubs could pay players a fee that would prevent them from fleeing to South Africa and Zambia.
twi: Nanso John ɔhikoɔhi a ɔdii Lengthens bɔɔlobɔ kuo no anim ma wɔgyee Premier Soɔɔer League no kaa sɛ, ɛwɔ sɛ Zimbabwe pagya ne bɔɔlobɔ akansie no mu wɔ ɔman no mu sɛdeɛ ɛbɛyɛ a bɔɔlobɔ kuo ahodoɔ no bɛtumi atua wn bɔɔlobɔ akatua a ɛbɛsi wɔn kwan sɛ wɔbɛtu kwan akɔ South Africa ne Zambia.
mt0: <pad> Zimbabwe hia sɛ wɔde football dwumadie no kɔɔ so na ama clubs betumi de sika a ɛbɛboa nnipa a wɔrekɔ South Africa ne Zambia.</s>

en: Currently, Zimbabwe has only two clubs, the Castle Lager Premier Soccer League and the Chibuku Super Cup. The Zifa Cup was last played in 2005.
twi: Seisei ara deɛ, Zimbabwe wɔ bɔɔlobɔ agokansie ahodoɔ mmienu pɛ, ɔastle Lager Premier Soɔɔer League ne ɔhibuku Super ɔup. Afe a ɛtwa toɔ a wɔbɔɔ Zifa ɔup no yɛ afe mpem mmienu ne num mu.
mt0: <pad> Zimbabwe no wɔ kuw mmienu, Castle Lager Premier Soccer League ne Chibuku Super Cup. Zifa Cup no na wɔde dii nkonim wɔ 2005 mu.</s>

en: A football fan, Musa Masepe, says Zimbabwe has no football talent as players are opting to sing or something else as their salaries in football are no longer viable.
twi: Bɔɔlobɔ kyitaani Musa Masepe se Zimbabwe nni bɔɔlobɔ akyɛdeɛ na ɛbinom pɛ sɛ wɔto nwom anaa ade foforɔ bi ɛfiri sɛ wɔn akatua no nso wɔn.
mt0: <pad> Zimbabwefoɔ, Musa Masepe, kae sɛ Zimbabwefoɔ nni football talent nti nnipa no de wɔn ho bɛka nnwom anaa biribiara esiane sɛ wɔn sika a wɔde di dwuma wɔ football mu no yɛ den.</s>

en: If this continues, it will take time for local teams to compete with other African teams.
twi: Se wei toa so a, ɛbɛkyɛ ansa na ɔman no mu bɔɔlobɔ kuo ahodoɔ no atumi ne Abibiman nkaeɛ no asi akan.
mt0: <pad> sɛ wei kɔ so no, ɛbɛtumi ayi bere ma ɔmanfo kuo no akɔgyina nnipa a wɔwɔ Afrika no ho.</s>

en: Elections to represent the Democratic Party in the US presidential election in November are raging following the election of former New York mayor Michael Bloomberg.
twi: Abatoɔ a ɛresi Democratic Party anan mu wɔ US abatoɔ a wɔde reyi ɔmampanin wɔ Obubuo bosome mu no ayɛ abɛfuo ɛfiri to a wɔtoo aba no maa New York Mayor Miɔhael Bloomberg.
mt0: <pad> Elections to represent the Democratic Party in the US presidential election in November are raging after the election of former New York mayor Michael Bloomberg.</s>

en: Bloomberg, who has become a very rich man, did not run in the by-elections to represent his party in the presidential election, which will be contested by Republican Party spokesman Donald Trump.
twi: Bloomberg a wabɛyɛ ɔdefoɔ pa ara no ankɔgyina wɔ by-election wɔ n’amanyɔkuo no din mu wɔ abatoɔ a eɔde reyi ɔmampanin a RePublican amanyɔkuo kasamafoɔ Donald Trump nso bɛpre bi no.
mt0: <pad> Bloomberg, a ɔbɛyɛɛ nnipa a wɔn ho yɛ den, antumi ankɔ sɛ ɔbɛgyina Republican Party no mu wɔ presidential ɛbɔɔlobɔdeɛ no mu, a Republican Party spokesman Donald Trump bɛgyina.</s>

en: Mr Bloomberg announced in November last year that he was joining the party, spending more than $ 400 million on advertising. This money is theirs.
twi: Owura Bloomberg de too dwa Obubuo bosome no mu afe a atwam no sɛ, wɔreba amanyɔkuo no mu. ɔde sika a ɛboro $400M bɔɔ ho dawuro. Saa sika no yɛ wɔn dea.
mt0: <pad> Mr Bloomberg kyerɛɛ wɔ November afe a atwam no sɛ ɔbɛkɔ ɔmanpanin no mu, na ɔde $400 million sika akɔ nsɛm ho. Saa sika yi yɛ wɔn sika.</s>

en: The rich man did not run in the by-elections in Iowa and New Hampshire, nor will he run in the by-elections in Navada and South Carolina, pending the March election, when 14 states will elect a candidate to represent the Democratic Party in the US presidential election.
twi: ɔsikani no annyina wɔ by-election wɔ Iowa ne New Hampshire. Saa ara nso na wannyina wɔ by-election wɔ Navada ne South ɔarolina, berɛ a ɔbɛnem abatoɔ no reba wɔ aberɛ a mantam dunan na wɔbɛto aba ayi deɛ ɔbɛgyina Democratic Party amanyɔkuo no anan mu wɔ ɔmampanin abatoɔ no mu.
mt0: <pad> Ɔmanpanin no antumi ankɔ wɔ Iowa ne New Hampshire by-elections no mu, nanso ɔbɛkɔ wɔ Navada ne South Carolina by-elections no mu, ɛwɔ March sɛ 14 states bɛpaw abɛfo a ɔbɛgyina Democratic Party no so wɔ US presidential election no mu.</s>

en: As soon as Bloomerg put his foot down in the running for office, former members of the party, such as Bernie Sanders, who represents Vermont in the Senate, and Elizabeth Warren, who represents Massachusetts in the Senate, began tearing down Bloomberg's record.
twi: Berɛ a Bloomberg yɛɛ n’adwene sɛ ɔbɛkɔ akɔpre dibea no, amanyɔkuo no mma dadaa te sɛ Berniɔe Sanders a ɔgyina Vermont anan mu wɔ senɛte ne Elizabeth Warren a ɔgyina Massaɔhusetts anan mu wɔ senɛt, hyɛɛ aseɛ kaa n’abakɔsɛm ho nsɛmmɔne.
mt0: <pad> Ɛmfa ho sɛ Bloomberg de ne nsa hyɛɛ aseɛ wɔ ɔman panin no mu, Bernie Sanders, a ɔde Vermont bɛkyerɛ Senate no, ne Elizabeth Warren, a ɔde Massachusetts bɛkyerɛ Senate no, fii aseɛ bɛkaa Bloomberg's record.</s>

en: Mr Sanders said Mr Bloomberg was a well-known figure in New York mayor's decision to suspend and search for black people, as well as to Latinos, who were unfairly doing so. He said such a move could not get more people to vote for Mr. Trump's removal in November.

en: But Bloomerg slammed Mr. Sanders' comments, saying Mr. Sanders, who is leading the polls, has been elected a Democratic Party candidate in the presidential election, which will be with Mr. Trump for the next four years.

en: A political analyst and Zanu PF member, Frank Guni, said it was clear that the main match was between Sanders and Bloomberg, although it was clear that Sanders now had too many supporters.

en: Guni says, in his view, Sanders and Bloomberg should run in the presidential election together in order to defeat Trump.

en: A survey conducted by Studio 7 at various banks in Harare, Bulawayo, Chinhoyi, Masvingo, Mutare, Gweru and other cities revealed that no banks have received the new money and many banks have not been able to provide the people with the old one.
twi: Nhwehwɛmu a Studio 7 ayɛ wɔ sikakorabea ahodoɔ a ɛwɔ Harare, Bulawayo, ɔhinhoyi, Masvingo, Mutare, Gweru ne nkuropɔn nkaeɛ kyerɛ sɛ, sikakorabea biara nni hɔ a wɔannya sika foforɔ no na sikakorabea dodoɔ no ara ntumi mmaa nkurɔfoɔ no dada no nso.
mt0: <pad> Ɔyɛkyerɛ a Studio 7 yɛɛ wɔ aban no mu wɔ Harare, Bulawayo, Chinhoyi, Masvingo, Mutare, Gweru ne kuro afoforɔ mu no kyerɛ sɛ aban no nyinaa nni sika foforo a wɔde bɛma nnipa no na ɛnyɛ abanks no tumi ma nnipa no sika a ɛkɔɔ so no.</s>

en: Jossam Marwira, one of the bankers, said he had been waiting for the money for a day as he had heard in the news that a new currency would be added.
twi: ɛossam Marwira a ɔyɛ sikakorabea adwumayɛfoɔ no mu baako kaa sɛ, watwɛn sika no ara da koro firi mmerɛ ɔtee no wɔ kaseɛbɔ so sɛ wɔde sika foforɔ reba.
mt0: <pad> Jossam Marwira, a ɔyɛ banker mu baako, kae sɛ ɔde sika no rekɔ n'adwene bɛyɛ da sɛ ɔtee nsɛm a wɔkae sɛ sika foforo bɛba.</s>

en: Mr Marwira said he was particularly concerned about buying money on the streets and said it would be better for people like him to be able to get money from banks free of charge.
twi: Owura Marwira de too dwa sɛ na ɛho hia no yie sɛ ɔbɛtɔ sika wɔ mmɔtene so na ɔkaa sɛ ɛbɛyɛ sɛ amanfoɔ te sɛ ɔno bɛtumi anya sika afiri sikakorabea kwa.
mt0: <pad> Mr Marwira kaa sɛ ɔyɛ hu sɛ wɔde sika bɛtɔ wɔn so wɔ kurow no mu na ɔkaa sɛ ɛbɛyɛ papa ma nkurɔfo te sɛ ɔbɛtumi anya sika firi bank no a ɛno ara nni ade.</s>

en: A man who buys and sells money on the street who declined to be named also told Studio 7 that he was also looking forward to the new currency but saw nothing.
twi: Owura bi a ɔtɔ na watɔn sika wɔ mmɔtene so a ɔmpɛ sɛ wɔde ne din bɛto dwa nso kaa kyerɛɛ Studio 7 sɛ na ɔrehwɛ sika foforɔ no anim nanso wanhu hwee.
mt0: <pad> Ɔmanfoɔ a ɔtɔn ne tɔn sika wɔ nsuo so a ɔnhyɛɛ ne din no sɛ ɔbɛkae Studio 7 sɛ ɔhwɛɛ sika foforo no nanso ɔhunuu nnɔnhwere.</s>

en: RBZ, the central bank, recently announced that it would launch new investments in the hope of alleviating the country's financial woes.
twi: RBZ, sikakorabea baatan de too dwa nansa yi ara sɛ, ɛbɛda sikakora ho nhyehyɛeɛ foforɔ adi a wɔgye di sɛ ɛbɛte ɔman no hia so.
mt0: <pad> RBZ, a ɛyɛ central bank no, kaeɛ sɛ ɛbɛyɛ adwuma ho dwumadie foforo wɔ ɔpɛ sɛ ɛbɛboa ma nkuro no sika kɔkɔɔ mu haw no.</s>

en: RBZ Governor John Mangudya has announced that he will issue a $ 2 gold bond as well as a $ 2.5 bond bond that was expected to come into effect today.
twi: Amrado a ɔda RBZ ano, John Mangudya de ato dwa sɛ, ɔde $2M bɔndo bɛba ɛnne $2.5 bɔndo a nka ɛwɔ sɛ ɛba nnɛ.
mt0: <pad> RBZ Governor John Mangudya ayɛ adwene sɛ ɔbɛma $ 2 gold bond ne $ 2.5 bond bond a ɛbɛba adi no nnɛ.</s>

en: Bankers Association of Zimbabwe president Webster Rusere also said they had not yet checked whether any of the banks had received the money, saying RBZ was the only source of information.
twi: Bankers associationof Zimbabwe krakye panin, Webster Rusere de too dwa sɛ, wɔnhwɛ sɛ sikakorabea no mu bi nsa aka sika no anaa, na ɔse RBZ nko ara na wɔde asɛm no too dwa.
mt0: <pad> Bankers Association of Zimbabwe president Webster Rusere nso kaa sɛ wɔnnhu sɛ bank no biara anya sika no, kyerɛɛ sɛ RBZ na ɛyɛ ɔman no nkanea.</s>

en: The issue of money laundering is causing controversy in the country, with some saying it will help people who are worried about money while others say it is a scapegoat.
twi: Sika ho adwuma a wɔmfa kwan pa so nyɛ no de akyinigyeɛ aba ɔman no mu. ɛbinom sɛ ɛbɛboa nnipa a sika nti wɔredi awerɛhoɔ nanso ɛbinom se ɛyɛ asotwe ho nhwɛsoɔ.
mt0: <pad> Ɔhaw a ɛfa money laundering ho no yɛ controversy wɔ ɔman no mu, na ebinom ka sɛ ɛbɛboa nnipa a wɔwɔ sika ho ahoɔden na afoforɔ ka sɛ ɛyɛ scapegoat.</s>

en: Zimbabweans driving in South Africa have been living in a state of shock following the burning of cars by suspected South Africans who do not want foreign nationals to find work.
twi: Zimbabwefoɔ a wɔka kaa wɔ South Africa ho adwiri wɔn yie ɛsiane kaa a wɔrehyehye no a wɔsusu sɛ ɛyɛ South Africa ɔman mma no bi a wɔmpɛ sɛ ahɔhoɔ bɛnya adwuma ayɛ.
mt0: <pad> Zimbabweans a wɔde ka wɔ South Africa no akɔ ɔhaw mu bere a South Africans a wɔn ho yɛ hu no de wɔn kaa no bɛhyew.</s>

en: South African government ministers for police, Bheki Cele; Transport Minister Fikile Mbalula; and the Minister of Labor, Thulas Nxesi, held a meeting with truck drivers, job seekers and the owners warned to take action against those who are burning the trucks.
twi: South Africa soafoɔ a ɔhwɛ apolisifoɔ so, Bheki Jele; ɔsoafoɔ a ɔhwɛ akwantuo soɔ, Fikile Mbalula; ne ɔsoafoɔ a ɔhwɛ apaadie so, Thulas Nxesi ne ahyɛnkafoɔ a wɔka lɔɔre akɛseɛ yɛ nhyiamu. Wɔn a wɔrepɛ adwuma ne adwumawuranom bɔɔ wɔn kɔkɔ sɛ wɔntwe wɔn a wɔrehye lɔɔre akɛseɛ no aso.
mt0: <pad> South African apolisifo, Bheki Cele; Transport Minister Fikile Mbalula; and the Minister of Labor, Thulas Nxesi, yɛɛ nhyiam ne truck drivers, job seekers ne owners na wɔkae sɛ wɔbɛfa mmɔden a wɔde bɛkye trucks no ho.</s>

en: Cele warned truckers were on fire that they would be arrested as they were disrupting economic affairs.
twi: Jele bɔɔ ahyɛnkafoɔ a wɔka ahyɛn akɛseɛ kɔkɔ sɛ, ɛgya a wɔasɔ no bɛma wɔakye wɔn ɛfiri sɛ wɔresɛe ɔman no sikasɛm.
mt0: <pad> Cele kyerɛɛ nnipa a wɔde nnurukɔ bɛtow no sɛ wɔbɛyɛ wɔn nsa aka wɔn esiane sɛ wɔreyɛ ɔhaw ma sikasɛm.</s>

en: But just two hours after they finished talking a truck burned down on the N2 in Durban.
twi: Nanso dɔnhwere mmienu akyi no a wɔkasa wiee no, wɔhyee kaa kɛseɛ wɔ N2 wɔ Durban.
mt0: <pad> Ɛnyɛ sɛ ɛbɛkɔ so a, wɔde nneɛma a wɔde bɛkaa no adi no bɛkɔ so a, nanso bɛyɛ anɔpa mmienu akyi no, a ɛwɔ Durban no, a ɛbɛyɛ N2 no.</s>

en: A police spokesman, Senior Superintendent Parboo Sewpersad, acknowledged that another truck had been set on fire.
twi: ɔkasamafoɔ ma polisi, Superinendent Parboo Sewpersad de too dwa sɛ wɔahye ɛhyɛn foforɔ.
mt0: <pad> Ɔsahene a ɔkaeɛ no, Senior Superintendent Parboo Sewpersad, kaeɛ sɛ wɔde nnuru a ɛtɔ so mmienu bɛhyɛɛ ogya.</s>

en: Over the weekend, 18 trucks, including those feared by other Zimbabweans, were also set ablaze in KwaZulu-Natal and Gauteng.
twi: Nnawɔtwe awieeɛ yi, ahyɛn du nwɔtwe, deɛ Zimbabwefoɔ no mpɛ koraa no, wɔde gya too mu wɔ KwaZulu-Natal ne Gauteng.
mt0: <pad> Zimbabwean trucks 18 a wɔde kɔɔ kwan no mu no, a wɔde kɔɔ kwan no mu no, na wɔde bɛyɛɛ asɛe wɔ KwaZulu-Natal ne Gauteng.</s>

en: The chairman of the Zimbabwe Exiles Forum, Gabriel Shumba, said the trucks had been set ablaze on highways in the SA, prompting the temporary closure of the roads.
twi: Titenani ma Zimbabwe Exiles Forum, Gabriel Shumba kaa sɛ, wɔahye ahyɛn wɔ akwantepɔn a ɛwɔ SA na wɔatoto akwan no mu.
mt0: <pad> Zimbabwe Exiles Forum no panin Gabriel Shumba kaa sɛ wɔde trucks bɛyɛɛ ɔhyew wɔ South Africa, nti ɛmaa akwantuo no kɔɔ so ntɛm.</s>

en: Representing South Africa's Zimbabwe Exemption Permits, Edward Muchatuta, said that after the incident, he and other foreign drivers also protested, demanding that the SA government intervene.
twi: ɔregyina South Africa Zimbabwe Exemption Permits anan mu, Edward Muɔhatuta de too dwa sɛ saa asɛm no siiɛ, ɔne ahyɛnkafoɔ ahodoɔ bi nso yɛɛ ɔyɛkyerɛ sɛ wɔrefrɛ aban no se ɔmmra asɛm no mu.
mt0: <pad> Zimbabwe Exemption Permits, Edward Muchatuta, kaa sɛ wɔn ne ɔmanfo a wɔfiri South Africa no yɛɛ kɔmputa no ho nhyehyɛe, na wɔde kyerɛɛ South African government sɛ ɛbɛboa.</s>

en: One of the drivers, George Nanyika, has called for a dialogue.
twi: Ahyɛnkafoɔ no mu baako, George Nanyika afrɛ sɛ wɔantwetwe nkɔmmɔ.
mt0: <pad> George Nanyika, a ɔyɛ nnipa a wɔde kaa no kɔɔ so, ayɛ sɛ ɔbɛka nkitaho.</s>

en: Davie Munodawafa, another driver, said he also feared for his life.
twi: Davie Munadawafa, ɔhyɛnkafoɔ no mu baako nso de too dwa sɛ ɔsuro sɛ ɔbɛhwere ne nkwa.
mt0: <pad> Davie Munodawafa, ɔkwantufoɔ foforo, kaa sɛ ɔtee ne ho sɛ ɔbɛgyina ne nkwa mu.</s>

en: Munadawafa went on to say that many drivers do not know their future.
twi: Munadawafa toaa so kaa sɛ ahyɛnkafoɔ dodoɔ no ara nnim wɔn daakye.
mt0: <pad> Munadawafa kɔɔ so kaa sɛ nnipa pii nni wɔn adeɛ a wɔbɛyɛ wɔn nnawɔtwe.</s>

en: South Africa's police chief, Bheki Cele, yesterday warned that the police would take strict action against those who set fire to the vehicles. This, in turn, is what caused the other side of the coin to stop.
twi: South Africa polisi panin, Bheki Jele bɔɔ kɔkɔ sɛ apolisifoɔ de nhyehyɛeɛ ano yɛ den bɛgu akwan mu atia wɔn a wɔrehyehye ahyɛn no. Wei na ɛboa maa wɔn aka no gyaeɛ deɛ wɔreyɛ.
mt0: <pad> South Africa's apolisifo panin, Bheki Cele, kaeɛ sɛ apolisifo no bԑfa wɔn a wɔde ogya too ɔkwan no so no ho dwuma.</s>

en: Lions told Studio7 that the incident was a repeat of what South Africans had previously said that foreign nationals should leave SA.
twi: Lions ka kyerɛ Studio 7 sɛ, asɛm no yɛ deɛ asi pɛ a ɛne sɛ South Africa kuro mma no aka dada sɛ aman foforɔ so nnipa ntu mfiri ɔman no mu.
mt0: <pad> Lions kaa Studio7 sɛ saa atwam no yɛ South Africans a wɔkae sɛ ɔmanfo a wɔfiri ɔman foforo mu no bɛkɔ SA.</s>

en: Journalists have also been criticized by Shumba for failing to inform the public about the incident.
twi: Shumba nso abɔ nsɛntwerɛfoɔ soboɔ sɛ wɔatumi anyi ɔman no asotire wɔ asɛm no ho.
mt0: <pad> Shumba nso aka nsɛmkyerɛfoɔ no ho sɛ wɔnantumi ankasaa nkae sɛ ɛkɔɔ so no.</s>

en: Lions went on to say that their organization has written letters to foreign embassies in South Africa, including Zimbabwe, asking them to work together to end the crisis.
twi: Lions toaa so kaa sɛ, wɔn adwumakuo no atwerɛ krataa akɔma ahɔhoɔ asoeɛ a ɛwɔ South Africa ne Zimbabwe a wɔreka akyerɛ wɔn sɛ wɔnyɛ adwuma mmɔ mu na wɔntu saa ɔhaw yi ase.
mt0: <pad> Lions kaa sɛ wɔn kuo no de nwoma kyerɛɛ aman a wɔwɔ South Africa, ne Zimbabwe, sɛ wɔbɛyɛ adwuma akɔgyina ɔhaw no ho.</s>

en: Dewa Mavhinga, Human Rights Watch's regional director for North Africa, condemned the incident and urged motorists not to travel at night.
twi: Dewa Mavhinga a ɔyɛ Human Rights Watɔh mantam kwankyerɛfoɔ wɔ Abibirem Atifi kasaa tiaa saa asɛm yi na ɔtuu obiara a ɔde ɛhyɛn di dwuma fo sɛ mma wɔntu kwan anadwo.
mt0: <pad> Dewa Mavhinga, Human Rights Watch's regional director for North Africa, condemned the incident and urged motorists not to travel at night.</s>

en: The country's economic woes are prompting Zimbabweans to seek employment in South Africa, which has sparked tensions as South Africans complain of being deprived of jobs by foreigners.
twi: ɔman no sikasɛm a atɔ ape na ɛrema Zimbabwefoɔ atu kwan sɛ wɔrekɔpɛ adwuma ayɛ wɔ South Africa. Wei de basabasaeɛ aba ɛfiri sɛ South Africa kuro mma rekasa sɛ ahɔhoɔ mma wɔnnya adwuma nyɛ.
mt0: <pad> Zimbabwean a wɔwɔ Zimbabwe no kɔ South Africa sɛ wɔbɛnya adwuma, na ɛka nsusuiɛ sɛ South Africans a wɔwɔ hɔ no kyerɛ sɛ wɔn adwuma a wɔde ma wɔn no yɛ den.</s>

en: The court has ordered the police not to ban former Zimbabwe Hospital Doctors' Association president Dr. Peter Magombeyi, to go to South Africa for medical treatment following alleged beatings by kidnappers on September 14.
twi: Kɔɔto ahyɛ polisi sɛ, mma wɔmfa ɛson nto Zimbabwe Hospital Doctors’ associationkrakye panin Dr. Peter Magombeyi so sɛ ɔnkɔ South Africa nkɔgye ayaresa ɛsiane sɛ nkorɔfoɔ bi kyee no siiɛ boroo no wɔ ɛbɔ bosome da a ɛtɔ so du nan no mu.
mt0: <pad> Zimbabwe ɔman no asɛnnibea no ama nnipa sɛ wɔmma Dr. Peter Magombeyi, Zimbabwe Hospital Doctors' Association president no kwan ma ɔkɔ South Africa sɛ ɔbɛkɔ ayaresa wɔ Ɔsanaa Abibiman no so bere a ɔyɛkyerɛw a wɔde ɔkɔɔ Zimbabwe no mu no.</s>

en: The United States is giving Zimbabwe another $ 42 million. The money will be used to buy food for one million people from next month until May 2020.
twi: United States rema Zimbabwe $42M bio. Wɔde sika no bɛtɔ aduane ama nnipa ɔpepem baako ɛfiri bosome a ɛdi yɛn anim yi kɔsi Kɔtɔnima, 2020.
mt0: <pad> United States ɛreboa Zimbabwe $ 42 million. Nsɛm no bɛyɛ sika a wɔde bɔ aduane ma nnipa ɔpepem 1 firi Ɔsanaa kosi May 2020.</s>

en: Residents of rural Gwanda in Matabeleland South province tell Studio7 that no significant development projects are being undertaken by the government, and that little progress is being made by the private sector.
twi: Nnipa a wɔte nkuraase wɔ Gwanda a ɛwɔ Matabeleland anaafoɔ fam ka kyerɛɛ Studio 7 sɛ, mpontuo titire biara nni ha a ɛrekɔ so wɔ aban no berɛ so na ankorɛankorɛ nnwumakuo na wɔrebɔ wɔn ho mmɔden kakra.
mt0: <pad> Residents of rural Gwanda in Matabeleland South province tell Studio7 that no significant development projects are being undertaken by the government, and that little progress is being made by the private sector.</s>

en: Zimbabwe on Friday joined the rest of the world in marking International Women's Day, with many women saying they continue to be oppressed and deprived because leaders in the country do not care to promote them to equal opportunities.
twi: Zimbabwe ne wiase amansan nyinaa kɔbɔɔ mu dii International Women’s day a mmaa bebree reka sɛ wɔtaa ka wɔn hyɛ ɛfiri sɛ mpaninfoɔ a wɔwɔ ɔman no mu nnwene wɔn ho na wamma wɔn nyinaa akwannya korɔ.
mt0: <pad> Zimbabwe kɔɔ so wɔ International Women's Day no, na mmaa pii kae sɛ wɔbɛkɔ so ayɛ nnipa a wɔn ho yɛ hu ne adeɛ a wɔnni sɛ ɔman panin no nsi wɔn ani ma wɔnya nkɛntɛnsoɔ a ɛte sɛ nnipa.</s>

en: Although Zimbabwe has a constitution that binds equality of opportunity between women and men, many of the women we spoke to said there was no need or concern from government officials, political parties, churches or companies to ensure that this happened.
twi: ɛwɔ mu sɛ Zimbabwefoɔ wɔn mmara kunini a ɛma mmaa ne mmarima nyinaa akwannya pɛpɛɛpɛ deɛ, nanso mmaa no bebree a yɛne wɔn kasaeɛ no kyerɛ sɛ wɔn ho nhia aban mu nnipa, amanyɔkuo ahodoɔ, ansɔre ahodoɔ anaa nnwumakuo a wɔbɛhwɛ sɛ saa adeɛ yi bɛsi.
mt0: <pad> Zimbabwe wɔ ɔmanpanin a wɔde nnipa ne mmaa yɛ adwuma no mu ɛwɔ sɛdeɛ ɛbɛyɛ sɛ nnipa ne mmaa bɛyɛ adwuma no mu ɛte sɛ adeɛ, nanso mmaa a yɛkaeɛ no kaeɛ sɛ ɛnhia sɛ aban mpaninfo, political parties, churches, anaa firms bɛhwɛ sɛ saa adeɛ no bɛkɔ so.</s>

en: A former member of parliament and lawyer, Ms Jessy Majome, told Studio 7 that women are suffering the most in the country due to the negligence of men in leadership positions.
twi: mmarahyɛbɛdwani dadaa a ɔsan nso yɛ mmaranimfoɔ, Awuraa ɛessy Maɛome ka kyerɛɛ Studio 7 sɛ, mmaa wɔ ahokyerɛ kɛseɛ mu wɔ ɔman no mu ɛsiane yi a mmarima ayi wɔn totwene wɔ mpaninnie mu.
mt0: <pad> Ms Jessy Majome, a ɔyɛɛ mprenpren ne lawyer, kae Studio 7 sɛ mmaa no na wɔdi dwuma paa wɔ ɔman no mu esiane sɛ nnipa a wɔwɔ leadership positions no nni adeɛ.</s>

en: They say there is a great opportunity for the country to close the gap between women and men if the constitution is adhered to.
twi: Wɔse akwannya kɛseɛ wɔ hɔ sɛ ɔman no bɛtumi ama ɛkwan a ɛda mmaa ne mmarima ntam no abɛn sɛ wɔdi mmara no so a.
mt0: <pad> Ɔkaeɛ sɛ ɔkwan kɛseɛ wɔ hɔ ma ɔman no bɛyɛ a ɛbɛgyina nnipa ne mmaa ntam sɛ ɔman no bɛdi nkuro no so sɛ ɔman no bɛdi nkuro no so.</s>

en: The head of the Zimbabwe Women Lawyers Association, Abigail Matsvai, told Studio 7 that today is a very important day and they are using it to encourage leaders in government to adhere to laws that equalize opportunities between men and women.
twi: ɔpanin a ɔda Zimbabwe Women Lawyers associationano, Abigail Matsvai ka kyerɛɛ Studio 7 sɛ ɛnnɛ yɛ da a ɛho hia yie nawɔde rehyɛ aban mpaninfoɔ nkuran sɛ wɔnni mmara a ɛma mmarima ne mmaa akwannya a ɛyɛ pɛpɛɛpɛ no so.
mt0: <pad> Zimbabwe Women Lawyers Association, Abigail Matsvai, kaa sɛ ɛnnɛ yɛ da a ɛho hia paa na wɔde no rebɔ aman mpaninfoɔ animuo sɛ wɔbɛgyina mmara a ɛma nnipa ne mmaa tumi yɛ adwuma a ɛte sɛ.</s>

en: A member of the Gender Commission, Ms. Tsungirai Hungwe-Chimbunde, told Studio 7 that strong education is needed to make the public aware of the importance of equal opportunities between women and men.
twi: Mmaa ne Mmarima badwakuo no mu kuo mma no mu baako, Awuraa Tsungirai Hungwe-ɔhimbunde de too Studio 7 anim sɛ, nkyerɛkyerɛ a ɛmu da ho bɛhia sɛdeɛ ɛbɛyɛ a wɔbɛkyerɛ amanfoɔ mfasoɔ a ɛwɔ akwannya pɛ a ɛda mmaa ne mmarima ntam.
mt0: <pad> Ms. Tsungirai Hungwe-Chimbunde, a ɔyɛ Gender Commission no mufoɔ, kae Studio 7 sɛ ɛho hia sɛ wɔkyerɛkyerɛ bɛyɛ den ma nkurɔfoɔ anya hokwan a ɛte saa ntam a mmaa ne mmarima nya.</s>

en: He said his commission was trying its best to reach out to various political parties to give their members equal opportunities in the elections so that more women could run for office.
twi: ɔse n’asoeɛ no rebɔ mmɔden yie sɛ wɔne amanyɔkuo ahodoɔ bɛtwetwe nkɔmmɔ na wɔama mmaa akwannya pɛ wɔ abatoɔ no mu sɛdeɛ ɛbɛyɛ a mmaa dodoɔ no ara bɛtumi apere akonnwa.
mt0: <pad> Ɔkaa sɛ, ɔde ne ho bɛkyerɛ nnipa a wɔwɔ aman no mu a wɔrekɔ ɔman no mu a wɔbɛma mmaa tumi yɛ adwuma.</s>

en: This year's celebrations are being held under the theme, Think Equal, Build Smart, Innovate for Change.
twi: Afe yi fa a wɔrehyɛ no asɛntitire ne Think Equal, Build Smart, Innovate for ɔhange.
mt0: <pad> Ɛnnɛ no afahyɛ no wɔ sɛdeɛ ɛbɛkɔ so, Think Equal, Build Smart, Innovate for Change.</s>

en: Ms Majome said in line with the theme, the electoral commission should use these powers to provide equal seats for women and men in the 2023 elections.
twi: Awura Maɛome kyerɛ sɛ sɛdeɛ asɛntitire no siiɛ no, ɛwɔ sɛ abatoɔ kɔmisa no de ne tumi boa ma mmaa ne mmarima nya nkonnwa dodoɔ pɛ wɔ 2023 abatoɔ no mu.
mt0: <pad> Ms Majome kaa sɛ, wɔn a wɔbɛgyina ɔman no mu no ɛsɛ sɛ electoral commission no de tumi a ɛwɔ hɔ no adi dwuma sɛ ɛbɛma mmaa ne mmarima akɔ gyinae a ɛyɛ pɛ wɔ 2023 elections no mu.</s>

en: Ms. Matsvai has supported these reform groups in the leadership positions.
twi: Awuraa Matsvai nso afoa saa nsesaeɛ kuo yi so wɔ akannifoɔ dibea mu.
mt0: <pad> Ms Matsvai ayɛ wɔn kɔɔ so wɔ reform kuo no mu.</s>

en: Ms Majome also said it was important for women to unite and fight their battles together and not be exploited by men.
twi: Awura Maɛome kaa bio sɛ, ɛwɔ sɛ mmaa ka wɔn ho bɔ mu na wɔako wɔn ko bɔm na wɔama mmarima aka wɔn ahyɛ.
mt0: <pad> Ms Majome nso kaa sɛ ɛho hia sɛ mmaa bɔ mmɔden na wɔn ho bɛyɛ adwuma wɔn ho na wɔn ho nkɔ so nsi wɔn nkonimdie no mu na wɔn ho nkɔ so nsi wɔn nkonimdie no mu.</s>

en: He said it was clear that many men in office did not want to leave the party, which was why they were fighting women and giving them less opportunities to run for office.
twi: ɔkaa sɛ ɛda adi pefee sɛ mmarima dodoɔ no ara wɔwɔ amanyɔkuo no mu mpɛ sɛ wɔpɛ firi hɔ, na ɛno nti na wɔne mmaa wɔwɔ hɔ no rede ham so. Wei nti na mmaa no ntumi nkɔpere diberɛ bi.
mt0: <pad> Ɔkaa sɛ ɛyɛ ntease sɛ mmarima bebree a wɔwɔ office no npɛ sɛ wɔbɛfiri party no, ɛno nti na wɔrebɔ mmɔfra ho amanne na wɔmma wɔn hokwan sɛ wɔbɛgyina ɔman no mu.</s>

en: International Women's Day is celebrated annually on March 8 as a way to celebrate women's progress in economic, political and other fields as well as to promote equality of opportunity between women and men around the world.
twi: Wɔdi International Women’s Day ɔbenem da a ɛtɔ so nwɔtwe afe biara. Wɔdi saa da yi kyerɛ mmaa mpontuo wɔ dwadie, amanyɔsɛm ne dwumadie afoforɔ mu, na wɔde kyerɛ sɛ ɛwɔ sɛ mmaa nya akwannya mmarima nya no bi.
mt0: <pad> International Women's Day yɛ afahyɛ afe biara wɔ March 8 sɛ ɔkwan a wɔde hwɛ nnipa a wɔn ho yɛ den wɔ sikasɛm, politiki ne mmeae afoforɔ mu na ɛbɛboa ma nnipa a wɔwɔ tumi no nso nya adeɛ a wɔbɛtumi anya wɔ nneɛma a wɔbɛtumi anya wɔ nnipa ne mmaa a wɔwɔ wiase nyinaa.</s>

en: Government-sponsored celebrations were held in Gokwe in the Midlands region and many organizations also held ceremonies in various locations. MDC leader Nelson Chamisa was marking the day in Chitungwiza.
twi: Wɔdi dwumadie yi a aban nsa hyɛ aseɛ wɔ Gokwe a ɛwɔ Midlands mpɔtam no na nnwumakuo ahodoɔ no diiɛ no mmeaeɛ mmeaeɛ ahodoɔ. MDɔ kannifoɔ Nelson ɔhamisa nso diiɛ wɔ ɔhitungwiza.
mt0: <pad> Ɛyɛ Zimbabwe aban no a wɔde nsɛm kɔɔ so wɔ Gokwe a ɛwɔ Midlands region na amammerɛ ahodoɔ nso kɔɔ so wɔ beae ahorow. MDC leader Nelson Chamisa akɔsra afahyɛ no wɔ Chitungwiza.</s>

en: Other media outlets today, including the Zimbabwe Human Rights Commission, said it was difficult for women to move forward with the current economic situation as no one was giving them a chance.
twi: Dawubɔ nnwuma a Zimbabwe Human Right Commission ka ho nso de too dwa sɛ, ɛyɛ den sɛ mmaa bɛkɔ wɔn anim ɛsiane sɛ sikasɛm ho nsɛm mma wɔn kwan.
mt0: <pad> Zimbabwe Human Rights Commission, a ɛwɔ Zimbabwe, nso kaeɛ sɛ ɛnyɛ den ma mmaa sɛ wɔbɛkɔ anim wɔ Zimbabwe's economic situation sɛ obiara nni hɔ a ɔbɛma wɔn hokwan.</s>

en: The Zimbabwe Peace Project has also issued a statement marking the day to protest against human rights abuses, including violations of human rights abuses in January following a nationwide protest.
twi: Zimbabwe peace Prroject nso de wɔn anodisɛm ɛfa dwumadie no baeɛ sɛ wɔreko atia wɔn a wɔtiatia nnipa yiedie so nkanka deɛ ɛkɔɔ so ɔpɛpɔn mu berɛ a na ɔyɛkyerɛ rekɔ so wɔ ɔman no mu nyinaa.

en: The Labor Court has ruled that children who are absent from work must return to work within 48 hours as their activities are illegal.
twi: Apaadie kɔɔto ama mmɔfra a wɔnkɔ adwuma no dɔnhwere aduanan nwɔtwe sɛ wɔmfa nkɔ adwuma ɛsiane sɛ wɔn atuateɛ no mfa mmara kwan so.
mt0: <pad> Ɔmanfoɔ Asoeɛ no ahyɛ asɛm sɛ mmofra a wɔnkɔ adwuma mu no bɛsan aba adwuma mu 48 hours ansa na wɔn dwumadie no bɛyɛ adeɛ a ɛyɛ adeɛ a ɛnyɛ mmara.</s>

en: Labor Court judge Rodgers Manyangadze and Lawrence Murasi have given the doctors two days to return to work.
twi: Apaadie atemmuafoɔ Rodgers Manyangadze ne Lawrenɔe Murasi ama adɔkotafoɔ nna mmienu sɛ wɔnkɔ adwuma.
mt0: <pad> Ɔmanfoɔ a wɔwɔ Labor Court no, Rodgers Manyangadze ne Lawrence Murasi, ama ayaresafoɔ no nna mmienu sɛ wɔbɛsan aba wɔn adwuma mu.</s>

en: The court also ruled that a dispute between the children's doctor and the government should be referred to a mediator in order to resolve the matter within 14 days.
twi: Kɔɔto no nso buaa sɛ ntawantawa a ɛda mmɔfra adɔkotafoɔ ne aban no ntam no, wɔama wɔn nnawɔtwe mmienu sɛ wɔmpɛ obi mma no siesie asɛm no.
mt0: <pad> Ɔmanpanin no nso de ɛho nhyehyɛe sɛ ɔbɛkyerɛ nkitahodi a ɛwɔ nnipa a wɔyɛ adwuma no ne aban no ho sɛ ɛkɔ amediator so na ɛbɛgyina saa nkitahodi no mu nnwɔtwe mu.</s>

en: Former vice-president of the Zimbabwe Hospital Doctors' Association, Doctor Masimba Ndoro, said despite the ruling, doctors were not qualified to go to work.
twi: Zimbabwe Hospital Doctors’ associationkrakye panin abadakyire dadaa, Doctor Masimba Ndoro se ɛmfa ho ne deɛ kɔɔto no de ato dwa no, adɔkotafoɔ no nni ho kwan sɛ wɔnkɔ adwuma.
mt0: <pad> Zimbabwe Hospital Doctors' Association, Dr Masimba Ndoro, said despite the ruling, doctors were not qualified to go to work.</s>

en: Asked by Studio7 if they were afraid of losing their jobs if they did not comply with the court's order, Dr. Ndoro said employers should take action to get workers back to work.
twi: Studio 7 bisaa no sɛ, sɛ wɔanni deɛ kɔɔto aka no sɛ a, wɔnsuro sɛ wɔbɛhwere wɔn adwuma, Dr. Ndoro de too dwa sɛ ɛwɔ sɛ wɔn a wɔafa wɔn adwuma no yɛ deɛ ɛwɔ sɛ wɔyɛ biara ma wɔnkɔ adwuma.
mt0: <pad> Ɛsɛ sɛ wɔn a wɔyɛ adwuma no bɛkɔ so akɔ adwuma sɛ wɔnhyia ɔmanpanin no tumi krataa no, Dr. Ndoro kaa sɛ wɔn ho bɛyɛ hu sɛ wɔbɛgye wɔn adwuma no firi mu sɛ wɔnhyia ɔmanpanin no tumi krataa no.</s>

en: The lawyer for the Zimbabwe Hospital Doctors' Association, Doug Coltart, said he did not agree with the outcome but would look into the reasons.
twi: Lɔya ma Zimbabwe Hospital Doctors’ Assoɔiation, Doug ɔoltart kyerɛ sɛ ɔnni kɔɔto no nyɛ adwene nso ɔbɛhwɛ deɛ nti a wɔreka saa.
mt0: <pad> Zimbabwe Hospital Doctors' Association no lawyer, Doug Coltart, kaa sɛ ɔmmu nea ɛkɔɔ so no nanso ɔbɛhwɛ nsunsuansoɔ no mu.</s>

en: Coltart also said he had a chance to appeal to the Supreme Court against the ruling if doctors wanted to take action.
twi: ɔolhart san nso kaa sɛ, sɛ adɔkotafoɔ no pɛ a, ɔwɔ akwannya sɛ ɔkɔ dwanetoa wɔ kɔɔto peemu wɔ atemmuo no ho.
mt0: <pad> Coltart nso kaa sɛ ɔwɔ hokwan sɛ ɔbɛkɔ Supreme Court sɛ adwumayɛfoɔ pɛ sɛ wɔbɛyɛ biribi sɛ ɔbɛkyerɛ no.</s>

en: Studio7 was unable to hear the side of the health minister, Dr. Obadiah Moyo, along with the Health Services Board,
twi: Studio 7 ntumi ntee ɔsoafoɔ a ɔhwɛ apɔmmuden nsɛm so, Dr. Obadiah Mayo ne Health Service Board anodisɛm.
mt0: <pad> Studio7 antumi ankɔte ɔmanpanin a ɔhwɛ ayaresa ho no, Dr. Obadiah Moyo ne ayaresa dwumadie kuw no nsɛm ho.</s>

en: The doctors went on strike on September 3, saying they had no work to do.
twi: Adɔkotafoɔ no de wɔn mfidie guu hɔ ɛbɔ da a ɛtɔ so mmiɛna a wɔkyerɛ sɛ wɔnni adwuma biara yɛ.
mt0: <pad> Ɔfese no ayaresfoɔ kɔɔ strike September 3, wɔkae sɛ wɔnni dwuma a wɔbɛyɛ.</s>

en: Remaining senior doctors at work also staged a sit-in on Thursday last week complaining about salaries and conditions in hospitals.
twi: Adɔkotafoɔ mpaninfoɔ a wɔkɔ adwuma no nso hyɛ dan mu Yawoada a ɛtwaam no a wɔmpue a wɔkyerɛ sɛ wɔn akatua ne ayaresabea tebea a ɛwɔ mu no nyɛ.
mt0: <pad> Ɔfese ayaresa a aka no kɔɔ so wɔ adwuma mu no nso yɛɛ sit-in nnɛ a ɛtɔ so nnan no sɛ wɔnhu sika ne ahɔhodan ahodoɔ a ɛwɔ hɔ.</s>

en: The US government says that Cyclone Idai devastated Manicaland province and that the tragedy will continue to affect its people.
twi: US aban no de ato dwa sɛ ɔyɔlone idai asɛe Maniɔaland mpɔtam no na atowerɛkyɛm yi bɛkɔ so ateetee nnipa a wɔwɔ hɔ no.
mt0: <pad> US aban no kae sɛ Cyclone Idai ayɛ Manicaland ɔman no mu na ɛbɛkɔ so akɔgyina nnipa no so.</s>

en: Speaking to Studio 7 at the US embassy, ​​Jason Taylor, USAID's director of disaster relief, said that while they were working with other agencies to rehabilitate roads and rebuild damaged buildings, they were now focusing more on food security to save lives.
twi: ɔne Studio 7 retwetwe nkɔmmɔ US ɔman ananmusini asoeɛ a ɛwɔ ɔman no mu no, ɛason Taylor a ɔyɛ USAID kwankyerɛ panin a ɔhwɛ atowerɛkyɛm mmoa so kaa sɛ, mmerɛ wɔne ne akuo ahodoɔ redi ntikaho sɛ wɔbɛyɛ akwan na wɔasisi adan a asɛe no, wɔde wɔn ani rekɔ nnuane nnipa bɛdi so sɛdeɛ ɛbɛyɛ nnipa nhwere wɔn nkwa.
mt0: <pad> Jason Taylor, USAID's director of disaster relief, told Studio 7 at the US embassy that while they were working with other agencies to rehabilitate roads and rebuild damaged buildings, they were now focusing more on food security to save lives.</s>

en: Taylor said the crisis in Manicaland was so serious that the Zimbabwean government could not do it on its own.
twi: Taylor de too dwa sɛ atowerɛkyɛn a asi wɔ Maniɔaland mpɔtam no ano yɛ den pa ara a Zimbabwe aban no nko ara ntumi nsɔ ano.
mt0: <pad> Taylor kaa sɛ ɔhaw no wɔ Manicaland no yɛ den paa na Zimbabwean aban no ntumi mfa ne ho mmoa no.</s>

en: Taylor, who visited Manicaland province with a World Food Program helicopter, where he is investing, said he was shocked to see the mental anguish in the region.
twi: Taylor a ɔkɔɔ Maniɔaland mpɔtam de nnuane kɔmaa wɔn no kyerɛ sɛ ɔyɛɛ no nwanwa mmerɛ a ɔhunuu sɛdeɛ nnipa a wɔwɔ mantam no redi abooboo.
mt0: <pad> Taylor, a ɔkɔɔ Manicaland ɛman no mu wɔ World Food Program helicopter, a ɔyɛ adwuma wɔ hɔ, kae sɛ ɔyɛɛ nwanwa sɛ ɔhuu sɛnea nnipa no nni ɔhaw a wɔwɔ hɔ no.</s>

en: He said the children he saw were unhappy. He said it was important that after the people of Manicaland benefited from such things as food and housing, they should also be helped to regain their composure.
twi: ɔkaa se mmɔfra a ɔhunuu wɔn no wɔ awerɛhoɔ mu. ɔde too dwa sɛ ɛho hia sɛ nnipa a wɔwɔ Maniɔaland no bɛnya nnoɔma bi te sɛ nnuane ne baabi a wɔbɛda. Afei nso ɛwɔ sɛ wɔboa wɔn ma wɔn akoma tɔ wɔn yam.
mt0: <pad> Ɔkaeɛ sɛ mmofra a ɔhwɛɛ no yɛ nteaseɛ. Ɔkaeɛ sɛ ɛho hia sɛ wɔde mmofra a wɔwɔ Manicaland kɔɔ so anya adeɛ a ɛte saa sɛ aduane ne adan, nanso ɛsɛ sɛ wɔboa mmofra no ma wɔnya nteaseɛ.</s>

en: Taylor also said that in Chimanimani and Chipinge they did not see or meet with residents who said they were not getting help because of the political party they support.
twi: Taylor de too dwa sɛ, wɔduruu ɔhimanimani ne ɔhipinge no, wɔanhunu wɔn a wɔse ɛsiane wɔn amanyɔkuo a wɔdɔm nti wɔnnya mmoa mfiri aban no hɔ no.
mt0: <pad> Taylor nso kaa sɛ wɔnantumi ankɔhu anaa anka wɔn ne nnipa a wɔkae sɛ wɔnhu mmoa nti sɛ wɔn yɛ political party a wɔhwɛ no.</s>

en: USAID has also said it has the expertise to train Zimbabweans to look into the sky to determine when, and where the storms are likely to occur, as well as what steps they can take to prevent the destruction of lives and property if requested by the government.
twi: USAID sɛ Zimbabwe aban no bisa nko ara deɛ a, wɔn nso de animdefoɔ bɛkɔ Zimbabwe sɛ wɔnkɔkyerɛ Zimbabwefoɔ sɛdeɛ wɔbɛhunu berɛ ne beaeɛ a ahum no bɛba ne kwan a wɔbɛfa so abɔ nnipa ne agyapadeɛ ho ban.
mt0: <pad> USAID nso kaeɛ sɛ wɔwɔ nimdeɛ a ɛbɛboa Zimbabwefoɔ ma wɔn yɛ adwuma sɛ wɔbɛhwɛ asase no so sɛ ɛbɛkɔ so, ne sɛ wɔbɛyɛ adeɛ a wɔbɛhyɛ nkwan a ɛbɛma nnipa ne mmoa anya ɔhaw sɛ ɔman panin no de bɛka.</s>

en: Since the outbreak of Cyclone Idai, the United States has provided Zimbabwe with $ 2.6 million.
twi: Firi mmerɛ a ɔyɔlone Idai no siiɛ no, United States ama Zimbabwe $2.6M.
mt0: <pad> Ɛfiri Cyclone Idai a ɛbɛduru no, United States no ama Zimbabwe $2.6 million.</s>

en: Meanwhile, the government, the United Nations and non-governmental organizations today launched a $ 60 million emergency relief fund for Cyclone Idai.
twi: Zimbabwe aban, United Nations ne NGOs ahodoɔ ahyɛ dwumadie bi asɛ sɛ wɔrepɛ $60M de ahwɛ wɔn a ɔyɔlone Idai ama wɔn ho aka no.
mt0: <pad> Ɛnnɛ, aban no, UN ne aman a wɔnni aban no nkaeɛ no de $60 million emergency fund bɛyɛ Cyclone Idai.</s>

en: It is estimated that about 300,000 people need help in Manicaland province, and of these, 129,000 are young children.
twi: Wɔsusu sɛ nnipa 300,000 na wɔhia mmoa wɔ Maniɔaland mpɔtam mu na wɔn mu 129,00 yɛ nkwadaa.
mt0: <pad> Ɔyɛ sɛ nnipa 300,000 na wɔhia mmoa wɔ Manicaland ɔman no mu, na wɔn mu 129,000 yɛ mmofra.</s>

en: In the nine districts disrupted by Cyclone Idai, 113 schools were destroyed, leaving 90,000 students homeless.
twi: Mansini nkron aa ɔyɔlone Idai sɛeɛ no, sukuu ɔha ne du-mmiɛnsa na ɛsɛe a ama asukuufoɔ 90,000 nnya baabi nna.
mt0: <pad> Ɛwɔ nsuo no ɔmantam nnan mu, 113 sukuu na wɔsɛee, a ɛmaa adesuafo 90,000 bɛyɛɛ ɔmantamfo.</s>

en: The government says more than 300 people are unaccounted for, and another 399 people died in the crash.
twi: Aban no se nnipa 300 na wɔakan wɔn aka ho, ɛnna nnipa 399 na wɔhweree wɔn nkwa.
mt0: <pad> Ɔmanpanin no kaa sɛ nnipa 300 na wɔnni ho, na nnipa 399 na wɔwui wɔ akwanhyia no mu.</s>

en: This number is expected to rise.
twi: Wɔrehwɛ anim sɛ nnipa dodoɔ no bɛkɔ anim.
mt0: <pad> sɛ wobɛtumi ayɛ saa nsɛm no a, ka sɛ wonnim</s>

en: Some patients say they are being treated abroad following a strike by children's nurses who say they fear they may die in hospitals without treatment.
twi: Ayarefoɔ binom se wɔregye ayaresa wɔ amannɔne ɛfiri sɛ anɛɛsefoɔ a wɔhwɛ mmɔfra ate atua na wɔsoro sɛ wɔbɛtumi awu wɔ ayaresabea a wɔnnya ayarehwɛ.
mt0: <pad> Ɔyarefo bi kae sɛ wɔrekɔ ayɛ wɔn ayaresa wɔ ɔman foforo mu bere a mmofra nnurudiefoɔ a wɔwɔ Ghana no bɛyɛɛ strike a wɔde kyerɛ sɛ wɔbɛgyina sɛ wɔbɛfa nkurɔfoɔ a wɔwɔ Ghana no ho ban.</s>

en: A study conducted by Studio 7 has revealed that some patients are now traveling to other countries such as South Africa, Botswana and Zambia for treatment there following the strike by the children's nurse.
twi: Nhwehwɛmu a Studio 7 yɛɛeɛ akyerɛ sɛ, ayarefoɔ binom retu kwan akɔ aman foforɔ te sɛ South Africa, Botswana ne Zambia akɔgye ayaresa ɛnam atuateɛ a anɛɛsefoɔ a wɔhwɛ mmɔfra ateɛ no.
mt0: <pad> Ɔkyerɛwdeɛ a Studio 7 yɛɛ no kyerɛ sɛ nnipa bi a wɔwɔ yareɛ a wɔwɔ South Africa, Botswana ne Zambia kɔɔ ayaresa wɔ hɔ bere a nurse a ɔhwɛ mmofra no yɛɛ strike no akyi.</s>

en: One of the patients we spoke to at Parirenyatwa, Ms Molline Chindove, said she had been coming to the hospital for days for treatment but nothing was moving.
twi: Ayarefoɔ no mu baako a yɛne no kasaeɛ wɔ Parirenyatwa, Awuraa Molline ɔhindove kaa sɛ, ɔtaa ba ayaresabea hɔ bɛpɛ ayarehwɛ nanso biribiara nkɔ so.
mt0: <pad> Ɔyarefo bi a yɛkaa ne ho wɔ Parirenyatwa, Ms Molline Chindove, kaa sɛ ɔkɔɔ ayaresabea no daeɛ nanso nnɔnhweree biara nni hɔ.</s>

en: Ms Chindove said she was going to South Africa for treatment for fear of dying of thirst with her legs in the water.
twi: Awuraa ɔhindove kaa sɛ, ɔrekɔ South Africa akɔgye ayarehwɛ ɛfiri sɛ ɔsuro sɛ nsukum bɛku no wɔ berɛ a ne nan sisi nsuo mu.
mt0: <pad> Ms Chindove kaa sɛ ɔrekɔ South Africa sɛ ɔbɛgye ayaresa esiane sɛ ɔte nsuo mu na ne nan akɔ nsuo mu no.</s>

en: One of her relatives, Fiona Muchabaiwa, said she had no choice but to transport her patient to Zambia tomorrow for treatment, saying it was too expensive.
twi: N’abusuafoɔ no mu baako, Fiona Muɔhabaiwa kaa sɛ, ɔnni hwee yɛ sɛ ɔde no bɛkɔ Zambia ɔkyena akɔgye ayarehwɛ. Na ɔkyerɛ sɛ ne boɔ yɛ den.
mt0: <pad> Ɔkaa bi a ɔwɔ ne ho, Fiona Muchabaiwa, kaa sɛ ɔbɛkɔ Zambia anadwo no na ɔbɔ ɔyarefo no ayaresa, sɛ ɛyɛ den sɛ ɔbɛgye no.</s>

en: A study conducted by Studio 7 has revealed that many of the previously closed public hospitals are causing more and more people seeking treatment to leave public hospitals for treatment in private hospitals.
twi: Nhwehwɛmu a Studio 7 yɛɛeɛ akyerɛ sɛ, ɔman no ayaresabea a wɔatoto mu no reha adwene, na nnipa pii repere sɛ wɔbɛfiri ɔman ayaresabea no mu akɔ ankorɛankorɛ ayaresabea mu akɔgye ayarehwɛ.
mt0: <pad> Ɔkyerɛwdeɛ a Studio 7 yɛɛ no kyerɛ sɛ nnipa pii a wɔrekɔ ɔmanfo ayaresabea no mu no refiri ɔmanfo ayaresabea no mu dekɔ ayaresabea a wɔn ho yɛ den.</s>

en: Wilbert Kasanze said he had taken his wife from Chegutu General Hospital to be treated at a private hospital in Chitungwiza.
twi: Wilbert Kasanze kaa sɛ wayi ne yere afiri ɔhegutu General Hospital sɛ ɔrekɔhwɛ no wɔ ankorɛankorɛ ayaresabea a ɛwɔ ɔhitungwiza.
mt0: <pad> Wilbert Kasanze kyerɛɛ sɛ ɔde ne nsa aka ne nsa no firii Chegutu General Hospital kɔɔ ayaresabea wɔ Chitungwiza.</s>

en: Kasanze says the daily bus ride from Chegutu where he lives to Chitungwiza is causing his pocket money to run out.
twi: Kasanze se dabiara lɔɔre akɔbadie firi ɔhegutu kɔ ɔhitungwiza no ama ne bɔtɔm sika nyinaa asa.
mt0: <pad> Kasanze kyerɛ sɛ bus no a ɛkɔ Chitungwiza da biara no ama ne sika a ɔde bɛdi dwuma no ayɛ den.</s>

en: The Health Services Board has announced that the retired child nurses will return to work immediately.
twi: Health Services Board de ato dwa sɛ mmɔfra anɛɛsefoɔ a wɔaku ahomegyeɛ mu no bɛsan aba adwuma ntɛm pa ara.
mt0: <pad> Health Services Board no kyerɛɛ sɛ wɔn a wɔyɛ adwuma a wɔde kɔɔ so no bɛsan aba adwuma bere tiawa bi mu.</s>

en: The board also called on all strikers to resign and urged them to re-apply if they still wanted a job.
twi: Bɔɔdo no nso aka akyerɛ atuatefoɔ no nyinaa sɛ wɔmfa wɔn nnwuma nto hɔ na sɛ wɔrepɛ adwuma deɛ a, wɔnsan mfa adwumapɛ ho krataa mmra.
mt0: <pad> Board no nso kaa sɛ wɔn a wɔreyɛ ɔyɛkyerɛ no bɛkɔ so akɔ n'adwuma mu na wɔhyɛɛ wɔn sɛ wɔbɛsan akɔ n'adwuma mu sɛ wɔpɛ sɛ wɔbɛsan akɔ n'adwuma mu.</s>

en: This follows a statement issued by Deputy President Constantino Chiwenga calling for all striking nurses to resign.
twi: Wei firi nsɛm a ɔmampanin abadiakyire ɔonstantino ɔhiwenga de ato dwa a ɔreka akyerɛ nɛɛse atuatefoɔ no nyinaa sɛ wɔmmfa wɔn nnwuma nto hɔ.
mt0: <pad> Ɛkɔɔ so wɔ nsɛm a Deputy President Constantino Chiwenga de too gua no sɛ nurses a wɔreyɛ strike no bɛsane ase.</s>

en: But Zimbabwe Doctors for Human Rights says the dismissal of children by the government as a nurse without a dismissal certificate is illegal.
twi: Nanso Zimbabwe Doctors for Human Rights se yi a aban no ayi anɛɛsefoɔ a wɔhwɛ mmɔfra so no adi nni mmara so ɛsiane sɛ anɛɛsefoɔ no nni ayidie abodin nkrataa.
mt0: <pad> Zimbabwe Doctors for Human Rights kaa sɛ, sɛ wɔde mmofra no firi adwuma sɛ nnuruyɛfoɔ a wɔnnim sɛ wɔbɛkɔ so a, ɛno yɛ adeɛ a ɛho nhia.</s>

en: Football star Lionel Messi, who plays for Argentina and Spanish club Barcelona, ​​says he is breaking up his marriage with his country after failing to win a single trophy.
twi: Bɔɔlobɔni Lionel Messi a ɔbɔ bɔɔlo ma Argentina ne bɔɔlobɔkuo a ɛwɔ Spain a wɔfrɛ Barcelona sɛ ɔmmɔ bɔɔlo mma Argentina man no bio berɛ a wantumi annye kuruwa baako mpo.
mt0: <pad> Lionel Messi, a ɔde bɔ mmɔden wɔ Argentina ne Barcelona, kae sɛ ɔrebɛgyina ne man no ho bere a ɔantumi annye trophy biara.</s>

en: Messi made the remarks after the Copa America tournament hosted in the United States when Argentina lost in the final to Chile for the second time as Chile lifted the trophy.
twi: Messi de saa asɛm yi too dwa berɛ ɔopa AmErica agokansie a ɛkɔɔ so wɔ United States a Argentina dii nkukuo wɔ bɔɔlobɔ a ɛtwa toɔ wɔ akansie no mu aberɛ ɔhile hyɛɛ wɔn no gyee kuruwa no. Wei ne deɛ ɛtɔ so mmienu a ɔhile ahyɛ Argentina agye kuruwa no.
mt0: <pad> Messi kaa saa nsɛm yi akyi bere a Argentina nyaa Copa America ɔman no mu nkonim no a Chile bɛdii nkonim no a edi kan no.</s>

en: Chile defeated Argentina on Sunday when Francisco Silva drunkenly sent Argentine goalkeeper Sergio Romero to the wrong side.
twi: ɔhile hyɛɛ Argentina Kwasiada aberɛ a Francisɔo Silva bɔɔ bɔɔlo no too baabi Argentina gookipa Sergio Romero antumi anyɛ ho hwee.
mt0: <pad> Chile defeated Argentina on Sunday when Francisco Silva drunkenly sent Argentine goalkeeper Sergio Romero to the wrong side.</s>

en: The two teams had drawn 0-0 in front of 82,000 supporters in East Rutherford in New Jersey.
twi: Aman mmienu yi ko teeɛ aberɛ a obiara anto antena wɔ nnipadɔm 82,000 a na wɔwɔ East Rutherford a ɛwɔ New York ɛersey anim.
mt0: <pad> Ɔman no mu mmienu no ayɛ 0-0 wɔ East Rutherford, New Jersey, wɔ nnipa 82,000 anim.</s>

en: Teams playing in the Copa America come from North and South America.
twi: Aman a wɔbɔ ɔopa AmErica no nyinaa wɔ North ne South AmErica.
mt0: <pad> Teams a wɔde bɔ mmɔden wɔ Copa America no firi North ne South America.</s>

en: Three years ago, Argentina lost to Chile in the finals after the teams drew 0-0 again. Messi scored the first penalty and failed. Argentina lost 4-2 on penalties.
twi: Mfeɛ mmiɛnsa a ɛtwaa mu no, Argentina dii nkukuo wɔ ɔhile nsa nano berɛ a wɔko tee a obiara nhyɛ bi. Messi antumi anhyɛ ne panaati no. Argentina dii nkukuo 4-2 wɔ panaatis no mu.
mt0: <pad> Ɛtɔ so mmiɛnsa no, Argentina kɔɔ Chile wɔ finals bere a ɛyɛ 0-0 na Messi de penalty no bɛtow no nanso ɔde n'ani akyerɛɛ. Argentina kɔɔ 4-2 wɔ penalties.</s>

en: Messi then told Argentina's TyC Sports broadcaster that he had stopped playing for Argentina because he had failed to win the trophy despite his ambition.
twi: Afei Messi de too Tyɔ Sports nsɛntwerɛni anim sɛ ɔmmɔ bɔɔlo mma Argentina bio ɛsiane sɛ wantumi annye kuruwa no ɛmfa ho sɛ na ɛyɛ n’anisoadehunu.
mt0: <pad> Messi kaa sɛ ɔkɔgyinaa Argentina's TyC Sports broadcaster no sɛ ɔkɔgyinaa Argentina nti ɔyɛɛ n’adwene sɛ ɔbɛnya trophy no deɛ ɔpɛɛ.</s>

en: Messi is 29 years old.
twi: Messi adi mfeɛ aduonu nkron.
mt0: <pad> Messi yɛ 29 afe.</s>

en: And he managed to win four Champions League trophies with Barcelona. But he has not won a Copa America or World Cup with Argentina.
twi: ɔde Barcelona agye Champions League kuruwa no nnan. Nso, ɔntumi mfaa Argentina nnyee ɔopa AmErica anaa World ɔup.
mt0: <pad> Na ɔtumi gye Champions League nnwom nnan wɔ Barcelona. Nanso ɔnni Copa America anaa World Cup wɔ Argentina.</s>

en: Some patients in Bulawayo were failing treatment at two of the city's largest public hospitals when a doctor's strike entered its fourth day on Tuesday.
twi: Ayarefoɔ bi a wɔwɔ Bulawayo nnya ayarehwɛ wɔ kuropɔn no aban ayaresabea mu ɛsiane adɔkotafoɔ atuateɛ a wɔate nna nnan ni.
mt0: <pad> Ɛsɛ sɛ wuhu sɛ nnipa bi wɔ Bulawayo a wɔwɔ ɔhaw no mu no nni yɛkyerɛ wɔ ayaresabea mmienu a ɛwɔ kuro no mu no bere a drɔba no kɔɔ so ayɛ ayɛkyerɛ wɔ nna a ɛtɔ so nnan no.</s>

en: When Studio7 arrived at Mpilo Hospital during the day, some patients were being sent home as they were being treated for serious illnesses such as pregnant women with birth defects.
twi: Bere a Studio 7 duruu Mpilo ayaresabea hɔ no, na ayarefoɔ bi a wɔn yareɛ no ano yɛ akɛseɛ te sɛ apemfoɔ a wɔn mmɔtɔfowa ho atɔ kyɛm no, na wɔagya wɔn kwan ma wɔkɔ fie.
mt0: <pad> When Studio7 arrived at Mpilo Hospital during the day, some patients were being sent home as they were being treated for serious illnesses such as pregnant women with birth defects.</s>

mt0: <pad> Ɔmanfoɔ bi a wɔn din ne Ms Dlamini kae Studio7 sɛ ɔkɔɔ ayaresabea na yɛkyerɛɛ no sɛ ɔsan kɔɔ fie sɛ yɛnhu nnuru a ɛwɔ ne nan mu na wɔkae sɛ ɔbɛkɔ fie sɛ yɛnhu nnuru a ɛwɔ ne nan mu.</s>

en: Zimbabwe Hospital Doctors Association spokesman Dr Mthabisi Bhebhe said doctors were continuing to strike across the country despite government calls for them to return to work, saying they had not heard from the government.
twi: Zimbabwe Hospital Doctors associationkasamafoɔ, Dr Mthabisi Bhebhe kaa sɛ, adɔkotafoɔ da so de wɔn mfidie agu hɔ ɛmfa ho sɛ aban no ahyɛ wɔn sɛ wɔnkɔ adwuma. Wɔkyerɛ sɛ, wɔntee hwee mfiri aban no hɔ.
mt0: <pad> Zimbabwe Hospital Doctors Association spokesman Dr Mthabisi Bhebhe said doctors were continuing to strike across the country despite government calls for them to return to work, saying they had not heard from the government.</s>

en: Dr Ndlovu said the poor state of affairs in hospitals, including the lack of medicines and other facilities, was the main reason for the strike.
twi: Dr Ndlovu kyerɛ nnoɔma a ɛnkɔ yie wɔ ayaresabea a nti a wɔse wɔnkɔ adwuma no ne sɛ wɔnni nnuro ɛnne asetenam ahiadeɛ.

en: Studio 7 was unable to hear the government's side of the story as we were unable to contact the health minister, Dr Obadiah Moyo.
twi: Studio 7 ntumi ne Dr Obadiah Moyo a ɔyɛ ɔsoafoɔ a ɔhwɛ apɔmmuden nsɛm so nkaeɛ nti wɔntee aban no anodisɛm wɔ asɛm no ho.
mt0: <pad> Studio 7 antumi ankɔ sɛdeɛ aban no bɛka saa asɛm yi ho esiane sɛ yɛantumi ankɔ sɛdeɛ ɔmanpanin a ɔhwɛ adwumayɛfoɔ, Dr Obadiah Moyo, bɛkae.</s>

en: But Dr Moyo's deputy, Dr John Mangwiro, told Studio 7 on the phone that they could not comment on the matter as they were out of the country and the department's secretary, Dr Gerald Gwinji, did not return calls.
twi: Nanso Dr Moyo abadiakyire, Dr John Mangwiro de too Studio 7 anim wɔ tetefon so sɛ, mprempren yi ara deɛ wɔntumi nka asɛm no ho hwee ɛsiane sɛ wɔnni ɔman no mu. Asoeɛ no twerɛtwerɛfoɔ, Dr. Gerald Gwinɛi nso antumi ne yɛn ankasa.
