en: Former Highlanders player and coach Barry Daka, 71, has died after a short illness.
twi: Barry Daka a na ɔyɛ kookyi ne bɔɔlobɔni ma Highlanders no awu berɛ a yareɛ bi a bɔɔ no mmerɛ tiawa bi mu . ɔdii mfeɛ aduoson baako.
mt0: <pad> Barry Daka, 71, a na ɔyɛ Highlanders player ne coach, akɔsɛe bere tenten akyi.</s>

en: Their daughter, Lorraine has told Studio 7 that her father passed away today at their home in Barbourfields.
twi: Ne babaa Lorraine de too Studio 7 anim sɛ, ne papa firii mu nnɛ wɔ wɔn fie a ɛwɔ Barbourfield.
mt0: <pad> Lorraine a wɔn nua no kae Studio 7 sɛ papa no wui ɛnnɛ wɔ wɔn fie wɔ Barbourfields.</s>

en: He said they became ill on Sunday when they were leaving a concert at Barbourfields Stadium and he is thought to have suffered a stroke.
twi: ɔse ɔyaree Kwasiada berɛ na wɔrefiri kɔnsɛt bi wɔ Barbourfields Stadium ase, ɛnna wɔgye di sɛ nnwodwoeɛ na ɔkumm no.
mt0: <pad> Ɔkaa sɛ wɔpiraa no bɛyɛɛ ɔmantam no mu no bere a wɔrekɔ nnwomdua no wɔ Barbourfields Stadium na wɔsusu sɛ ɔwɔ stroke.</s>

en: The Highlangers team posted a message on Twitter saying they were "deeply saddened" by the death and said they were mourning the loss of their family and others in sports news.
twi: Highlanders bɔɔlobɔkuo no de too wɔn Twitter so sɛ, owuo no ayɛ wɔn ya na wɔde kaa ho sɛ, wɔresu wɔn abusuafoɔ ne wɔn a wɔkeka ho wɔn bɔɔlobɔ mu.
mt0: <pad> Ɔman no Highlangers kuo no de tweet kyerɛɛ sɛ wɔ "yɛn ani gye" ɔman no akɔsɛm no na wɔkaa sɛ wɔrekɔsɛm ɔman no ne wɔn abusua ne wɔn ho.</s>

en: The club says Mr Daka started coaching the team in 1986 and managed to lift several trophies including the Independence Cup, Chibuku Trophy, Rothmans Shield and NetBrew Cup.
twi: Bɔɔlobɔkuo no ka daa no adi sɛ, Owura Daka hyɛɛ ne koogyi adwuma ase no ase wɔ 1986 mu na ɔde wɔn gyee nkuruwa bebree a Independence ɔup, ɔhibuku Trophy, Rothmans Shield ne NetBrew ɔup no ka ho.
mt0: <pad> Club no kae sɛ Daka fii ase coach wɔ 1986 na ɔtumi nyaa nnwom pii a ɛwɔ Independence Cup, Chibuku Trophy, Rothmans Shield ne NetBrew Cup.</s>

en: Arrangements for Mr Daka's funeral have not yet been announced.
twi: Owura Daka ayie ho ntotoeɛ nnya mmaa abɔntene.
mt0: <pad> Arrangements for Mr Daka's funeral have not yet been announced.</s>

en: Prominent musician Thomas Mapfumo says he will join other Zimbabwean children who will protest next month in New York at the start of the United Nations General Assembly, which is expected to be attended by President Robert Mugabe.
twi: Thomas Mapfumo a ɔyɛ dwontoni kɛseɛ no se, ɔbɛka Zimbabwefoɔ a wɔybɛyɛ ɔyɛkyerɛ atia wɔn mampanin Robert Mugabe wɔ United Nations General Assembly ɛrebɛba so wɔ New York wɔ bosome a ɛdi yɛn anim yi mu.
mt0: <pad> Zimbabwean sɔretiafo Thomas Mapfumo kaa sɛ ɔbɛka Zimbabwean mmofra a wɔbɛyɛ demonstration wɔ New York no mu wɔ United Nations General Assembly a ɛbɛkɔ so no.</s>

en: Mr Mapfumo said it was important for Zimbabweans to show their displeasure with the way things were going in the country as it was everyone's right to do so if things did not go well.
twi: Owura Mapfumo kaa sɛ, ɛho hia sɛ Zimbabwefoɔ bɛda no adi sɛ wɔn ani nnye deɛ ɛrekɔ so wɔ wɔn man no, na sɛ nnoɔma nkɔ yie a, ɛyɛ ɔmam mma no asɛdeɛ sɛ wɔyɛ ɔyɛkyerɛ.
mt0: <pad> Mr Mapfumo kyerɛɛ sɛ Zimbabwefoɔ no hia sɛ wɔkyerɛ wɔn nsunsuansoɔ a wɔwɔ sɛ nneɛma rekɔ so wɔ Zimbabwe esiane sɛ ɛyɛ nnipa nyinaa ade sɛ wɔbɛyɛ saa sɛ nneɛma nni ɔkwan yiye.</s>

en: Mr Mapfumo said he would not be playing the guitar during the protest as he wanted to join Zimbabweans in showing the world government, especially President Mugabe, that things needed to change in the country.
twi: Owura Mapfumo se ɔremmɔ ahomansia berɛ a ɔyɛkyerɛ no rekɔ so na ɔne Zimbabwefoɔ no bɛka abom ayɛ akyerɛ wiase nyinaa aban nkanka ɔmampanin Mugabe sɛ ɛwɔ sɛ nnoɔma sesa wɔ ɔman no mu.
mt0: <pad> Ɔkaa sɛ ɔbɛn Zimbabwean a wɔreyɛ ɔyɛkyerɛ no sɛ ɔbɛkɔ Zimbabwean a wɔreyɛ ɔyɛkyerɛ no mu sɛ adeɛ hia sɛ ɛsesa wɔ Zimbabwe.</s>

en: "I am a musician but at the New York I will not be singing I will be joining others to protest against the corruption and oppression of Zimbabweans by the Mugabe government which is no longer popular," Mapfumo told Studio 7.
twi: Mapfumo ka kyerɛɛ Studio 7 sɛ, “Meyɛ dwontoni nanso ɛwɔ New York mɛka afoforɔ ho ayɛ ama yɛyɛ ɔyɛkyerɛ atia kɛtɛasehyɛ ne nhyɛsoɔ a Mugabe aban no de Zimbabwefoɔ refam no.
mt0: <pad> "Meyɛ ɔkwantuni nanso wɔ New York no, me nkɔsoa nkaeɛ, me ne afoforɔ bɛka sɛdeɛ Zimbabwefoɔ a wɔwɔ mu no yɛ ɔkyeree ne ɔhaw a Mugabe a ɔdi so no adi."</s>

en: Organizations such as #ThisFlag led by Pastor Evan Mawarire, Tajamuka, Occupy Africa Unity Square and other NGOs and political parties affiliated with Zimbabweans from different cities are expected to join the protest.
twi: Yɛrehwɛ anim sɛ ekuo a yɛfrɛ wɔn #Thisflag a ɔsɔfoɔ Evans Mawarie da ano, Taɛamuka kuo Oɔɔupy Africa Unity Square, NGOs ne Zimbabwe amanyɔkuo akyitaafoɔ ahodoɔ bɛbɛ abɛka ɔyɛkyerɛ yi ho.
mt0: <pad> Zimbabwean a wɔwɔ nkuro ahorow no bɛka ɔyɛkyerɛ no ho.</s>

en: Others expected to be at the rally include Patson Dzamara, the younger brother of human rights activist Itai Dzamara, who went missing last year.
twi: Wɔn a wɔbɛba dwumadie no ase bi ne Patson Dzamara a ɔyɛ Itai Dzamara a ɔko ma nnipa yiedie a ɔyerae afe a ɛtwaa mu no nua kumaa.
mt0: <pad> Ɔkaa sɛ Patson Dzamara, ɔtɔɔ so mmienu a ɔbɛkɔ ɔman no mu yɛkyerɛkyerɛ no, na ɔbɛkɔ ɔman no mu wɔ ɔman no mu yɛkyerɛkyerɛ no.</s>

en: The Amalgamated Rural Teachers Union of Zimbabwe (ARTUZ) says there are no talks between the government and teachers on resolving teachers' grievances.
twi: Amalgamated Rural Teachers of Zimbabwe (ARTUZɔ kyerɛ sɛ nkɔmmɔ twetweɛ biara nkɔɔ so wɔn aban no ne akyerɛkyerɛfoɔ ntam sɛ wɔresiesie ɔhaw a ɛda akyerɛkyerɛfoɔ so.
mt0: <pad> Amalgamated Rural Teachers Union of Zimbabwe (ARTUZ) kae sɛ nnipa a wɔkyerɛ sukuu no ne aban no nni agodie wɔ ɔkwan a wɔbɛfa so yɛɛ nsɛm a ɛwɔ nsɛm a wɔkyerɛ sukuu no ho.</s>

en: ARTUZ president Obert Masaraure told Studio7 that his organization was unhappy to see students lacking funding for education, while teachers lacked funds to go to work.
twi: Obert Masaure a ɔyɛ ARTUZ kannifoɔ kyerɛɛ mu kyerɛɛ Studio 7 sɛ, ɛnyɛ adwumakuo no dɛ sɛ wɔbɛhunu asukuufoɔ a wɔnnya sika ntoa wɔn nnwomasua so, nkanka ne akyerɛkyerɛfoɔ a wɔdi hia no.
mt0: <pad> ARTUZ president Obert Masaraure kyerɛ Studio7 sɛ, ɔyɛ nsunsuanso sɛ adesuafo nni sika a wɔde bɛkɔ sukuu, na adesuafo nso nni sika a wɔde bɛkɔ sukuu.</s>

en: Masaraure said many members of his party were writing letters of resignation saying they were looking for other jobs as their salaries were not enough to support their families.
twi: Masaraure kaa sɛ, esiane sɛ akyerɛkyerɛfoɔ no akatua ɛnso wɔn ne wɔn abusuafoɔ no nti, wɔretwerɛ nkrataa agyae adwuma no akɔhwehwɛ adwuma foforɔ.
mt0: <pad> Masaraure kaa sɛ nnipa pii a wɔwɔ ne kuo no rekɔ so sɛ wɔbɛyɛ adwuma afoforo esiane sɛ wɔn sika a wɔdi no ɛnkɔɔ so ma wɔn abusua.</s>

en: We have not been able to contact the Minister of Education, Professor Paul Mavhima, to hear his side of the story.
twi: Yɛntumi ne ɔsoafoɔ a ɔhwɛ nwomasua so, ɔbenfoɔ Paul Mavhima nnii nkɔmmɔ ntie n’ano asɛm.
mt0: <pad> Ɛnyɛ yɛn adwene sɛ yɛbɛka sɛ yɛnim.</s>

en: As the world marks October as Breast Cancer Awareness Month, the Cancer Association of Zimbabwe says it is deeply concerned about the misunderstanding of some people in the country.
twi: Sɛdeɛ wiase nyinaa ayi Ahinime bosome asi hɔ sɛ wɔde bɛbɔ dawuru afa kokoram yadeɛ a ɛtɔ mmaa nofo mu no, ɔanɔer associationof Zimbabwe kyerɛ sɛ wɔdwene ho wɔn sɛ nnipa bi nnim hwee fa yareɛ no ho wɔ ɔman no mu.
mt0: <pad> Ɔman no bɛka Ɔbenem sɛ Breast Cancer Awareness Month, Cancer Association of Zimbabwe kaa sɛ ɛyɛ ne ho nsunsuansoɔ sɛ nkurɔfoɔ bi wɔ Zimbabwe bɛte aseɛ sɛ wɔnim breast cancer.</s>

en: The organization reports that many people who claim to have been diagnosed with cancer, first go to a psychiatrist or a psychiatrist, and then to a specialist for serious illness, making it difficult to treat.
twi: Kuo yi amannebɔ kyerɛ sɛ wɔn a wɔka wɔanya kokoram yadeɛ no di nkan kɔhunu wɔn a wɔhwɛ adwene mu yadeɛ no ansa na wɔakɔ wɔn a wɔatu wɔn ho asi hɔ sɛ wɔbɛboa ahwɛ wɔn a wɔanya kokoram yadeɛ no hɔ. Sɛ ɛkɔba no saa nso a, ɛma yadeɛ no ko yɛ den pa ara.
mt0: <pad> Ɔman no kaeɛ sɛ nnipa pii a wɔka sɛ wɔwɔ cancer, kɔɔ psychiatrist anaa psychiatrist, na ɛkɔɔ specialist a ɔyɛ adwuma wɔ nnuru yareɛ ho, ɛma ɛyɛ den sɛ wɔbɛgye wɔn.</s>

en: Cancer Association of Zimbabwe consultant Priscilla Mangwiro said it was important for people to go to a qualified doctor if they had the problem.
twi: Priscilla Mangwiro a ɔyɛ ɔanɔer associationof Zimbabwe kɔnsɔɔltant de ato dwa sɛ ɛtwa sɛ wɔn a wɔanya saa yadeɛ kɔ adɔkotafoɔ a wɔaben wɔ kokoram yadeɛ ho kɔgye ayarehwɛ.
mt0: <pad> Cancer Association of Zimbabwe consultant Priscilla Mangwiro said it was important for people to go to a qualified doctor if they had the problem.</s>

en: Ms Mangwiro says it is important for people to be screened for cancer, especially breast cancer.
twi: Awuraa Mangwiro kyerɛ sɛ ɛho hia sɛ berɛ-ano-berɛ-ano nnipa bɛkɔ ayaresabea sɛ wɔnhwehwɛ wɔn nnipadua mu nhwɛ sɛ wɔanya kokoram yadeɛ no bi ahinta a, nkanka ne nofoɔ mu kokoram.
mt0: <pad> Ms Mangwiro kae sɛ ɛho hia sɛ nkurɔfoɔ bɛkɔ ayɛ nhwehwɛmu wɔ kanser ho, ne titire ne breast cancer.</s>

en: Ms. Mangwiro says breast cancer is the second leading cause of death for women in Zimbabwe.
twi: Awuraa Mangwiro kyerɛ sɛ nofoɔ mu kokoram yɛ yareɛ a ɛtɔ so mmienu a ɛreku mmaa wɔ Zimbabwe.
mt0: <pad> Ms. Mangwiro kaa sɛ breast cancer yɛ ɔkwan a ɛtɔ so mmienu a ɛma mmaa kɔkɔɔ wɔ Zimbabwe.</s>

en: Ms. Mangwiro says that since October 1, when it launched its campaign to mark October as Cancer Awareness Month, its organization has tested more than 50 women, and the number will continue to rise until the end of this month.
twi: Awuraaa Mangwiro kaa sɛ, ɛfiri Ahinime da a ɛdi kan no a wɔhyɛɛ aseɛ bɔɔ nofoɔ kokoram mu dawuro no, n’adwumakuo ne de mmaa a wɔboro aduonum na afa afidie ahwɛ sɛ wɔwɔ yadeɛ no bi anaasɛ wɔnni yadeɛ no bi. Na nɔmma no bɛkɔ soro kɔsi bosome no awieeɛ.
mt0: <pad> Ms. Mangwiro kae sɛ efi Ɔpɛpɔm 1, bere a wɔde yɛɛ nhwehwɛmu no sɛ Ɔpɛpɔm bɛyɛ Cancer Awareness Month, nnipa bɛboro 50 na wɔasi wɔn nsa sɛ wɔwɔ cancer, na nnipa no bɛkɔ so akɔ soro kosi Ɔpɛpɔm awiee.</s>

en: After hearing about the Cancer Association of Zimbabwe program, a woman, Gertrude Magwaniza, said she took her daughter for a lump in her breast.
twi: Berɛ ɔtee ɔanɔer associationof Zimbabwe dwumadie no ho asɛm no, ɔbaa a wɔfrɛ no Gertrude Magwaniza de too dwa sɛ ɔde ne babaa kɔɔ hɔ na wɔhunuu kokoram wɔ ne nofo mu.
mt0: <pad> Ɔbaa bi, Gertrude Magwaniza, kae sɛ ɔde ne baa maa lump wɔ ne breast no.</s>

en: Ms Mangwiro says there are many factors that put women at risk of developing breast cancer.
twi: Awuraa Mangwira kyerɛ sɛ nnoɔma bebree na ɛtumi ma mmaa nya nofoɔ mu kokoram.
mt0: <pad> Ms Mangwiro kae sɛ nneɛma pii na ɛma mmaa bɛtumi anya breast cancer.</s>

en: Ms Mangwiro says women need to be monitored for changes in their breasts, and if they do, they should be screened immediately.
twi: Awuraa Mangwira de too dwa sɛ ɛwɔ sɛ wɔma wɔn ani kɔ nsesaeɛ a ɛba mmaa nofo mu. Wɔyɛ saa a wɔbɛhunu sɛ wɔwɔ nofom kokoram anaa wɔnni bi.
mt0: <pad> Ms Mangwiro ka sɛ mmaa hia sɛ wɔhwɛ sɛ wɔn breasts no yɛ adeɛ, na sɛ wɔhu sɛ ɛkɔ so a, wɔbɛyɛ nhwehwɛmu ntɛm.</s>

en: Ms Mangwiro says many people think that being diagnosed with cancer means they are dying but there is a lot that can be done to help women live longer.
twi: Awuraa Mangwiro kaa sɛ mmaa dodoɔ no ara dwene sɛ sɛ wɔnya kokoram a na ɛkyerɛ sɛ wɔrebɛwu, nanso nnoɔma bebree na wɔbɛtu ayɛ ama mmaa atena wiase akye.
mt0: <pad> Ms Mangwiro kae sɛ nkurɔfo pii susuw sɛ sɛ wɔbɛnya cancer no a, ɛno kyerɛ sɛ wɔrekɔwu, nanso adeɛ bebree betumi ayɛ sɛ ɛbɛboa mmaa ma wɔtena nkwa mu.</s>

en: Ms. Mangwiro says one of the main causes of cancer is eating a diet high in fat and sugar.
twi: Awuraa Mangwiro kyerɛ sɛ adeɛ baako a ɛma kokoram ne nnuane a anwa ne asikyire wɔ mu bebree.
mt0: <pad> Ms. Mangwiro kae sɛ ɔkwan baako a ɛma cancer no yɛ sɛ wobɛdi nnuane a ɛwɔ nnua ne sukɔkɔɔ mu.</s>

en: Ms. Mangwiro is urging women to take advantage of the October opportunity to get tested for cancer, as well as to be educated about the disease.
twi: Awuraa Mangwiro atu mmaa fo sɛ wɔmfa saa akwannya yi so nkɔhwɛ wɔ wɔwɔ kokoram anaa wɔnni bi, na wɔmma wɔn nimdeɛ mfa yadeɛ no ho.
mt0: <pad> Ms. Mangwiro rekyerɛ nnipa mmaa sɛ wɔbɛfa Ɔpɛpɔm no mu mmerɛ no sɛ wɔbɛyɛ nhwehwɛmu ma cancer, ne adesua a wɔbɛnya sɛ wɔbɛnim yare no ho.</s>

en: More than 5,000 people are infected every year and more and more will see a pediatrician for a serious illness.
twi: Nnipa boro mpem num na afe biara wɔnya yadeɛ yi bi na yareɛ a ɛyɛ hu de nnipa dodoɔ no ara bɛkɔ adɔkorafoɔ hɔ.
mt0: <pad> Ɛboro 5,000 mmaa na wɔn yare afe biara na ɛbɛyɛ sɛ wɔbɛkɔ Pediatrician no sɛ wɔn yare no yɛ den.</s>

en: The state-owned petrol company Petrotrade says if the government continues to set prices for the purchase and sale of motor fuel, the problem of fuel shortages will not go away.
twi: Aban pɛtro dwumakuo, Petrotrade se sɛ aban no kɔso kyerɛ sɛdeɛ wɔntɔ anaa wɔtɔ fango a, ɛnneɛ fango a ɛho akɔ atwee no nkɔ da.
mt0: <pad> Petrotrade kyerɛ sɛ sɛ aban no bɛkɔ so ayɛ nnipa sika a wɔde bɛtɔ motor fuel no, ɛno nti ɛho nhyehyɛe a ɛwɔ hɔ no bɛkɔ so ayɛ nnipa sika a wɔde bɛtɔ motor fuel no ho.</s>

en: Responding to a parliamentary proposal on fuel prices, former Petrotrade chief executive Godfrey Ncube said this was only possible if businesses were given the opportunity to buy fuel and sell at their own expense.
twi: ɔde n’anodisɛm fa mmarahyɛbadwafie fango boɔ nhyehyɛeɛ reto dwa no, Petrotrade krakye panin dadaa Godfrey Nɔube de too dwa sɛ sɛ wɔma adwumakuo akwannya ma wɔtɔ anaa wɔtɔn fango sɛdeɛ wɔn ara pɛ a, wei bɛyɛ yie.
mt0: <pad> Ɔmanpanin no a na ɔyɛ Petrotrade chief executive Godfrey Ncube kaa sɛ saa bɛtumi aba so sɛ wɔma adwumakuw no hokwan sɛ wɔbɛtɔ fuel na wɔde bɛkɔ sikasɛm no mu.</s>

en: Mr Ncube acknowledged that doing so would raise prices but said it was the only way out of the country's long-running oil crisis.
twi: Owura Nɔube gye too mu sɛ, wei bɛma boɔ akɔ soro nanso ɛno ara ne kwan a ɔman no bɛtumi asi ɔhaw no ano.
mt0: <pad> Ncube kyerɛɛ sɛ ɛbɛyɛ denam nsuo mu no, nanso ɔkae sɛ ɛbɛma nsuo mu no ayɛ denam nsuo mu no.</s>

en: Mr Ncube said waiting for the government's oil supply was slowing down oil prices in the country as they were getting more fuel in the long run.
twi: Mr Nɔube de too dwa wɔretwɛn aban no fango ma fango boɔ no kɔ fam wɔ ɔman no mu, na daakye no wɔbɛnya fango bebree.
mt0: <pad> Ncube kaa sɛ, sɛ wɔbɛhwɛ sɛ aban no de nnuane bɔ nsuo mu no, na ɛbɛyɛ den sɛ nsuo bɛkɔ so ayɛ den wɔ ɔman no mu esiane sɛ wɔbɛnya nnuane pii wɔ mmerɛ tenten mu.</s>

en: Mr Ncube pointed out the shortage of fuel purchased by government assistance with the example he gave, saying that in the first six months last year, they sold 50 million liters, but in the same period this year they sold only 36 million liters.
twi: Mr Nɔube kyerɛ sɛ fango a aban no tɔ a ɛhɔ akɔ atwee no ho nhwɛsoɔ a ɔde too dwa ne sɛ, bosome nsia a na ɛdi afe a ɛtwaam no anim no, wɔtɔnn fango lita ɔpepem aduonum, nanso saa mmerɛ koraa no mu afe yi mu, wɔatɔn lita ɔpepem aduasa nsia pɛ.
mt0: <pad> Mr Ncube kyerɛɛ sɛ fuel a wɔde kɔɔ nsuo mu no yɛ den a wɔde kɔɔ nsuo mu no yɛ den a, ɔkae sɛ wɔde 50 million liters kɔɔ nsuo mu afe yi a edi kan no, na wɔde 36 million liters kɔɔ nsuo mu afe yi.</s>

en: Asked when her department hopes to address the fuel shortage crisis, fire department secretary Gloria Magombo said the problem would not go away if foreign investment was low.
twi: Berɛ wɔbisaa no kwan a ɔbɛfa so asiesie fango a ɛho akɔ atwee no, ɔtwerɛtwerɛfoɔ ma wɔn a wɔdum gya, Gloria Magombo kaa sɛ ɔhaw no nkɔ aberɛ wɔn a wɔde wɔn dwetire abɛhyɛ ɔman no mu so.
mt0: <pad> Gloria Magombo, fire department secretary, said the problem would not go away if foreign investment was low.</s>

en: He also said that addressing the issue needs the whole country and not just his department.
twi: ɔsan nso kyerɛ sɛ wɔresɔ ɔhaw no ano a, ɛhia ɔman no nyinaa na nyɛ n’asoeɛ no nko ara.
mt0: <pad> Ɔkaa sɛ ɔbɛfa saa asɛm no ho no, ɔkyerɛɛ sɛ ɔhia ɔman no nyinaa na ɛnyɛ ne adwumakuw no pɛ.</s>

en: Asked whether the plan to use the Smart Card to buy fuel was mentioned by the governor of the central bank, John Mangudya, when he said the card would show the amount of fuel consumed by each car in the garage used to buy the fuel, Ms Magombo said the plan was reversed by the COVID-19 scandal. there was a need to buy in China.
twi: Awuraa Magombo rekyerɛ n’adwene fa sɛ wɔde semaate kaade bɛtɔ fango sɛdeɛ amrado a ɔda CentralBank, John Mangudya de too dwa sɛ kaade no bɛkyerɛ fango dodoɔ a wo lɔɔre no anom no, ɔde too dwa sɛ nhyehyɛeɛ amma mu ɛsiane COVID-19 yareɛ no.
mt0: <pad> Ɔkaa sɛ wɔde Smart Card no bɛtɔ fuel no, Ms Magombo kaa sɛ ɛyɛ ade a ɛho hia sɛ wɔtɔ fuel no wɔ China.</s>

en: Ms Magombo said she could not say when the plan would be successful, although Mr Mangudya told the committee last month that he hoped by the end of June they would try to use the card to see if it worked as intended.
twi: Awuraa Magombo de too dwa sɛ ɔntumi nkyerɛ berɛ nhyehyɛeɛ no bɛyɛ yie mfa ho sɛ Owura Mangudya ka kyerɛɛ kɔmitee bosome a ɛtwaa mu no sɛ ɔwɔ anidasoɔ sɛ Kɔtɔnima bosome no nkɔ awieeɛ wɔbɛtumi de kaade no adi dwuma sɛdeɛ wɔaka no.
mt0: <pad> Ms Magombo kaa sɛ ɔbɛtumi aka bere a ɔbɛyɛ adwuma, nanso Mr Mangudya kaa sɛ wɔbɛbɔ mmɔden sɛ wɔde kɔdɔm no bɛyɛ adwuma ansa na June awiee no.</s>

en: This has angered a parliamentary committee that has said the fire department is failing to do its job as Ms Magombo also said she had heard from members of the committee today that many petrol stations in the country were selling for US dollars or foreign currency coupons.
twi: Wei maa mmarahyɛbadwa kɔmitee bo afu na wɔde ato dwa sɛ wɔn a wɔdum gya no nyɛ wɔn adwuma yie. Sɛdeɛ Awuraa Magombo nso kaa sɛ wɔate afiri kɔmitee no kuo mma hɔ nnɛ sɛ, beaeɛ a wɔtɔ pɛtrol wɔn ɔman no mu bebree no, wɔde AmErica dɔla no na ɛtɔ.
mt0: <pad> Ɔmanpanin no akɔhwɛ sɛ ɔbɛyɛ ne dwuma no yiye na ɔkae sɛ ɔde nsuo a ɛwɔ Ghanafoɔ nsase no bɛtɔ nsuo no mu.</s>

en: The committee said it was "deeply concerned" that many developments in the country are being affected by the shortage of fuel.
twi: Kɔmitee no de too dwa sɛ wɔredwene ho sɛ fango a akɔ atwee no renya nnoɔma so nsunsuansoɔ wɔ ɔman no mu.
mt0: <pad> Ɔmanpanin no kaa sɛ ɔyɛ "nteaseɛ paa" sɛ nsuo mu dwumadie pii wɔ ɔman no mu no bɛkɔ so akɔ so ɛfiri sɛ fuel a ɛwɔ hɔ no nni hɔ.</s>

en: Zimbabweans on Saturday mark the 40th anniversary of the country's independence from white supremacy, with blacks and other blacks being enslaved.
twi: Memeneda yi, Zimbabuefoɔ dii wɔn nnaduasa afahyɛ a wɔde dee wɔn ho firii aborɔfo nsɛm ni nkoasom a abibifoɔ kɔɔ mu no
mt0: <pad> Zimbabweans bɛyɛ afahyɛ 40th a wɔde kyerɛ sɛ wɔn man no afiri white supremacy, a na nnipa a wɔyɛ nkurofo ne nkurofo a wɔyɛ nkurofo no kɔɔ asraafo mu.</s>

en: The advent of black supremacy raised the hopes of many that they would eventually gain a white supremacy, many of whom had been thrown into the abyss by whites as they took all their good land.
twi: Saa Abibifoɔ fahoɔdii yi de anidasoɔ baa sɛ da bi wɔbɛnya Aborɔfo fahodii no bi
mt0: <pad> Ɔman no mu nnipa pii a wɔyɛɛ sɛ wɔbɛnya ɔman a ɛyɛ nkumaa no ho tumi no kɔɔ so no, na wɔn ho yɛ den ma wɔn a wɔwɔ ɔman a ɛyɛ nkumaa no ho tumi no, sɛ nkumaa no de wɔn nsa aka wɔn adeɛ no a, ɛno na ɛmaa wɔn a wɔyɛɛ sɛ wɔbɛnya ɔman a ɛyɛ nkumaa no ho tumi.</s>

en: But 40 years after the country gained independence, some of them have said things have gotten worse for them compared to the white supremacy, as they no longer have jobs to support their families.
twi: Nanso no mfeɛ aduanan akyiri a ɔman no nyaa fahodie no, nneɛma asɛe sene sɛ deɛ ɔsusui no mpo, wɔnni nnwuma mpo a wɔde reboa wɔn abusua
mt0: <pad> Nanso mfeɛ 40 akyi no, wɔn mu bi kae sɛ nneɛma ayɛ hu ma wɔn sene ɔman no kɔɔ so no, esiane sɛ wɔnni dwuma a wɔbɛboa wɔn abusua no.</s>

en: They say that the economic situation is so bad that it is difficult to know what the future holds.
twi: Wɔse adwadie nsɛm mpo nnyɛ a, wɔn hu deɛ wɔreyɛ mpo anaa deɛ daakye no wɔ ma wɔn
mt0: <pad> Ɔka sɛ, abɛyɛ no yɛ den nti ɛyɛ den sɛ wobɛte aseɛ sɛ yɛbɛte aseɛ sɛ yɛbɛte aseɛ.</s>

en: Health issues are said to be at an all-time low as many hospitals in the country are no longer functioning as expected.
twi: Apɔmuden nsɛm koraa nyɛ sene sɛdeɛ anka ɔman no rehwehwɛ afiri wɔn hɔ no
mt0: <pad> Ɔhaw a ɛfa adwene ho no yɛ ɔhaw a ɛyɛ den paa wɔ nkuro ahorow mu esiane sɛ ayaresabea a ɛwɔ ɔman no mu no nni dwuma sɛnea wɔhwɛ kwan sɛ wɔbɛyɛ.</s>

en: A few who are still working say that they often spend it on the streets protesting in order to earn a living.
twi: Kakra wɔn a wɔreyɛ adwuma no nso daa no wɔrekɔ atwe wɔn akwantenpɔn mu aperɛ deɛ eyɛ
mt0: <pad> Nnipa binom a wɔwɔ adwuma no ka sɛ wɔtaa kɔ ɔkwan so yɛkyerɛw wɔ ɔkwan so sɛ wɔbɛnya nkwa.</s>

en: The inauguration of former president Emmerson Mnangagwa in 2017, following the military ousting of former president Robert Mugabe, has given the public hope for a brighter future.
twi: ɔmanpanin Emmerson Mnanagagwa a wɔde no aba 2017, yi ɛnam ɔmanpanin Robert Mugabe a asraafoɔ no tuu no no ama ɔmanfoɔ anidaasoɔ
mt0: <pad> Ɔman panin Emmerson Mnangagwa a wɔde ɔman panin Robert Mugabe firi ɔman panin mu no, ɛma ɔman panin no anya asomdwoe sɛ ɔbɛkɔ ɔman panin a ɔyɛ papa.</s>

en: But most of them have been celebrating the witch and witch doctor, as they say things are getting worse.
twi: Nanso wɔn mu binom nhyɛ da nne wɔn ho a deɛ wɔgu reka ara ne sɛ nneɛma gye a na ɛregye nsam
mt0: <pad> Ɛnnim, nanso wɔn mu dodow no ara ayɛ afahyɛ ɔbɔɔso ne ɔbɔɔso ayaresa, esiane sɛ wɔka sɛ nneɛma rekɔ so ayɛ hu.</s>

en: But isn't there any good thing that Zanu PF has done for all these 40 years?
twi: Nti biribiara nni hɔ a ZanuPF amanyɔkuo no ayɛ ama ɔman no mfeɛ aduanan yi
mt0: <pad> Nanso ɛwɔ biribi papa biara a Zanu PF ayɛ wɔ afe 40 a atwam no mu?</s>

en: Zanu PF North American regional chairman Regis Charumbira says his party has done much to give land to blacks, regardless of party affiliation.
twi: Zanu amamnyɔkuo no North Amɛrɛka titenani no sɛ Regis ɔharumbira sɛ wɔn amanyɔkuo no ayɛ pii a wɔama Abibifoɔ nsaase sɛ woyɛ wɔn amanyɔkuo ba anaasɛ wɔnnyɛ amamnyɔkuo ba
mt0: <pad> Zanu PF North American regional chairman Regis Charumbira says his party has done much to give land to blacks, regardless of party affiliation.</s>

en: Mr Charumbira said his party had now completed an investigation into who had acquired more farms than others, and that those who had not yet acquired land, including Zimbabweans living abroad, should be acquired.
twi: Mr. Churumbira kaa sɛ, n’amanyɔkuo no awie nhwehwɛmu a afa wɔn a wɔanya nsaase a yɛde yɛ afuo ɛnna wɔn wɔn nso a wɔnnyaa bi no ɛsɛ sɛ wɔnya bi a wɔte amanɔne no
mt0: <pad> Ɔkaa sɛ ne nhwehwɛmu no bɛyɛɛ nnipa a wɔwɔ Zimbabwe a wɔnni asase, na ɔkaa sɛ Zimbabwean a wɔwɔ abroad no nso bɛnya asase.</s>

en: But Timothy Muringai, deputy secretary general of the MDC-T in North America, said Zanu PF had failed for many years to fulfill all the demands of the liberation struggle.
twi: Nanso Timothy Muringai, ɔtwerɛfoɔ abadiakyire a ɔwɔ MDC-T north Amɛrika amanyɔkuo no mu no antumi anni ne bɔhyɛ so.
mt0: <pad> MDC-T deputy secretary general Timothy Muringai, a ɔwɔ North America, kaeɛ sɛ Zanu PF nni nkitaho sɛ ɛbɛyɛ sɛ ɛbɛdi nnipa a wɔrebɔ ɔko no ho dwuma no ho dwuma.</s>

en: They say things have deteriorated for years in economic, health and business closures, leaving many workers on the streets unemployed.
twi: Wɔnse nneɛma asɛe mfeɛ pii wɔ adwadie mu, apomuden mu, adwumaguo mu ama nnipa pii no ara tete fie
mt0: <pad> Ɔkaeɛ sɛ nneɛma ayɛ hu wɔ afe mu wɔ sikasɛm, ayaresa ne adwumakuw a wɔde bɛtwa toɔ no mu, ɛmaa nnipa pii a wɔdi dwuma wɔ ɔkwan so a wɔn ho nni dwuma.</s>

en: Attorney Ntabazinduna Nhlanhlayamangwe Ndiweni or Lord Felix Ndiweni has appealed to the High Court today to challenge his sentence and sentence him to 18 months imprisonment.

en: Mr Chirisa said the problem of patients in government hospitals was exacerbated by the absence of young doctors and 533 doctors who had been suspended following a move by the Health Services Board.
twi: Mr ɔhirisa rekasa no ɔkaa sɛ nnipa a wɔrebɛgye ayarehwɛ abu so wɔ ayaresabea ahodoɔ no mu ɛnam dokotafoɔ bɛyɛ 533 a wɔmma adwuma no nti
mt0: <pad> Ɔkaa sɛ nnipa a wɔwɔ ayaresabea no mu no yɛ den paa esiane sɛ nnuru a wɔde ma ayaresa no nni hɔ ne ayaresa 533 a wɔde ma ayaresa no nni hɔ.</s>

en: The general secretary of the Zimbabwe Hospital Doctors Association, Mthabisi Anele Bhebhe, also said he was unhappy with the comments made yesterday by former president Constantino Chiwenga that young doctors were still in school.
twi: ɔtwerɛfo ma Zimbabwe Hospital Doctors Assoɔiation, Mthabisi Anele Bhebhe nso kaa sɛ, n’ani nnye asɛm a ɔmanpanin dada ɔonstantino ɔhiwenga kaa sɛ adɔkota nkumaa no gu so wɔ sukuu mu no
mt0: <pad> Zimbabwe Hospital Doctors Association general secretary, Mthabisi Anele Bhebhe, also said he was unhappy with the comments made yesterday by former president Constantino Chiwenga that young doctors were still in school.</s>

en: Chiwenga, who was appointed by the cabinet to lead the dialogue between the government and the striking doctors, fired the nurses after the strike.
twi: ɔhewenga a ɔkaa saa asɛm no no wɔfaa no sɛ ɔne nkɔmmɔtwetwe a ɔne aban no redie no anim mfa adɔkotafoɔ a wɔte fie no ho ne anɛɛsefoɔ a wɔn so te fie no ho
mt0: <pad> Chiwenga, a wɔde no adi dwumadie a ɛbɛkɔ so wɔ aban ne ayaresa nsrahwɛ mu no, kyeree ayaresa no bere a wɔdii ɔyɛkyerɛ no akyi.</s>

en: Their actions have been criticized by many who say Mr Chiwenga was using the military on issues that require dialogue.
twi: Wɔn anammɔntuo no pii no ara na wɔakasa atia, berɛ a wɔde asraafoɔ na ɛredi asɛm no
mt0: <pad> Ɔyɛkyerɛ no a wɔde di dwuma no akɔ so a wɔn ho yɛ hu sɛ nnipa pii kae sɛ Chiwenga reyɛ adwuma a ɛho hia nkitahodie.</s>

en: Young doctors say they want the government to provide them with medical equipment, medicine and protective clothing while on duty as well as an increase in salaries which they say is similar to dog taxes.
twi: Adɔkotafoɔ nketewa no se, ɛsɛ sɛ aban no ma wɔn akadeɛ ne ntaadeɛ a wɔde bɛyɛ adwuma berɛ a wɔreyɛ adwuma no na wɔsan nto wɔn akatua mu
mt0: <pad> Ɔdɔm a wɔyɛ adwuma no mu nsɛm kyerɛ sɛ wɔpɛ sɛ aban ma wɔn adeɛ, nnuru ne ntadeɛ a wɔbɛhyɛ wɔn so bere a wɔrekɔ dwuma no mu ne sika a ɛte sɛ dog taxes.</s>

en: But the government also says its coffers are so depleted that it cannot afford to increase them.
twi: Nanso aban no nso see wɔnni sika nti ɔntumi nyɛ deɛ wɔreka no
mt0: <pad> Nanso aban no nso ka sɛ n'adwumayɛbeae no ayɛ den paa na ɛntumi anya sika akɔ so.</s>

en: We were unable to hear the side of the health minister, Mr Obadiah Moyo, as he immediately attended a meeting with the pediatrician at the time we first went on air.
twi: Wɔatumi ante deɛ ɔsoafoɔ a ɔhwɛ apomuden so, Mr Obadia Moyo reka no a ɔkɔɔ pɛdiatiriki wɔ nhyimu no bi no
mt0: <pad> yɛntumi mfa ɔmanpanin a ɔhwɛ ayaresa ho, Obadiah Moyo, sɛdeɛ ɔkɔɔ nkitaho a ɔwɔ ne pediatrician no ntam bere a yɛdii kan wɔ air.</s>

en: The Labor Court has rejected the government's request as the government has not submitted any documents in its case against doctors who are not going to work.
twi: Labor kɔɔto no abu aban no agyinatuo no agu ɛnam sɛ aban no amfa nkrataa biara ankɔ
mt0: <pad> The Labor Court rejected the government's request because the government has not submitted any documents in its case against doctors who are not going to work.</s>

en: Doug Coltart, a lawyer representing the Zimbabwe Hospital Doctor's Association in Labor Court, said the court said there was not enough documentation from the Health Services Board, HSB, and therefore the matter could not be heard legally.
twi: Doug ɔoltart, mmaranimni a ɔgyina Zimbabwe Hospital Doctor's associationananmu wɔ Labor kɔɔto kyerɛ sɛ nkrataa papa biara mfii Health Services Board, HSB no hɔ mmae nti wɔntumi ntena asɛm no so
mt0: <pad> Doug Coltart, a ɔkyerɛwↄ Zimbabwe Hospital Doctors Association no wɔ Labor Court no kaeɛ sɛ nnipa a wɔde yɛ adwuma no bɛka nsɛm no nni nwoma a ɛho hia firi Health Services Board, HSB, na ɛno nti ɛho nsɛm no bɛtumi asane asɛm no adi adeɛ.</s>

en: The court ordered the HSB's lawyer to file the missing documents tomorrow, Wednesday.
twi: Kɔɔto no hyɛɛ HSB’s mmaranimfoɔ sɛ wɔnyɛ nkrataa no a ayera no ho adwuma wukuada
mt0: <pad> Ɔmanpanin no de HSB's lawyer no kɔkyerɛɛ sɛ ɔbɛtwerɛ nwoma a ɛho hia no ɛbɛda adi Ɔbenem, Wednesday.</s>

en: But doctors have also said that going to court is not the key to getting them to go to work, so it does not solve the problem.
twi: Nanso adɔkotafoɔ no se wɔrekɔ asɛnnibea no nyɛ adeɛ a ɛbɛma wɔasan aba adwuma
mt0: <pad> Ɛmfa ho sɛ nnuruyɛfoɔ no kaa sɛ kɔɔ asɛnnibea nkɔ gyinaeɛ sɛ wɔbɛkɔ adwuma, nti ɛmma ɛho nhyehyɛeɛ no mu.</s>

en: Former vice-president of the Zimbabwe Hospital Doctors Association, Doctor Masimba Ndoro, said his job required him to be on a daily basis and he needed to be paid for this.
twi: Ekuo yi manpaninabediakyire dada, Masiba Ndoro kaa sɛ n’adwuma no ɔhia sɛ wɔbɛtu ka da biara
mt0: <pad> Zimbabwe Hospital Doctors Association, Dr Masimba Ndoro, a ɔyɛɛ adwuma no nsutɔfo a ɔwɔ Zimbabwe, kae sɛ ɛsɛ sɛ wɔtua no sika sɛ ɔbɛkɔ n'adwuma no so da biara na ɛsɛ sɛ wɔtua no sika sɛ ɔbɛkɔ n'adwuma no so da biara.</s>

en: The junior doctors went on strike on September 3, saying they did not have enough resources to go to work.
twi: Adɔkotafoɔ nketewa no kɔɔ straeke ɛbɔ 3 a wɔreka sɛ wɔnni akodeɛ a wɔde yɛ adwuma
mt0: <pad> Junior doctors kɔɔ strike September 3, wɔkae sɛ wɔnni adeɛ a wɔbɛkɔ adwuma.</s>

en: Senior doctors from the Zimbabwe Senior Hospital Doctors' Association also went on strike last Thursday, complaining about poor pay and inadequate medical care.
twi: Adɔkotafoɔ mpaninfoɔ a wɔwɔ Zimbabwe Senior Hospital Doctors' association nso kɔɔ straeke Yawoada yi a wɔn nso sɛ wɔn akatua nyɛ na wɔnni apomuden akyiri asibaa biara
mt0: <pad> Zimbabwe Senior Hospital Doctors' Association no nso kɔɔ strike wɔn a wɔwɔ Zimbabwe no mu Ɔsanaa, ɛkyerɛɛ sɛ wɔnhu sika ne ayaresa ho dwumadie a ɛyɛ den.</s>

en: The senior doctors also wrote a letter complaining about the threats they were making and said it was useless for doctors to go to hospitals without adequate facilities to save patients' lives.
twi: Adɔkotafoɔ mpanyinfoɔ a wɔkyerɛɛ krataa faa de wɔrekɔ mu no sɛ, ɛyɛ nkwasɛm sɛ dɔkotafoɔ bɛkɔ adwuma berɛ a wɔnni akadeɛ a wɔde reyɛ adwuma
mt0: <pad> Ɔfese ayaresa no nso de nwoma too gua sɛ wɔreyɛ ɔhaw na wɔkae sɛ ɛnyɛ adwene sɛ ayaresa bɛkɔ ayaresabea a adeɛ nni hɔ sɛ ɛbɛboa yareɛ no nkwa.</s>

en: The doctors also criticized the government, saying the money had been increased by 60 percent, saying they did not agree with it.
twi: Adɔkotafoɔ no nso bɔɔ aban no akyi sɛ, wɔato akatua mu 60%, na wɔnte aseɛ
mt0: <pad> Ɔfese no mu ayaresfoɔ no nso kyerɛɛ aban no, sɛ wɔn sika no ayɛ kɛseɛ 60 percent, sɛ wɔn nni ho.</s>

en: Meanwhile, two other senior doctors have been suspended without pay by the University of Zimbabwe on charges of joining the strike and influencing others to resign.
twi: Berɛ koro no ara mu no, wɔayi, adɔkotafoɔ mmienu afiri hɔ a University of Zimbabwe se wɔaka straeki no hɔ, na wɔasan ama ntumi binom agyae adwuma.
mt0: <pad> Ɛnnɛ, nnuru mmienu a wɔyɛ adwuma no mu dodoɔ no ara na wɔde wɔn ho bɛkyerɛɛ Zimbabwe University no sɛ wɔkɔtwe wɔn nsuo so a wɔn nsa nni hɔ.</s>

en: Suspended is Dr. Bothwell Mbuvayesango, who specializes in pediatric surgery, with Drs. David Chimuka, an expert in the treatment of heart disease.
twi: Wɔatwe Dr. Bothwell Mbuvayesango asɛn ɔno nso na wɔabene wɔ pɛdiatiric nhwehwɛmu emu
mt0: <pad> Suspended is Dr. Bothwell Mbuvayesango, a specialist in pediatric surgery, with Drs. David Chimuka, an expert in the treatment of heart disease.</s>

en: The Zimbabwe Association of Doctors for Human Rights has strongly condemned the suspension of Dr. Mbuvayesangano with Dr. Get up.

mt0: <pad> Zimbabwe Association of Doctors for Human Rights has strongly condemned the suspension of Dr. Mbuvayesangano with Dr.</s>

en: We have not been able to hear from the University of Zimbabwe or to hear from the government on the state of health issues.
twi: Yɛntumi ntee mfiri University of Zimbabwe anaa aban no nka ɛfa ayarehwɛ ho
mt0: <pad> yɛntumi mfa Zimbabwe University no anaa aban no ho nsɛm a ɛfa adwene ho adeɛ a ɛwɔ hɔ no.</s>

en: But a statement from Health Minister Obadiah Moyo acknowledged that doctors had not heeded the government's call to return to work.
twi: Nanso nsɛnkae a ɛfiri apomuden soafoɔ, Health Minister Obadiah Moyo kyerɛ sɛ dɔkotafoɔ nsan nkɔ adwuma
mt0: <pad> Ɔman panin Obadiah Moyo kaa sɛ ayaresfoɔ no nni ɔman no kɔmmɔ sɛ wɔsan bɛkɔ adwuma.</s>

en: Moyo said the government was awaiting the outcome of the court proceedings, after which he informed the state of the situation.
twi: Moyo kaa sɛ, aban no retwe deɛ ɛbɛfiri asɛnnie no mu aba no, ɛno na ɛbɛkyerɛ deɛ aban no nyɛ
mt0: <pad> Moyo kaa sɛ aban no rehwɛ kwan a wɔbɛgyina ɔmanpanin no so, na ɔkaa sɛ ɔbɛkyerɛ ɔman no sɛ ɛnyɛ saa.</s>

en: Doctors went on strike on September 3, saying they did not have enough money to go to work.
twi: Adɔkotafoɔ tee atua ɛbɔ 3 no ɛnam sɛ wɔse wɔnni sika a wɔde kɔ adwuma
mt0: <pad> Ɔfese no mu ayaresa no kɔɔ strike September 3, wɔkae sɛ wɔnni sika a wɔde bɛkɔ adwuma.</s>

en: The government has signed an agreement with a foreign company to assist in the export of coal to countries such as India and Japan.
twi: Aban no ne ahɔhoɔ adwuma asan nteasɛ krataa sɛ wɔde koal bɛkɔ India ne ɛapan
mt0: <pad> Ɔmanpanin no de nsa hyɛɛ nsɛm a wɔde bɛka ɔman foforo ho sɛ ɛbɛboa sɛ ɛbɛtɔn kɔɔl kɔ aman te sɛ India ne Japan.</s>

en: Speaking at the signing of the agreement with Victoria Consulting, the Minister of Minerals, Winston Chitando, said the government's intention was for the country to have access to coal trading in India and to raise funds for mining.
twi: Berɛ a wɔrekasa fa nteasɛ apam a wɔne Viɔtoria ɔonsulting ayɛ no ɔsoafoɔ, Winston ɔhitando,  aban no anisoɔdehunu ne sɛ ɔman no bɛdi koah dwa
mt0: <pad> Ɔmanpanin a ɔhwɛ minerals, Winston Chitando, kaa sɛ ɔpɛ sɛ ɔman no bɛnya hokwan akɔtɔ coal trading wɔ India na ɔbɛgye sika akɔtɔ mining.</s>

en: Chitando said Zimbabwe has an estimated 25 billion tonnes of coal but between 2 and 3 million tonnes are mined annually.
twi: ɔhitando kaa sɛ Zimbabwe rehwe sɛ ɔde koal tɔnso ɔpepempem 25 na ɛbɛkɔ nanso no wɔrehwɛ sɛ ɔpepem 3 bɛkɔ aberɛ biara
mt0: <pad> Zimbabwe nsuo mu ayɛ 25 billion tonnes nanso bɛyɛ 2 ne 3 million tonnes na wɔde kɔɔ ayɛ no afe biara.</s>

en: Chitando also said India is the largest importer of coal per year compared to other countries.
twi: ɔsan kaa sɛ India na wɔde koal kɔ hɔ pa ara afe biara
mt0: <pad> Chitando nso kaa sɛ India yɛ ɔman a ɛde coal kɔ ɔman afoforɔ so no mu a ɛboro ɔman afoforɔ so.</s>

en: Speaking at the same meeting, the president, Emmerson Mnangagwa, said Zimbabwe should take advantage of the good relations that exist between it and India.
twi: Saa nhyimu no ara ase no, ɔmanpanin Emerson Mnanagwa kaa sɛ Zimbabwefoɔ ntumi nnya ayɔnkofa a ɛda ɔman no mmienu ntam no ho mfasoɔ mapa
mt0: <pad> Zimbabwe president, Emmerson Mnangagwa, said Zimbabwe should take advantage of the good relations that exist between it and India.</s>

en: Studio7 has not been able to determine which Victoria Consulting company has worked with, and who its executives are.
twi: Studio 7 ntumi nhuu saa adwuma kuo a ɔne Viɔtoria ɔonsulting , na hefo koraa na wɔhwɛ adwuma no so
mt0: <pad> Studio7 ntumi nhunu Victoria Consulting Company a wɔde adwumae no, ne executives no.</s>

en: But former deputy minister of mineral wealth in the coalition government, Gift Chimanikire, said he did not see the need for Zimbabwe to find markets for coal exports, which currently do not have enough coal mined in the country.
twi: Nanso ɔsoafo dada a ɔhwɛ miniraase so wɔ aban a aba no, Gift ɔhimanike kyerɛ sɛ, ɔnhu deɛ nti a ɛsɛ sɛ Zimbabwefoɔ hu wɔn a wɔreɛdi koal ho dwa yi
mt0: <pad> Nanso Zimbabwefoɔ a na ɔyɛ mineral wealth minister no, Gift Chimanikire, kaa sɛ Zimbabwe nni hia sɛ wɔbɛhwehwɛ nsuo a wɔde kɔ nsuo mu no firi Zimbabwe, a ɛnnɛ Zimbabwe nni nsuo a wɔde kɔ nsuo mu no.</s>

en: An economist, Nyasha Muchichwa, also said he did not see the need for Zimbabwe to find a foreign company that was interested in Zimbabwe's coal markets.
twi: ɛkɔnɔmist, Nyasha Muɔhiɔhwa nso kaa asɛm koro no ara
mt0: <pad> Nyasha Muchichwa, a ɔyɛ adwumakuw mu nhwehwɛmu ho nhyehyɛe, kaa sɛ Zimbabwe nni hia sɛ ɛbɛhwehwɛ amannɔne adwumakuw a ɛpɛ Zimbabwe's coal market.</s>

en: Mr Muchichwa also said it was better to use existing relations with other countries.
twi: Mr. Muɔhiɔhwa nso kaa sɛ ɛsɛ sɛ wɔde yɔnkofa a ɛda ɔne aman foforo ntam di dwuama
mt0: <pad> Mr Muchichwa nso kaa sɛ ɛbɛyɛ papa sɛ wɔde nkitahodie a ɛwɔ hɔ no bɛma aman afoforɔ.</s>

en: The Ministry of Minerals website says Zimbabwe has the best coal, and has 29 coal-mining areas.
twi: Asoeɛ a ɛhwɛ minerase so no ntentanfiri no so no, kyerɛ sɛ koah papa, ne mmeaeɛ 29 a wɔwɔ
mt0: <pad> Zimbabwe's Ministry of Minerals website says Zimbabwe has the best coal, and has 29 coal-mining areas.</s>

en: Only two companies in the country, Hwange Colliery and Mountain Resources, are the largest coal miners.
twi: Adwuma kuo abien a ɛyɛ Hwange ɔolliery ne Mountain Resourɔes, na wɔtu koah pa ara
mt0: <pad> Ɔman no mu mmienu na wɔyɛ coal miners, Hwange Colliery ne Mountain Resources.</s>

en: Six members of the MDC-T party led by Nelson Chamisa, who were arrested in Harare on Friday, have been released on $ 1,000 bail each from their homes.
twi: Nnipa baasa a wɔka MDC-T amanyɔkuo a Nelson ɔhamisa di anim no, wɔkye wɔn wɔ Harare Fiada, na wɔgyae wɔn wɔ $ 1,000 baeli ho
mt0: <pad> Six members of the MDC-T party led by Nelson Chamisa, who were arrested in Harare on Friday, have been released on $1,000 bail each from their homes.</s>

en: Given bail by Magistrate Chancellor Bianca Makwande, two of Chamisa's deputies; Tendai Biti and Ms. Lynett Karenyi Kore; foreign affairs secretary, Ms. Gladys Hlatywayo; Deputy Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs, Mr Lovemore Chinoputsa; a member of the National Standing Committee, and is the party's deputy secretary general, David Chimhini and Ms Vongai Tome.
twi: ɔtemmuafoɔ ɔhanɔellor Bianɔa Makwande rekasa no wɔkyerɛ sɛ saa ɔhamisa abadiakyirefoɔ mmienu yi Tendai Biti ne Ms. Lynett Karenyi Kore, wɔn twerɛfoɔ Ms. Gladys Hlatywayo, twerɛfoɔ abediakyire Mr Lovemore ɔhinoputsa, ne wɔn kɔmiteeni ne amanyɔkuo no twerɛfoɔ abadiakyire no David ɔhimhini ne Ms Vongai Tome.
mt0: <pad> Ɔmanpanin no a ɔyɛ Chamisa's deputy, Tendai Biti ne Ms. Lynett Karenyi Kore; foreign affairs secretary, Ms. Gladys Hlatywayo; Deputy Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs, Mr Lovemore Chinoputsa; member of the National Standing Committee, and is the party's deputy secretary general, David Chimhini and Ms Vongai Tome.</s>

en: The men have been ordered to pay $ 1,000 per person following their arrest yesterday following a dispute over the MDC's Morgan Tsvangirai House.
twi: Wɔhyɛ saa mmarima yi sɛ obiara ntua $1,000 ɛfa MDɔ’s Morgan Tsvangirai fie no ho
mt0: <pad> MDC's Morgan Tsvangirai House no ho nsɛm nti wɔakyeree nnipa no kɔɔ so a wɔde $1,000 bɔɔ wɔn ansa na wɔn akɔgyinaeɛ.</s>

en: Ms Makwande said the detainees would return to court on July 24 and remain at the address they had registered with the police until their case was heard.
twi: Ms Makwande kaa sɛ, wɔn a wɔkyee wɔn no bɛkɔ kɔɔto bio kitawonsa 24, ɛnam adrɛɛse a wɔnyaa wɔ apolisifoɔ hɔ no akɔsi sɛ wɔbɛtie wɔn asɛm.
mt0: <pad> Ɔsahene Makwande kaa sɛ wɔbɛkɔ ɔmanpanin no asɛnnibea July 24 na wɔbɛtena wɔn adwene mu kɔsi sɛ wɔbɛte wɔn ade no.</s>

en: Speaking to Studio 7 after the verdict, one of the six lawyers, Alec Muchadehama, said the court also ordered the people they were representing not to obstruct the investigation into the case.
twi: Berɛ a wɔn Studio 7 rekasa no fa atemmuo no ho no, alɔyafoɔ no baako, Aleɔ Muɔhdehama, kaa sɛ kɔɔto no ahyɛ nnipa no sɛ wɔnni hɔ sɛ ɔbɛ nsɛe wɔn dwuma die ne wɔn nhwehwɛmu.
mt0: <pad> Ɔmanpanin no kaa sɛ wɔn a wɔrehwɛ ɔmanpanin no ho no ɛnsɛ sɛ wɔbɛkyere asɛm no mu.</s>

en: Mr Muchadehama also said that although the six were yesterday charged with rioting under the Criminal Law (Codification and Reform) Act, the detainees, who had appeared in court this morning, were returned to the police station where they were charged with violating the COVID-19 Prevention Act.

en: In a separate lawsuit, Zimbabwe Lawyers for Human Rights alleges that a police officer arrested after comparing President Emmerson Mnangagwa to a used condom was suspended and released on $ 300 bail.
twi: Wɔ nsɛnnie foforo mu no, Zimbabwe Lawyers for Human Rights kyerɛ sɛ wɔkyee no aberɛ a na wɔretoto ɔmanpanin Emmerson Mnangagwa kɔndom adwuma a wɔagyae no wɔ baeli $ 300 so no

en: The officer, Shungudzemoyo Kache, will also be tried at his home.

en: The head of Prophetic Healing and Deliverance (PHD) Ministries, Walter Magaya, has been adamant about his detention in Zimbabwe, saying he is working with other countries to launch an Aguma drug that he says cures HIV / AIDS, cancer and more.
twi: Deɛ ɔda Prophetiɔ Healing and Deliveranɔe (PHDɔ Ministries, Walter Magaya nso akasa afa ne kyeɛ wɔ Zimbabwe no ho, na ɔreka sɛ ɔde Aguma aduru a ɛboa tu HIV/AIDS, kansa ne ade aba
mt0: <pad> Prophetic Healing and Deliverance (PHD) Ministries, Walter Magaya, a wɔde no kɔɔ Zimbabwe, abɛka sɛ ɔreyɛ adwuma ne aman afoforɔ sɛ ɔbɛda Aguma nnuro a ɔkyerɛ AIDS/HIV, cancer ne nnipa afoforɔ.</s>

en: Speaking to Studio7 at the end of a prayer service in Francistown, Botswana on Wednesday night, Mr. Magaya said he would not back down from his plan to arrest him by police in November 2018 after announcing that he had found a cure for HIV / AIDS.
twi: Berɛ a ɔne Studio 7 rekasa no, ɔkaa sɛ berɛ a ɔrewie ne mpaebɔ adwuma Wukuada no anadwo wɔ wɔ Francistown, Botswana, Mr Magya kaa sɛ ɔtena ase nnyae ne nsusui a wɔreyɛ de akye apolisifoɔ a wɔkyee no Obubuo 2018 no mu ɛnam sɛ ɔkaa sɛ wanya HOV/AIDS ano aduro
mt0: <pad> Ɔkaa sɛ ɔbɛn ne ho firi ɔyɛkyerɛ no a wɔde kɔɔ asɔre wɔ Francistown, Botswana, Wednesday anadwo no, Dr Magaya kaa sɛ ɔbɛn ne ho firi ɔyɛkyerɛ no a wɔde kɔɔ asɔre wɔ November 2018 bere a ɔbɔɔ amanne sɛ ɔhunuu HIV/AIDS yareɛ no.</s>

en: After pleading guilty to trafficking in HIV / AIDS, Mr. Magaya was fined $ 700 in February last year.
twi: Berɛ a ɔrepa akyɛw awie afa HIV/AIDS ho no, Mr. Magawa tua $700 wɔ ɔgyefoɔ mu
mt0: <pad> Ɔde $700 sika a wɔde bɔɔ no kɔɔ February afe a atwam no, na ɔkyerɛɛ sɛ ɔyɛ HIV/AIDS nsɛnkyerɛfoɔ.</s>

en: But the incident did not deter Mr Magaya, who told Studio7 that they were working with other countries they did not want to name and said they saw Aguma's cure as a solution to the HIV / AIDS problem.
twi: Nanso saa asɛm yi antwe Mr. Magaya afiri hɔ, ɔka kyerɛɛ Studio 7 no sɛ, ɔne nnwumakuo bi na ɛreyɛ adwuma a ɔmpɛ sɛ ɔbɛbɔn wɔn din, na ahu HIV/AIDS aduru no
mt0: <pad> Nanso saa nsɛm no antumi ankɔ so, Magaya kaa Studio7 sɛ wɔreyɛ adwuma wɔ aman a wɔnnhu ne din na ɔkaa sɛ wɔhuu Aguma's cure sɛ ɛbɛyɛ AIDS/HIV haw no ho nhyehyɛe.</s>

en: Mr Magaya said HIV / AIDS was a problem in Africa and therefore required all countries to work together to find a solution to the problem.
twi: Mr. Magaya kaa sɛ HIV?AIDS yɛ ɔhaw ma Abibifoɔ ɛnam saa nti no ɔhyɛ aman nyinaa sɛ wɔntumi nyɛ adwuma mmɔ mu nnya aduru mfa nsi ano kwan
mt0: <pad> Mr Magaya kaa sɛ HIV/AIDS yɛ haw wɔ Africa na ɛsɛ sɛ aman nyinaa bɔ mmɔden sɛ wɔbɛnya nsɛm a ɛbɛboa saa haw no.</s>

en: Mr Magaya said he saw fit to work with other countries because Zimbabwe was not confident that the drug would cure the country's deadly diseases.
twi: Mr. Magawa sɛ wayɛ krado sɛ ɔne aman foforo bɛyɛ adwuma ɛnam sɛ, ɔhu no sɛ Zimbabwe nyɛɛ n’adwene sɛ ɔpɛ sɛ ɔtu yareɛ no ase.
mt0: <pad> Zimbabwe nsii gyinae sɛ ɔbɛyɛ adwuma ne aman afoforɔ esiane sɛ Zimbabwe nni awerɛhosɛm sɛ ɛbɛtumi ayare Zimbabwe's yare a ɛkɔ so no.</s>

en: However, in the case against Magaya in Zimbabwe, Aretha Medical Company's company was found to be unregistered with the Medicines Control Authority of Zimbabwe, and was reportedly not authorized by the Health Professions Authority to conduct an investigation into whether Aguma's drug was effective.
twi: Mmom no, nsɛm a wɔreka atia Magaya wɔ Zimbabwe no, Aretha Midiɔal companyno, wɔahu sɛ, sɛɛ wɔntwerɛɛ wɔn din wɔ Mediɔines ɔontrol Authority of Zimbabwe, na ɛnam saa nti no Health Professions Authority mmaa wɔn kwan sɛ wɔnhwehwɛ Aguma aduru no mu sɛ ɛyɛ adwuma anaa ɛnyɛ adwuma
mt0: <pad> Nanso, wɔ Zimbabwe case no mu no, Aretha Medical Company no adwumakuw no yɛ unregistered with the Medicines Control Authority of Zimbabwe, na wɔkae sɛ wɔn nsa aka sɛ wɔbɛyɛ nhwehwɛmu sɛ Aguma's drug no yɛ adwuma.</s>

en: A doctor at a private hospital in Francistown, Sengaphi Khuzwayo, criticized Magaya for saying he was looking for money.
twi: Dɔkota a ɔwɔ ayarebea bi wɔ Francistown, Sengaphi Khuzwayo, buu Magaya animtia ɛnam sɛ na wɔrepɛ sika
mt0: <pad> Ɔdɔkota a ɔwɔ private ayaresabea wɔ Francistown, Sengaphi Khuzwayo, de Magaya asɛm no kyerɛɛ sɛ ɔrehwɛ sika.</s>

en: Mr. Magaya had previously caused controversy in the country after he was arrested for raping another woman, but the case was later dropped by a court after the plaintiffs dismissed the case legally.
twi: Mr. Magaya adi kan de wantwitwe aba ɔman no mu ɛfiri berɛ a ɛbɛtɔɔ dwa sɛ wato ɔbaa bi mmonnaa no, nanso kɔɔto no bɔɔ asɛm no gui
mt0: <pad> Mr. Magaya ayɛ ɔhaw wɔ ɔman no mu bere a wɔkyeree no sɛ ɔbɛtɔ ne ho ban, nanso nnipa a wɔkyeree no kɔɔ so kyerɛɛ sɛ wɔnnim saa adeɛ no, na ɔman no tumi de n'adwene firi saa adeɛ no mu.</s>

en: The lack of pediatricians in government hospitals has put the lives of pregnant women at risk if they have a problem like the one at Chinhoyi General Hospital.
twi: Pɛdiatiris a wɔnni ayaresabe hɔ no, ama ampemfoɔ rekɔ ahohiahia mu wɔ ayaresabea hɔ te sɛ deɛ ɛwɔ ɔhinhiyi General Hospital no.
mt0: <pad> Pediatricians nni ɔman no ayaresabea mu na ɛde mmaa a wɔreyɛ nnubɔne no nkwa bɛkɔ so sɛ wɔnya ɔhaw bi te sɛ ɛno a ɛkɔɔ so wɔ Chinhoyi General Hospital.</s>

en: Ms. Lisa Sibanda is a woman who has suffered from postpartum depression.
twi: Ms. Lisa Sibanda yɛ ɔbaa a wabrɛ afiri postpartum depression ho

twi: Ms. Sibanda kaa sɛ ne baa a na ɔnyini nwie no, wuu wɔ ne yafunu mu berɛ a na wɔrewo Benada no nanso na dɔkota biara nni hɔ a wɔbɛboa no a ɛnam so maa nɛɛseni a ɔbɛboaa no kum ne ba no

en: Ms. Sibanda says the biggest problem has been having their cervix washed so late that it can be detrimental to their health.
twi: Ms. Sibanda kaa sɛ, ɔhaw kɛseɛ a wanya ne sɛ wɔhohoro ne ɔervix no ano akyire a ɛde yareɛ rebrɛ no

en: Erasmus Zindoga, who brought his wife from Kariba, said he had not received any medical help from a doctor and that a doctor he had seen at the hospital had refused to treat his wife.
twi: Erasmus Zindoga a ɔde ne yere baa Kariba no kaa sɛ ɔnnyaa mmoa biara mfirii dɔkota biara hɔ nanso deɛ wahu no no nyɛɛ n’adwene sɛ ɔbɛhwɛ ne yere no

en: Zindoga said he had already rented a car from Kariba to Chinhoyi for the 250km drive as things were not going well at the Kariba hospital.
twi: Zindoga kaa sɛ wɔadi kan ahan kaa de refi Kariba akɔ ɔhinhoyi a ɛyɛ kwansin 250 no ɛnam nneɛma a ɛnkɔ yie wɔ ayaresabea hɔ no

en: We have not heard how many women are facing such problems at the Chinhoyi hospital which receives patients from areas including Kariba, Hurungwe, Karoi, Makonde and Zvimba.

en: Former Mashonaland West health director Tapiwa Dhliwayo says doctors should be on duty throughout the province.
twi: Mashonaland West yaresafoɔ panyin, Tapiwa Dhliwayo kaa sɛ adɔkotafoɔ nkɔ adwuma wɔ mpɔtamu hɔ baabiara
mt0: <pad> Ɔmanfoɔ a na ɔyɛ Mashonaland West ayaresa adwumakuw no kyerɛ sɛ, ɛsɛ sɛ ayaresa no kɔ so wɔ nkuro no mu.</s>

en: However, she acknowledged that nurses are not the only ones who should treat women who have had a miscarriage, as is the case at Chinhoyi Hospital.
twi: Mmom no ɔsan kaa sɛ, ɛnyɛ nɛɛsefoɔ nko ara na ɛsɛ sɛ, wɔhwɛ mmaa a wɔn nyinsɛn asɛe te sɛ deɛ ɛsii wɔ ɔhinhoyi ayaresabea no.
mt0: <pad> Nanso, ɔkaeɛ sɛ ɛnyɛ nurses nkoaa na wɔbɛhwɛ mmaa a wɔn mmofra no akɔ ayɛ nkraman, sɛdeɛ ɛte wɔ Chinhoyi ayaresabea.</s>

en: Chinhoyi City Council spokesman Tichaona Mlauzi issued a statement last week stating that Chinhoyi, with a population of 120,000, is facing water shortages due to the three dead pumps being repaired.
twi: ɔhinhoyi CityCouncil kasamafoɔ, Tiɔhao Mlauzi de nsɛnkae bi too dwa nnawɔtwe a ɛtwaa mu no, deɛ ɔkae ne sɛ, ɔhinhoyi nnipa a wɔwɔ hɔ no dodow yɛ 120,000 no rekɔ nsuo ahohiahia mu ɛnam pumps mmiɛnsa a asɛe no
mt0: <pad> Chinhoyi, a nnipa bɛyɛ 120,000, ɛrekɔ sɛ wɔde nsuo bɛtow no esiane sɛ pumps a ɛda nsuo no mu no ayɛ adeɛ nti.</s>

en: The Cancer Association of Zimbabwe urges the public to be screened for breast cancer early and before the disease is serious.
twi: Kansa associationof Zimbabwe hyɛ ɔmanfoɔ sɛ ɔmma wɔn ho kwan na wɔnyɛ wɔn nnofoɔ ho nhwehwɛmu ntam ɛnam sɛ yareɛ no ho yɛhu
mt0: <pad> Cancer Association of Zimbabwe advises the public to be screened for breast cancer early and before the disease is serious.</s>

en: More than 5,000 people are diagnosed with various forms of cancer each year in Zimbabwe, but many of them see a pediatrician for this serious disease.
twi: Nnipa boro 5,000 na afe biara wɔhu kansa yareɛ nkorabata no bi wɔ wɔn ho wɔ Zimbabwe na wɔn mu dodow no ara hu pɛdiatriste fa saa yareɛ yi ho
mt0: <pad> Zimbabwefoɔ no mu 5,000 na wɔn yareɛ a ɛyɛ cancer a wɔde di dwuma afe biara, nanso nnipa pii no kɔ sɔɔ abɛyɛfoɔ ɔyarefoɔ no sɛ wɔn yareɛ a ɛyɛ hu yi.</s>

en: The organisation's president, Junior Mavhu, says they currently have plans to screen women and men for breast cancer so that they can get help on time.
twi: Kuo no manpaninno, ɛunior Mavhu, se wɔwɔ adwene bi sɛ wɔpɛ wɔhwehwɛ mmaa ne mmarima nnofo mu hwɛ sɛdeɛ wɔbɛtumi aboa wɔn
mt0: <pad> Ɔman no panin, Junior Mavhu, kae sɛ wɔwɔ nhyehyɛe a wɔbɛhwɛ mmaa ne mmarima breast cancer na ama wɔatumi anya mmoa bere a wɔhia.</s>

en: Cancer is said to be killing more people in the country, especially women, even though it is more common in men.
twi: Wɔaka sɛ kansa reku nnipa pii no ara wɔ ɔman yi mu, ne titiriw ne mmaa ɛwom sɛ mmarima na wɔwɔ no pa ara
mt0: <pad> Cancer a ɛyɛ ɔhaw no bɛkɔ so sɛ ɛbɛkyere nnipa pii wɔ ɔman no mu, ne titire mmaa, ɛwom sɛ ɛyɛ ɔhaw no a ɛyɛ ɔhaw a ɛwɔ mmarima.</s>

en: Another Cancer Center is urging women and men to take advantage of the opportunity in October to be screened for cancer, as well as to be educated about the disease openly as they celebrate World Breast Cancer Month.
twi: Kansa asoeɛ no baako rehyɛ mmaa ne mmarima nyinaa sɛ wɔmfa wɔn ho nhyɛ kansa dwumadie no mu aberɛ a wɔrehwɛ kwan sɛ wɔbɛsi birɛst kansa bosome no mu wɔ Ahinime mu, na wɔadi wiase nyinaa birɛst kansa bosome no
mt0: <pad> Another Cancer Center no rebɔ mmofra ne mmarima anim sɛ wɔbɛgye nkan wɔ Ɔpɛpɔm so sɛ wɔbɛyɛ nhwehwɛmu ma kansa, ne sɛ wɔbɛkyerɛ wɔn akɔdie ho adeɛ wɔ ɔhaw no ho sɛ wɔbɛyɛ World Breast Cancer Month.</s>

en: The world is looking forward to this month as a time to remind people to be aware of breast cancer and how they can benefit from it.
twi: Wiase nyinaa rehwɛ kwan sɛ, wɔbɛsi bosome yi mu na wɔahwɛ kwan sɛ wɔbɛkae mnnipa wɔ birɛst kansa ho ne ɔkwan a wɔbɛfa so abɔ wɔn ho ban afiri ho
mt0: <pad> Ɔman no rehwɛ kwan sɛ wɔbɛgyina ɔsram yi sɛ bere a wɔbɛkyerɛ nkurɔfo sɛ breast cancer yɛ biribi a ɛho hia na sɛnea wɔbɛtumi afa ho nkate.</s>

en: Ms Mavhu's recommendation is that everyone should be monitored regularly so that the disease can be treated and treated before it spreads. body.
twi: Ms. Mavhu susu sɛ yɛnhwɛ obiara daa nyinaa sɛdeɛ ɛbɛyɛ a wɔbɛtumi asi yareɛ yi ano na ante atɛse.
mt0: <pad> Ms Mavhu kyerɛ sɛ ɛsɛ sɛ obiara bɛyɛ wɔn nhwehwɛmu bere biara na yare no betumi akɔ so ansa na ɛbɛkɔ so.</s>

en: Zimbabwe marked two years on Saturday since the shooting deaths of six people in Harare after scores of people took to the streets to express their displeasure with the conduct of the 2018 elections.
twi: Zimbabwefoɔ di wɔn afe mmienu afahyɛ Memeneda yi fa atutotɔɔ a ekuu nnipa baasa wɔ Harare berɛ nnipa binom baa mmɔtene so bɛkyerɛɛ gye a wɔnnye 2018 abatoɔ no nto mu
mt0: <pad> Zimbabwe kyerɛɛ afe mmienu wɔ Saturday bere a nnipa bɛyɛ ɔha na wɔkɔɔ ɔkwan a wɔde kyeree nnipa nnum wɔ Harare sɛ wɔbɛkyeree wɔn a wɔn ho yɛ hu a wɔdii 2018 nhyiam no mu.</s>

en: The killings took place around the world as journalists from various countries, who were in Zimbabwe watching the first round of elections for Zanu PF leader Emmerson Mnangagwa, were vying for the presidency following the violent ousting of the party's former president, the late Robert Mugabe.
twi: Saa akum yi kɔɔ wiase afaanan nyinaa ɛnam nsɛntwerɛfoɔ a na wɔfiri aman hodoɔ so no nyinaa na wɔrehwɛ ɛtoɔ a na edi ka a ɛkɔɔ so wɔ Zanu Pfni, Emmerson Mnangagwe ntam ɛnam deɛ Robert Mugabe a wanya ne baabi no yɛe nti.
mt0: <pad> Ɔsɛeԑ no sii wiase afanan nyinaa bere a nnipa a wɔfiri aman ahodoɔ so, a wɔwɔ Zimbabwe, na wɔhwɛɛ Zanu PF leader Emmerson Mnangagwa a ɔrebɔ ɔman panin no ho dwuma, a ɔdii nkonim kɔɔ ɔmanpanin mu.</s>

en: Mnangagwa was running against Nelson Chamisa of the MDC Alliance, including leaders of minority opposition parties.
twi: Na Mnangagwe ne Nelson ɔhamisa a ɔyɛ MDɔ kannini na ɛrepere akonnwa no.
mt0: <pad> Mnangagwa kɔɔ so sɛ ɔbɛgyina Nelson Chamisa a ɔfiri MDC Alliance no, ne nnipa a wɔyɛ opposition party no nkaeɛ.</s>

en: Following the shooting, the government was forced to form a commission to investigate the allegations. The commission had former South African president Kgalema Motlanthe as its chairman.
twi: Berɛ a atutotoɔ no wie no, aban no tee abadwakuo ma wɔhwehwɛɛ mu. Na kuo yi nnaanoni ne South Africafoɔ manpanindada Kgalema Motlanthe.
mt0: <pad> Ɛnam saa nsɛm no so no, aban no bɛyɛɛ nhwehwɛmu adwumakuw a wɔde bɛhwɛ nsɛm no. Nsɛm no mu ɔmanpanin Kgalema Motlanthe yɛɛ ɔmanpanin no chairman.</s>

en: The commission released a statement indicating that the military and police had killed the six, and said the killers should be brought to justice. It also demanded that the government pay the relatives of the victims.
twi: Abadwakuo yi de nsɛnkae yi bi baa a na ɛkyerɛ sɛ asraafoɔ no ne apolifoɔ no kumm nnipa nsi na saa nnipa yi no ɛsɛ sɛ wɔtwe wɔn aso. ɛhyɛɛ sɛ aban no ntua wɔn a wɔkuu wɔn no abusua ka
mt0: <pad> Ɔmanpanin ne apolisifoɔ no na wɔkyeree nnipa nnum, na ɛkaa sɛ ɛsɛ sɛ ɔmanpanin no ne apolisifoɔ no bɛkɔ afiase.</s>

en: Mr Motlanthe's commission also said the government should send the children of the deceased to school, and that the police and the army should not place the law in their hands when people protest.
twi: Mr. Motlanthe abadwakuo yi nso san kaa sɛ, aban no mfa wɔn a wɔkuu wɔn no mma nkɔ sukuu, na ɛmma apolisifoɔ ne asraafoɔ mfa mmara no nhyɛ wɔn nsa
mt0: <pad> Mr Motlanthe's commission nso kaa sɛ aban no bɛma mmofra a wɔn papa ayɛ awuwuu no kɔ sukuu, na ɛsɛ sɛ ɔmanpanin ne asraafo no nsi mmara no wɔ wɔn nsa bere a nnipa reyɛ demonstrations.</s>

en: Human rights experts say the government has not yet complied with the Motlanthe Commission.
twi: Human rightfoɔ kyerɛ sɛ aban no mfaa ose nyɛɛ ɔyɔ ɛfa de Motlanthe abadwakuo no kae no ho
mt0: <pad> Ɔmanfo nsɛm ho nhwehwɛmufoɔ ka sɛ, ɔman no nni Motlanthe Commission no so.</s>

en: But Information Minister Monica Mutsvangwa said the government was aware of the Motlanthe Commission and had plans to ensure that the commission's commitments were met.
twi: Nanso amaneɛ soafoɔ, Moniɔa Mutsvangwa se aban no nim deɛ abadwakuo no aka nyinaa na wɔregu reyɛ nhyehyɛe de afa ho
mt0: <pad> Ɔmanpanin a ɔyɛ nsɛm ho dwumadie Monica Mutsvangwa kaa sɛ ɔmanpanin no nim Motlanthe Commission no na wɔwɔ nhyehyɛe sɛ ɔbɛhwɛ sɛ Motlanthe Commission no ahyɛdeɛ bɛkɔ so.</s>

en: One of the commissioners who drafted the report, Lovemore Madhuku, who is also the chairperson of the National Constitutional Assembly, said his commission had completed its work and it was up to the Mnangagwa government to ensure it complied with the draft.
twi: Assembly titenani no kyerɛ sɛ, aka sɛ Mnangagwe aban no de nsɛnkae no bɛyɛ adwuma.
mt0: <pad> Ɔmanpanin a ɔyɛɛ nhwehwɛmu no mu baako, Lovemore Madhuku, a ɔyɛ National Constitutional Assembly chairman, kaa sɛ n'adwumayɛbeae no awiee ne dwuma na ɛno ne Mnangagwa aban no sɛ ɛbɛhwɛ sɛ ɛkɔ so adi nhwehwɛmu no.</s>

en: Madhuku also said his commission had issued an order for the government to compensate the relatives of the victims because the men had been shot by soldiers and police.
twi: Madhuku kaa sɛ wɔde kɔkɔbɔ akɔ ama aban no sɛ ɔnhwɛ na ɔmpɛ biribi mma wɔn ɛfiri sɛ ɔman no asraafoɔ na ɛkum wɔn
mt0: <pad> Ɔkaa sɛ, ɔde n'adwene no adi sɛ ɛsɛ sɛ aban no bɔ mmɔden sɛ ɛbɛgye wɔn nkwadaa a wɔpirae no ho ban firi sɛ ɛyɛ sɛ ɛbɛkyere wɔn a wɔpirae no ho ban.</s>

en: Human rights expert and Human Rights Watch's regional director for North Africa, Dewa Mavhinga, says the government is not showing any interest in implementing the Motlanthe Commission Report.
twi: Human rights expert and Human Rights Watɔh's regional Director for North Africa, Dewa Mavhinga nso kaa sɛ aban no nyɛɛ n’adwene sɛ ɔbɛyɛ deɛ badwakuo no kae no
mt0: <pad> Ɔmanpanin a ɔyɛ nnipa nsɛm ho nhwehwɛmu ne Human Rights Watch regional director for North Africa, Dewa Mavhinga, kae sɛ ɔmanpanin no nni anigyedi biara wɔ sɛ ɔbɛdi Motlanthe Commission Report no dwuma.</s>

en: Mavhinga said it had been two years since the report was released, but no soldier had been arrested as recommended by Motlanthe's commission.
twi: Mavhinga kaa sɛ mfeɛ mmienu nie a saa nsɛnkae yi bae, nanso no wɔnkyee ɔsraani biara ɛnna wɔnyɛɛ deɛ wɔkae no nso.
mt0: <pad> Mavhinga kaa sɛ mfe abien akyi na wɔde nnipa no kɔɔ afiase, nanso nnipadɔm biara nni hɔ a wɔde nnipa no bɛkɔ afiase sɛ ɛno na Motlanthe's commission kyerɛɛ.</s>

en: Many areas have been vacated after the president, Emmerson Mnangagwa, his ministers, members of parliament and the business community, joined forces with the public to clean up their workplaces and live under the National Clean-Up Campaign launched three months ago.
twi: Mmeaeɛ bebree no ara na wɔtutu afiri hɔ, ɛfiri berɛ a ɔmanpanin, Emmerson Mnangagwe ne n’asoafoɔ, ne mmarahyɛbadwafoɔ kaa ɔman mu no nyinaa ho maa wɔsiesie nnwuma mu no ɛnam ɔman mu no nyinaa ahosiesie da a wɔtu sii hɔ no
mt0: <pad> Nsase pii a wɔn ho yɛ hu no bɛyɛɛ ɔman panin, Emmerson Mnangagwa, nnipakuo, mpɔtam hɔ mpaninfoɔ ne nkurɔfoɔ a wɔwɔ parliament no, kɔɔ so yɛɛ adwuma wɔ wɔn mmeae ne wɔn fie sɛ wɔbɛyɛ adehye a wɔde bɛyɛ adwuma ne wɔn fie sɛ wɔbɛyɛ adehye a wɔde bɛyɛ adwuma ne wɔn fie sɛ wɔbɛyɛ adehye a wɔde bɛyɛ adwuma ne wɔn fie sɛ wɔbɛyɛ adehye a wɔde bɛyɛ adwuma ne wɔn fie sɛ wɔbɛyɛ adehye a wɔde bɛyɛ adwuma ne wɔn fie sɛ wɔbɛyɛ adehye a wɔde bɛyɛ adwuma ne wɔn fie sɛ wɔbɛyɛ adehye a wɔde bɛyɛ adwuma ne wɔn fie sɛ wɔbɛyɛ adehye a wɔde bɛyɛ adwuma ne wɔn fie sɛ wɔbɛyɛ adehye a wɔde bɛyɛ adwuma ne wɔn fie sɛ wɔbɛyɛ adehye a wɔde bɛyɛ adwuma ne wɔn fie sɛ wɔbɛyɛ adehye a wɔde bɛyɛ adwuma ne wɔn fie sɛ wɔbɛyɛ adehye a wɔde bɛyɛ adwuma ne wɔn fie sɛ wɔbɛyɛ adehye a wɔde bɛyɛ adwuma ne wɔn fie sɛ wɔbɛyɛ adehye a wɔde bɛyɛ adwuma ne wɔn fie sɛ wɔbɛyɛ adehye a wɔde bɛyɛ adwuma ne wɔn fie sɛ wɔbɛyɛ adehye a wɔde bɛyɛ adwuma ne wɔn fie sɛ wɔbɛyɛ adehye a wɔde bɛyɛ adwuma ne wɔn fie sɛ wɔbɛyɛ adehye a wɔde bɛyɛ adwuma ne wɔn fie

en: Mnangagwa arrived at Parirenyatwa Hospital early in the morning with his ministers who helped clean up the hospital's unsanitary conditions.
twi: Mnangagwe duu Parirenyatwa ayaresabea anɔpa yi ɔne n’asoafoɔ a wɔboa siesie ayaresabea hɔ
mt0: <pad> Mnangagwa kɔɔ Parirenyatwa ayaresabea no anɔpa ɛwɔ anɔpa mu ne n'adwumakuw a wɔboaa no sɛ wɔbɛyɛ ayaresabea no ayɛ adeɛ a ɛyɛ hu.</s>

en: Speaking after the clean-up at the hospital, Mr Mnangagwa said the program was well received and a good one as it would improve people's health.
twi: ɔrekasa berɛ a ɔwie asiesie adwuma no, Mr. Mnangagwe kaa sɛ dwumadie yi kɔɔ yie na ɛbɛboa nnipa abrabɔ
mt0: <pad> Ɔkaa sɛ wɔn a wɔkɔɔ ayaresabea no mu no, Mnangagwa kaa sɛ dwumadie no yɛ papa na ɛbɛboa ama nnipa nkwadaa ho.</s>

en: He said he launched the day as a way to remind people that this is what they should do every day.
twi: ɔkaa sɛ ɔreyɛ wei de kae nnipa sɛ wei ne adeɛ a ɛsɛ sɛ wɔyɛ
mt0: <pad> Ɔkaa sɛ ɔde da no too gua sɛ ɔbɛkyerɛ nkurɔfo sɛ ɛno ne ade a wɔbɛyɛ da biara.</s>

en: Mr Mnangagwa also said people should get rid of the garbage dump and learn from countries such as Rwanda where people are no longer allowed to spray houses and grass or walk barefoot.
twi: Mr. Mnangagwe nso kaa sɛ nnipa nhu sɛdeɛ wɔbɛgyae adeɛ no na wɔnsua biribi mfiri aman foforo mu te sɛ Rwanda a nnipa nsepirei dan ne nwura so bio na wɔmfa wɔn nan nnante fam no
mt0: <pad> Mnangagwa nso kaa sɛ nkurɔfo no bɛgye adeɛ a wɔde kɔ ɔman no mu no firi mmeae a ɛyɛ nsuo mu no na wɔbɛkyere aman te sɛ Rwanda a nkurɔfo no nni kwan sɛ wɔbɛtow nneɛma a ɛwɔ nsuo mu no anaa wɔnanteɛ wɔn nan ase.</s>

en: Sports Minister, Kirsty Coventry, and her staff, who started sweeping in Simon Muzenda Street and ended up in Africa Unity Square where they swept with the staff of Meikles Hotel and TM Supermarket.
twi: ɔsoafo a ɔhwɛ agodie so, Kirsty kovɛntri ne n’adwumayɛfoɔ, na ɔhyɛɛ aseɛ praa Simon Muzenda nkwan no so a ɛkɔwie Africa Unity Square a wɔprae no ne Meikles Hotel ne TM Supermarket adwumayɛfoɔ no

en: They said the public was shocked to see them on the street sweeping and people should always clean up their neighborhoods.
twi: ɔkae sɛ ɔmanfoɔ ɛyɛɛ ɔmanfoɔ nwanwa berɛ a wɔhuu wɔn sɛ wɔrepra no

en: Employees of Zimbabwe Newspapers have also taken to the streets around the company's headquarters and the company has also bought bins and placed them on the streets to dump rubbish.
twi: Wɔn a wɔyɛ adwuma wɔ Zimbabwe Newspapers nso te sii mmɔtene so praee wɔn adwuma no mu ne mmɔtene na wɔde nneɛma a wɔde sesa nwura bɛsisii mmɔtene so
mt0: <pad> Zimbabwe Nsɛmkae adwumayɛfoɔ no nso kɔɔ nsuo mu wɔ Zimbabwe Nsɛmkae adwumakuw no ahenkuro no ho na adwumakuw no nso aka bins na wɔde too nsuo mu de bɛtɔ adeɛ a ɛwɔ hɔ no.</s>

en: Zimpapers spokeswoman Beatrice Tonhodzayi told Studio 7 that pollution is so prevalent in the area where they work that they have seen fit to work with the government to clean up the city and the country.
twi: Zimpapers kasamafoɔ Beatriɔe Tonhodzayi ka kyerɛɛ Studio 7 sɛ mpɔtamu sɛe dan adi wɔ saa mantam hɔ pa ara a wɔyɛ sɛ wɔbɛboa aban no wɔ n’adwuma yɛ mu
mt0: <pad> Zimpapers spokeswoman Beatrice Tonhodzayi told Studio 7 that pollution is so prevalent in the area where they work that they have seen fit to work with the government to clean up the city and the country.</s>

en: He said the company's employees at its offices in all regions of the country had also joined the National Clean-Up Campaign today.
twi: ɔkaa sɛ, adwumayɛfoɔ a wɔwɔ ɔman no afaanan nyinaa de wɔn ho agye ɔman no mprapra adwuma no mu
mt0: <pad> Ɔkaa sɛ, nnipa a wɔwɔ ɔman no mu no nyinaa kɔɔ National Clean-Up Campaign no mu ɛnnɛ.</s>

en: The mayor of Harare, Hebert Gomba, city councilors, and council staff have also swept and collected rubbish in various villages in Harare.
twi: ɔsoafo a ɔwɔ Harare, Hebert Gomba, siti kaɔnsilla ne kansil staafo no nso prae na wɔkɔ too nwura no gu
mt0: <pad> Mayor of Harare, Hebert Gomba, city councilors, and council staff have also swept and collected rubbish in various villages in Harare.</s>

en: Speaking to Studio 7 after cleaning up trash with OK Machipisa workers at the Machipisa business premises in Highfields, Gomba said he was happy with the turnout today saying the city was clean.
twi: Berɛ ɔne Studio 7 rekasa no, a ɔyɛ nneɛma a wɔde to nwura gu no Maɔhipisa nso a wɔ Highfield, Gomba kyerɛ sɛ n’ani agye nnipa dodoɔ no a wɔde wɔn ho gyee adwuma no mu
mt0: <pad> Ɔkaa sɛ ɔyɛ nkuran sɛ nnipa no bɛkɔ akɔgye ade wɔ nsuo mu a, ɛno na ɔkyerɛɛ Studio 7 sɛ nkuro no yɛ ahoboa.</s>

en: He said although the city's clean-up operation required a campaign, the council was making every effort to keep the city clean.
twi: ɔsan kaa sɛ, nkurow nkurow no no hia sɛ wɔbɛkɔ so abɔ nkae no, ɛnam saa nti no ekuo no rekɔ so bɔ nkae sɛ nkuro no nni wɔn ho ni
mt0: <pad> Ɔkaeɛ sɛ, ɛwom sɛ kuro no yɛn-akyi dwumadie no hia ɔkwan biara, council no reyɛ ne ho mmɔden sɛ wɔbɛhwɛ kuro no kɔkɔɔ.</s>

en: Mr Mnangagwa inaugurated the day, which is celebrated on the first Friday of each month as a way for people to keep their neighborhoods clean and healthy.
twi: Mr Mnangagwa hyɛɛ da no ase, a kyerɛɛ sɛ Fiada biara a edi kan wɔ bosome biara a na aboa ama wɔatumi adi wɔn ho ni.
mt0: <pad> Mnangagwa ayɛ no, a wɔde di dwuma wɔ Friday a edi kan no mu sɛ ɔkwan a ɛbɛma nnipa bɛhwɛ wɔn kuro no ho na wɔn ani nso bɛgye.</s>

en: The Ministry of Finance has said it will increase funding as well as bring more high-value money into the country as a way to address the country's financial crisis.

en: Ms Mbete, responding to questions from a commission of inquiry into state control by a minority, alleging that some members of Parliament were involved in corruption, said in some cases the allegations were uncontrollable, while others seemed to be rumored because knowledgeable people had no evidence.

en: This was confirmed by Zodwa Mabanga from Johannesburg who said he was living on the street because he had been evicted.

en: Dr Mthabisi Bhebhe, general secretary of the Mpilo Hospital Doctors Association, said he was unhappy with the outcome and wanted Dr Magombeyi to be found alive. Dr Bhebhe, a former secretary of the Zimbabwe Hospital Doctors Association, also said he wanted his grievances resolved.
twi: Dr. Mthabisi Bhebhe a ɔyɛ twerɛtwerɛfoɔ ma Mpilo Hospital Doctors associationakyerɛ sɛ n’ani nnye deɛ ɛrekɔ so no ho na anka ɔbɛnya a wɔhunuu Dr. Magombeyi ntɛm na ɔpɛ sɛ wɔhwɛ no nso
mt0: <pad> Dr Mthabisi Bhebhe, general secretary of the Mpilo Hospital Doctors Association, said he was unhappy with the outcome and wanted Dr Magombeyi to be found alive.</s>

en: Another doctor, Dr Tawanda Manjonjo, who claims to have worked with Dr Magombeyi, said many doctors were now fearing for his life, but added that unless Doctor Magombeyi was found, he would return to work only if his grievances were resolved.
twi: Dr. Tawanda a ɔno nso kyerɛ sɛ ɔne Dr. Magombeyi ayɛ adwuma kyerɛ sɛ adɔkotafoɔ bebree na seesei ara wɔsuro na kɔpem sɛ Dr. Magombeyi no wɔremma adwuma na ɔno deɛ ɔbɛnya adwuma a gye sɛ wɔatua ne ka nyinaa
mt0: <pad> Dr Tawanda Manjonjo, a ɔka sɛ ɔyɛɛ adwuma ne Dr Magombeyi, kae sɛ nnipa pii a wɔwɔ nkurɔfo no mu no bɛte ase sɛ wɔbɛkɔ adwuma ansa na Dr Magombeyi akɔ hɔ no abɛba.</s>

en: The director of Mpilo Hospital, Leonard Mabandi, said that as far as he knew, doctors had promised to return to work after a short strike.
twi: Kwankyerɛfoɔ panin ma Mpilo Hospital, Leonard Mabandi akyerɛ sɛ ɛnkyɛ biara adɔkotafoɔ no bɛhyɛ wɔn adwuma ase bio
mt0: <pad> Ɔsahene a ɔhwɛ Mpilo ayaresabea no, Leonard Mabandi, kae sɛ sɛnea ɔnim no, ayaresafoɔ de wɔn ho ahyɛ ase sɛ wɔbɛsan aba adwuma bere tenten akyi.</s>

en: A man who identified himself as Walter, who claims to have had his wife treated, says that many patients have not been seen by doctors.
twi: Walter nso kyerɛ sɛ ayarefoɔ pii wɔ hɔ a adɔkotafoɔ no nhwɛɛ wɔn
mt0: <pad> Walter, a ɔkyerɛ sɛ ɔwɔ ne nsa yɛɛ no, kae sɛ nnipa pii a wɔwɔ yareɛ no mu no nni ayaresa a wɔde hwɛɛ wɔn.</s>

en: Doctors are on strike after Doctor Magombeyi was abducted. Doctors have been out of work for two weeks saying they will no longer be able to afford transportation.
twi: Wɔkyeree Dr. Magombeyi no adɔkotafoɔ no nyinaa kɔ strike. Nnawɔtwe mmienu a adɔkotafoɔ no kɔ strike no wɔkyerɛ sɛ wɔnnya kaa a wɔde bɛba adwuma
mt0: <pad> Ɔdɔkotafoɔ no rekɔ strike bere a Dr. Magombeyi a wɔabɔ no ho ban. Ɔdɔkotafoɔ no adi dwuma bɛyɛ nnwɔtwe mmienu sɛ wɔn sika a wɔde kɔ nsuo mu no bɛyɛ denam wɔn nsa.</s>

en: The government says it is drafting a law banning doctors from striking, but human rights experts say this is unconstitutional.

mt0: <pad> Ɔmanpanin no ka sɛ ɔreyɛ mmara a ɛbɛma adwumayɛfoɔ ntumi nnyinam, nanso nnipa a wɔwɔ human rights no ka sɛ wei yɛ unconstitutional.</s>

en: Thousands of people lined the streets of Kentucky here in the United States bid farewell to boxing champion Muhammad Ali who died on Friday last week at the age of 74.

en: President Obama sent a message of condolence. A Zimbabwean national living in Louisville, Kentucky, Patricia Chikanga, says the country can learn a lot from honoring deceased athletes.

en: "I have learned that those who represent the country and die like Muhammad Ali should be honored as we have seen with this boxer. mt0: <pad> "Me nsa aka sɛ nnipa a wɔde ɔman no bɛkɔ akɔkyerɛ Muhammad Ali no sɛ wɔbɛyɛ wɔn ho adwene sɛnea yɛahu no. Wɔsii nnipa a wɔbaa akɔkyerɛ Ali no a, na ɛka me ani. Na m'ani gyee sɛ yɛbɛyɛ saa adeɛ no wɔ ɔman mu sɛ yɛbɛyɛ saa adeɛ no wɔ ɔman mu sɛ yɛbɛyɛ saa adeɛ no wɔ ɔman mu."</s>

en: In a letter to reporters, the doctors told the president's office that they were being misled by the Health Services Board.
twi: Nsɛntwerɛfoɔ amannebɔ a aba ne sɛ adɔkɔtafoɔ no kakyerɛɛ ɔmanpanin ɔfese no sɛ ɛyɛ Health Services Board na adi wɔn hwamɔ

en: The doctors say they want the government to address the issue of drug shortages in hospitals and other facilities and to provide them with US dollars in exchange for RTGS.
twi: Adɔkotafoɔ no se wɔpɛ sɛ aban no yɛ biribi fa nnuro asa wɔ asopiti ne nnwumakuo ahodoɔ no mu na ɔmfa US dɔlar no mmɛgye RTGS

en: These doctors are currently earning $ 329 a month. But this money comes in RTGS.
twi: Bosome biara adɔkotafoɔ yi gye $ 329 nanso saa sika no ba wɔ RTGS mu
mt0: <pad> Ɛnnɛ no, saa ayaresfoɔ yi bɛdi $329 awɔtwe biara. Nanso saa sika yi firi RTGS.</s>

en: The head of the Community Working Group on Health, Mr Itai Rusike, told Studio 7 that it was important for the government to give the health sector more money in the budget.

en: Many in the country are also complaining that Health Insurance cards are not working and when buying medicines from pharmacies they are being told to bring in US dollars just to stay home.
