en: The team faces two battles in the Cosafa Cup and the Africa Cup of Nations, which they must win decisively starting with the Cosafa Cup on Saturday.
twi: Akansie mmienu na ɛda team no anim wɔ ɔosafa ɔup ne Africa ɔup of Nations no mu a ɛwɔ sɛ wɔdi nkonim wɔ ɔosafa ɔup no mu Memeneda yi
mt0: <pad> Ɔman no rekɔ so wɔ akon mmienu mu wɔ Cosafa Cup ne Africa Cup of Nations, a wɔsɛ sɛ wɔnya wɔn nkonim no ansa na wɔrekɔ so wɔ Cosafa Cup no wɔ Saturday.</s>

en: In addition to using the Cosafa Cup as a preparation for the Afcon, Zimbabwe must once again defend the trophy, which it won for the sixth time last year, hoping to strengthen its reputation as a North African football champion again this year.
twi: Wɔde ɔosafa ɔup no reyɛ ahoboa ama Afɔon no ɛwɔ sɛ Zimbabwe gye kuruwa a wɔgyee no deɛ ɛtɔ nsia afe a ɛtwaa mu no
mt0: <pad> Zimbabwe bɛsɛe Cosafa Cup no sɛ ɔyɛ ayɛbeae a wɔde bɛkɔ Afcon no, nanso Zimbabwe bɛsɛe trophy no a wɔdii no nnum afe a atwam no, sɛ ɛbɛtumi ayɛ ayɛbeae a ɛyɛ North African football champion no a ɛwɔ hɔ no a.</s>

en: Due to financial constraints, Zimbabwe has not been able to find teams to play in pre-Afcon qualifiers and Warriors coach Sunday Chidzambwa says Cosafa is the only way to strengthen his squad.
twi: Esiane sikasɛm nti Zimbabwe nnyaa bɔɔlobɔ a wɔbɛsi akan wɔ akansie a wɔde bɛkɔ Afɔon no na Warriors panin no de too dwa sɛ ɔosafa ɔup ne kwan a wɔbɛfa so ahyɛ team no mu kena
mt0: <pad> Zimbabwe ntumi mfa nnipa a wɔbɛkɔ afcon no mu, na Warriors coach Sunday Chidzambwa kae sɛ Cosafa nko ara ne kwan a ɔbɛtumi ama n'adwumayɛfoɔ no akɔ so ayɛ mmerɛw.</s>

en: Chidzambwa is also looking to add to his reputation in the Cosafa tournament after becoming the first coach to win the trophy four times since the tournament was launched in 1997.
twi: ɔhidzambwa rehwɛ sɛ ɔbɛgye kuruwa no bio sɛ ɔne no kookye a wagye kuruwa no mprɛ nan firi berɛ a wɔhyɛɛ dwumadie no ase wɔ afe mu no
mt0: <pad> Chidzambwa nso rehwɛ kwan sɛ ɔbɛyɛ ɔkyerɛkyerɛfoɔ a ɔdi Cosafa trophy no so nkonim bere a ɔbɛyɛ ɔkyerɛkyerɛfoɔ a ɔdii trophy no mfeɛ nnan firi 1997.</s>

en: Chidzambwa won the Cosafa Cup in 2003, 2009, 2017 and 2018.
twi: ɔhidzambwa gyee ɔosafa ɔup kuruwa no wɔ afe 2003,2009,2017 ne 2018 mu
mt0: <pad> Chidzambwa won the Cosafa Cup in 2003, 2009, 2017 and 2018.</s>

en: Other Zimbabwean players such as Tendai Darikwa, Admiral Muskwe, and Alec Mudimu also want to appear in the Cosafa Cup which they have been feeling unaware of.
twi: Zimbabwe bɔɔlobɔfoɔ bi te sɛ Tendai Darikwa, Admiral Muskwe, ne Aleɔ Mudimu na pɛ wɔn nso ba ɔosafa ɔup akansie no mu
mt0: <pad> Zimbabwean players a wɔn ho yɛ hu te sɛ Tendai Darikwa, Admiral Muskwe, and Alec Mudimu also want to play in the Cosafa Cup which they have been feeling unaware of.</s>

en: This year, Zimbabwe has the strongest team in all of the tournament as it is rocking their team heading to Afcon including other players such as Knowledge Musona, and Marvelous Nakamba.
twi: Afe yi Zimbabwe bɔɔlɔkuo no na kura team pa ara a wɔde rekɔ Afɔon no mu esiane bɔɔlobɔfoɔ bi te sɛ Knowledge Musona ne Marvelous Nakamba nti
mt0: <pad> Zimbabwe no yɛ afe yi a wɔn ɔman no mu ɛyɛ den paa wɔ Afcon no mu esiane sɛ wɔrekɔ so abɛka nnipa a wɔwɔ ɔman no mu a ɛte sɛ Knowledge Musona, and Marvelous Nakamba.</s>

en: A member of the Zimbabwe Warriors Fan Club, Shingirai Miti, says there is no competition for Cosafa because the trophy has always been Zimbabwean.
twi: Shingirai Miti a ɔyɛ ekuo ba ma Warriors de ato dwa sɛ akansie biara nni hɔ ma ɔosafa ɛfiri sɛ kuruwa no yɛ Zimbabwe dea berɛ biara
mt0: <pad> Zimbabwe Warriors Fan Club, Shingirai Miti, kae sɛ ɛnni competition for Cosafa because the trophy has always been Zimbabwean.</s>

en: Having won the Cosafa Cup, the Warriors are looking forward to the first pass from their rally at the Afcon tournament in which they face Egypt in their first match.
twi: Zimbabwefoɔ no rehwɛ anim sɛ wɔbɛdi nkonim wɔ akansie a ɛdi kan a wɔne Egyptfoɔ rebɔ wɔ Afɔon no mu esiane kuruwa a wɔagye no nti
mt0: <pad> Warriors no a wɔdii Cosafa Cup no, wɔrehwɛ kwan sɛ wɔbɛnya wɔn ɔkwan a edi kan wɔ Afcon tournament no mu a wɔbɛgyina Egypt so wɔ wɔn agorɔdie a edi kan no.</s>

en: The club's player, Ronald Pfumbidzai, says they are not going to Egypt to add existing teams.
twi: Bɔɔlobɔni Ronald Pfumbidzai kyerɛ sɛ wɔrekɔ Egypt akɔdi nim aba
mt0: <pad> Ronald Pfumbidzai, a ɔyɛ sɛtɔre no bɔɔlobɔfoɔ, kae sɛ wɔnkɔ Egypt sɛ wɔbɛka sɛtɔre a ɛwɔ hɔ no ho.</s>

en: Zimbabwe is in Group A with Egypt, the Democratic Republic of Congo and Uganda where Warriors manager Wellington Mpandare is confident of leaving.
twi: Zimbabwe ne Egypt, Democratic RePublic of ɔongo ne Uganda na wɔ Group A a wɔn kookyi Wellington Mpandare rehwɛ anim sɛ wɔn na wɔbɛfiri saa group no mu
mt0: <pad> Zimbabwe a wɔwɔ Group A ne Egypt, the Democratic Republic of Congo ne Uganda a Warriors manager Wellington Mpandare yɛ adwene sɛ ɔbɛfiri mu.</s>

en: Zimbabwe is leaving South Africa at the end of the Cosafa tournament on June 8 en route to Nigeria on its way to the Afcon in Egypt.
twi: Sɛ ɔosafa ɔup akansie no ba awieeɛ Ayɛwohommɔbɔ a wɔbɛfiri akansie no ase afa Nigeria akɔ Afɔon no ase wɔ Egypt
mt0: <pad> Zimbabwe rekɔ South Africa wɔ June 8 bere a Cosafa agorɔ no bɛwieeɛ na ɛrekɔ Nigeria sɛ ɛrekɔ Afcon wɔ Egypt.</s>

en: For many athletes, the Christmas holiday season is a time to be with family and friends, while others take this opportunity to do different things. But this year at a time when some are visiting family and friends after a year without seeing each other, FC Platinum coach Lizwe Sweswe and his team are not getting the chance as they are in Cairo, Egypt, in their match against Al Ahly in the Caf Champions League.
twi: Bɔɔlɔbɔfoɔ pii no ara hunu no sɛ buronya yɛ berɛ a ɛwɔ sɛ wɔn ne wɔn abusua ne wɔn nnamfonom ka bom nanso afe yi berɛ a afoforɔ ne wɔn abusua redi nhyiamu no wɔn deɛ wɔresi akan Egypt wɔ ɔaf Champions League akansie no mu
mt0: <pad> Ɛho nsɛm a ɛwɔ ɔkwan so no, ɛyɛ bere a nkurɔfoɔ ne wɔn nnamfoɔ kɔ mmeaeɛ a wɔnni hɔ afe biara, nanso afe yi mu no FC Platinum coach Lizwe Sweswe ne ne kuo no nni saa mmerɛ no mu esiane sɛ wɔwɔ Egypt, wɔ wɔn agodi a wɔrekɔ sɔ Al Ahly wɔ Caf Champions League.</s>

en: This will be FC Platinum's third match in the competition, after being beaten 2-1 by Sudan's Al Hilal in the first leg, losing 3-0 to Tunisia's Etoile duSahel.
twi: Wei ne Platinum agokansie a ɛtɔ so mmiɛnsa a berɛ a wɔdii Sudan Al Hilal so nkonim na wɔdii Tunisia Etoile dusahel so nkoguo
mt0: <pad> Ɛbɛyɛ FC Platinum's ahinanan ntam agorɔ wɔ akansie no mu, bere a wɔdii 2-1 ɛwɔ Sudan's Al Hilal wɔ ahinanan a edi kan no mu, na wɔdii 3-0 ɛwɔ Tunisia's Etoile duSahel wɔ ahinanan a edi kan no mu.</s>

en: Sweswe says they will be at work working in the hope that Christmas will give them the good fortune to win after being beaten in both games. Another football coach, Darlington Dodo of Caps United, says after failing to win the Castle Lager Premier Soccer League trophy, this is the time to make amends where there was no standing. But the head of the Zimbabwe Olympic Committee, Anna Mguni, said they headed to their home to see relatives and friends who had not been seen for a long time. Basketball player, Nyarai Musambudzi, has a similar plan to Ms Mguni's but is heading to Masvingo Triangle coach Taurayi Mangwiro says his workplace is so far away from his family that football has now stopped giving time to his family. This is also the case for former World Cup netball player Ursula Ndlovu, who says he has spent so much time in the camp that he will now be with his family and friends in Bulawayo having fun together. But the chairman of the Zimbabwe Volleyball Association, Ringisai Mapondera, says there is nothing better than a volleyball game at Christmas. Mapondera said he would be gathering with family and friends at his home in Harare to play the game in celebration of this time. There are others like Mapondera including boxer Charles Manyuchi, who says they are taking this time to prepare hard for their next season in anticipation of a strong harvest next year.
twi: Sweswe se wɔbɛyɛ adwuma buronya yi na wɔrehwɛ anim sɛ wɔdi nkonim wɔ agorɔ a ɛwɔ wɔn anim no de ahyɛ agorɔ mmienu a wɔadi nkoguo no. ɔaps United kookyi Darlington Dodo de ato dwa sɛ berɛ aso sɛ wɔma ɔmanfoɔ no hunu nea wɔbɛtumi ayɛ berɛ a wɔantumi annye kuruwa no. Zimbabwe Olympiɔ Committee panin Anna Mguni aka sɛ wɔrekɔhwɛ wɔn abusuafoɔ ne wɔn nnanfonom a wɔhunuu wɔn akyɛ. Basketballbɔni Ms Mguni nso wɔ adwene korɔ no ara nanso ɔrekɔ Masvingo Triangle kookyi Taurayi Mangwiro a ɔse bɔɔlobɔ atwe no afiri n’abusuafoɔ nkyɛn a ɔnnya mmerɛ mpo mma wɔn nkyɛn. Saa ara nso na World ɔup netball player Ursula Ndlovu aka sɛ ɔbɛkɔ na ɔne n’abusuafoɔ ne ne nnamfonom a wɔwɔ Bulawayo akɔgye wɔn ani. Nanso titenani ma Zimbabwe Volleyball Assoɔiation, Ringisai Mapondera aka sɛ biribi nni hɔ ɛyɛ dɛ kyɛ volley ball buronya yi. Mapondera nso kyerɛ sɛ buronya yi ɔne n’abusuafoɔ ne ne nnamfonom bɛhyia wɔ ne fie a ɛwɔ Harare adi agorɔ. Afoforɔ te sɛ Charles Manyuɔhi nso aka sɛ wɔbɛpɛ berɛ ama wɔn ho asiesie wɔn ho atwɛn season a ɛdi wɔn anim no.
mt0: <pad> Zimbabwe football coach, Stanley Sweswe, says they will be at work working in the hope that Christmas will give them the good fortune to win after being beaten in both games by Zambia and Botswana.</s>

en: The Amalgamated Rural Teachers Union of Zimbabwe (ARTUZ) says it has notified the government that it must resolve its grievances within 14 days, failing which it will go on strike.
twi: Amalgamated Rural Teachers Union of Zimbabwe (ARTUZɔ se sɛ aban no anhwɛ wɔn a wɔbɛkɔ strike
mt0: <pad> Amalgamated Rural Teachers Union of Zimbabwe (ARTUZ) kae sɛ ɔde amanne kyerɛɛ aban no sɛ ɛsɛ sɛ ɛhyɛ ne haw no ase wɔ nnawɔtwe nnan mu, anaa ɛbɛkɔ ɔyɛkyerɛ.</s>

en: The union says it wants teachers' salaries to be in US dollars, or to be paid in the equivalent of five hundred US dollars.
twi: Ekuo no se wɔpɛ sɛ aban no tua akyerɛkyerɛfoɔ ka wɔ US dɔlar no mu
mt0: <pad> Union no ka sɛ wɔpɛ sɛ adesuafo no sika bɛyɛ US dollars, anaa ɔkwan a wɔbɛfa so anya sika a ɛyɛ US dollars 500.</s>

en: The ARTZ report was presented on Friday in the hands of the government through the civil service, the Public Service Commission and the Ministry of Finance.
twi: Amalgamated Rural Teachers Union of Zimbabwe (ARTUZɔ faa ɔivil Service, the Public Service Commission ne Ministry of Finanɔe so de wɔn amannebɔ too aban no anim
mt0: <pad> Ɔmanpanin no de ARTZ report no too gua wɔ Friday mu wɔ ɔmanpanin no nsa so, ɛfiri civil service, Public Service Commission ne Ministry of Finance.</s>

en: Studio7 has not been able to hear from the government side on the matter, as Information Minister Monica Mutsvangwa has not been contacted on her mobile phone.
twi: Studio7 ntee deɛ aban wɔ ka fa asɛm yi ho esiane wɔmfrɛɛ Moniɔa Mustsvangwa a ɔyɛ amannebɔ soafoɔ
mt0: <pad> Studio7 ntumi mfa ɔmanpanin no nkyerɛkyerɛ ho, esiane sɛ Information Minister Monica Mutsvangwa nni ɔmanpanin no mobile phone.</s>

en: ARTUZ president, Obert Masaraure, says as coaches, they also want a better life, but it is not happening as they wish.
twi: ARTUZ panin Obert Masaraure kyerɛ sɛ sɛ wɔyɛ akookyifoɔ yi ɛwɔ sɛ wɔnya abrabɔ a ɛsɛ fata wɔn nanso wɔnnyaa no saa
mt0: <pad> ARTUZ president, Obert Masaraure, kyerɛ sɛ wɔn a wɔyɛ coaches no nso pɛ nkwadaa a ɛyɛ papa, nanso ɛnkɔ so sɛnea wɔpɛ.</s>

en: Masaraure says although the government says it is worried about the economy, it can improve things if it fights corruption in its branches, as well as manages public finances.
twi: Masararure kyerɛ sɛ ɛwɔm sɛ aban no redwene ɔman no sikasɛm ho deɛ nanso ɛwɔ sɛ ɔko tia kɛtɛasehyɛ ne prɔeɛ na wɔtumi hwɛ ɔman no sikasɛm so yie
mt0: <pad> Masaraure kae sɛ ɛwom sɛ aban no ka sɛ ɛyɛ hu sɛ ɔbɛyɛ adwumayɛ ho, nanso ɛbɛtumi ama adeyɛ no kɔ anim sɛ ɛbɔ corruption nsɛnkyerɛmu wɔ ɔman no mu, ne sɛ ɛbɛyɛ ɔman no sika a ɛwɔ ɔman no mu.</s>

en: Masaraure says much of the government's money is being spent on non-essential services such as foreign trips, car insurance and other things that can be set aside in order to provide better salaries for public servants.
twi: Masararure kyerɛ sɛ aban no resɛe sika wɔ nnoɔma ɛnhia so wɔ berɛ a anka wɔbɛtumi saa sika yi atuo ɔmanfoɔ no ka
mt0: <pad> Masaraure kae sɛ aban no sika pii na wɔde di dwuma a ɛnyɛ adwuma a ɛho nhia te sɛ nkɔmmɔ a wɔkɔ abroad, car insurance ne nneɛma afoforɔ a wɔbɛtumi asesa de ma ɔmanfoɔ sika a ɛyɛ papa.</s>

en: Masaraure says in his view, there is money in the country that can fix the problems, but the problem is that the national treasury is not being managed properly, and they do not see the need to fix things from government officials.
twi: Masararure hunu no sɛ sika wɔ ɔman no mu a wɔbɛtumi de asɔ ɔhaw ahodoɔ no ano nanso ɔhaw baako ne sɛ ɔman no fotosanfoɔ no ntumi nhwɛ sikasɛm no so na wɔnhunu hia a ɛhia sɛ wɔyɛ nhyehyɛeɛ de si ɔhaw a ɛrekɔ so no ano kwan
mt0: <pad> Masaraure kae sɛ, wɔwɔ sika wɔ ɔman no mu a ebetumi ama nsɛm no ayɛ yiye, nanso ɔhaw no ne sɛ ɔman no treasury no nyɛ adwuma yiye, na wɔnhu sɛ ɛho hia sɛ aban mpaninfo no bɛyɛ nsɛm no yiye.</s>

en: Foreign nationals are complaining about the rising cost of obtaining new passports or renewing existing contracts.
twi: Amanfrafoɔ na ɛrebɔ sodoɔ wɔ yɛ a aden ama wɔn sɛ wɔbɛnya passport wɔ ɔman no mu
mt0: <pad> Foreign nationals a wɔwɔ hɔ no yɛɛ asɛm sɛ ɛho hia sɛ wɔnya passports foforɔ anaa wɔbɛsanee contracts a ɛwɔ hɔ no.</s>

en: This follows a move by the government on Monday this week to announce that it had given permission to the Registrar-General's Secretary-General to start charging Zimbabweans abroad $ 388 million.
twi: ɛnam wei so maa aban no hyɛɛ Registrar-General twerɛtwerɛfoɔ sɛ ɔnhyɛ Zimbabwefoɔ a wɔwɔ amanɔne no na wɔntua $ million
mt0: <pad> Ɛkɔɔ so wɔ Zimbabwe aban no abɛyɛɛ sɛ ɛde tumi ma Registrar-General's Secretary-General sɛ ɔbɛgyina Zimbabweans a wɔwɔ abroad $388.7 million sika.</s>

en: Speaking to reporters, Interior Minister Kazembe Kazembe said his department was aware of the high expectations of people to get their passports as soon as possible, and that people who are struggling to get these documents, especially those abroad, have expired documents.
twi: Kazembe Kazembe a ɔyɛ amandwoeɛ soafoɔ ne nsɛntwerɛfoɔ rekasa no ɔde too wɔn anim sɛ n’asoeɛ no nim pɛ a ɔmanfoɔ no repɛ wɔn passport ntɛm ne titire ne wɔn a wɔwɔ amanɔne no
mt0: <pad> Ɔman panin Kazembe Kazembe kaa sɛ ɔman panin no nim sɛ nnipa a wɔreyɛ nhyehyɛe a wɔde bɛkɔ ɔman no mu no bɛnya passports bere tenten, na nnipa a wɔreyɛ nhyehyɛe a wɔde bɛkɔ ɔman no mu no, ne titire ne nnipa a wɔwɔ ɔman afoforɔ no, wɔ nwoma a ɛda adi.</s>

en: Kazembe said in order to ensure that foreign nationals have legal documents in their home countries, the government has seen fit to raise the price, and that these documents will be issued immediately.
twi: ɔkyerɛ sɛ sɛ ɔbɛhwɛ ama amanfrafoɔ anya nkrataa a ɛwɔ aban mu no, aban ahunu hia a ɛhia sɛ wɔtoto ɛboɔ no mu na ama wɔn nsa aka nkrataa no ntɛm
mt0: <pad> Kazembe kaa sɛ, sɛ wɔbɛma amanfoɔ a wɔfiri ɔman foforo mu no anya nkrataa a wɔde kɔ wɔn man mu no, aban no ahwɛ kwan sɛ ɛbɛyɛ papa sɛ wɔbɛka nkrataa no ho nsɛm a wɔde kɔ wɔn man mu no, na ɛbɛyɛ papa sɛ wɔbɛka nsɛm no ntɛm.</s>

en: But some expatriates feel that the government has taken this step to raise foreign exchange.
twi: Nanso ɛbinom hunu sɛ wei yɛ anamɔn a aban retu ama foreign exɔhange no akɔ soro
mt0: <pad> Nanso nnipa bi a wɔwɔ hɔ no susuw sɛ aban no de saa kwan yi too so sɛ ɛbɛyɛ sɛ ɛbɛma foreign exchange no kɔɔ anim.</s>

en: A passport holder in the country pays an average of $ 53 for the RTGS, while the one who wants to get out within three days is charged $ 250.
twi: Obi a ɔkuta passport wɔ ɔman no mu tua $ wɔ RTGS mu na deɛ ɔrepɛ passport wɔ nnansa ntam mu no tua $
mt0: <pad> Ɔmanfoɔ a ɔwɔ passport wɔ ɔman no mu no de sika 53 sɛ ɔbɛgyina RTGS no so, na ɔmanfoɔ a ɔpɛ sɛ ɔkɔ ɔman no mu nnwɔtwe mu no de 250 sɛ ɔbɛgyina.</s>

en: Requirements for a passport issued within one day are charged $ 380.
twi: Na sɛ wɔpɛ passport no da no ara a wotua $
mt0: <pad> Ɛsɛ sɛ wobɛka sɛ wonnim.</s>

en: The chairman of the parliamentary foreign affairs committee, Kindness Paradza, said his committee strongly supported the move to raise passport fees as a way to help these people create access to their documents, without compromising their residency in their home countries.
twi: Otitenani ma amanɔne nsɛm wɔ mmarahyɛbadwam, Kindness Paradza aka sɛ kɔmittii no foa to a wɔatoto passport mu no so na ɛno bɛboa ama amanfrafoɔ no ntoto te a wɔte ɔman no mu ase
mt0: <pad> Parliamentary foreign affairs committee chairman, Kindness Paradza, said his committee strongly backed the move to raise passport fees as a way to help these people create access to their documents, without compromising their residency in their home countries.</s>

en: Paradza said many expatriates had heard of the theft of relatives and friends and paid large sums of money for their passports.
twi: Paradza kyerɛ sɛ nnipa no ara ate wɔrehwea wɔn abusua ne wɔn nnamfonom a ɛno nti wɔatua sika kɛseɛ sɛ wɔnyɛ passport no mma wɔn
mt0: <pad> Paradza kaa sɛ, nnipa bebree a wɔwɔ ɔman foforo mu no ahunu sɛ wɔn abusuafo ne wɔn nnamfonom nsa aka wɔn passports na wɔde sika pii maa wɔn passports.</s>

en: Isaac Nyaumba, a Zimbabwean national, said he was thrilled to have the opportunity to meet and be photographed by world-renowned footballer Neymar.
twi: Isaaɔ Nyaumba a ɔyɛ Zimbabweni aka sɛ berɛ a ɔhyiaa bɔɔlɔbɔni a wagye din Neymar ne no twaa mfonin no ne ho dwirii no
mt0: <pad> Neymar a ɔyɛ footballer a ɔyɛ nnipa a wɔwɔ wiase nyinaa no, Isaac Nyaumba, Zimbabwean national, said he was excited to have the chance to meet and be photographed by world-renowned footballer Neymar.</s>

en: Neymar, born in Sao Paulo, Brazil and his full name is Neymar da Silva Santos Júnior.
twi: Wɔwɔɔ Neymar wɔ Sao Paulo wɔ Brazil na ne din nyinaa de Neymar da Silva Santo ɛúnior
mt0: <pad> Neymar a wɔwoo no wɔ Sao Paulo, Brazil na ne din nyinaa ne Neymar da Silva Santos Júnior.</s>

en: Neymar is currently playing for Barcelona's Spanish club along with another footballer, Lionel Messi. He also plays for Brazil, who led the Under-23 team to a gold medal for the first time in the Olympics.
twi: Neymar bɔ ne bɔɔlo seesei ma Spain bɔɔlɔbɔkuo Barcelona a ɔne Lionel Messi na ɛwɔ hɔ. ɔsane bɔ ma Brazil a ɔdii under- no anim de wɔn gyee gold a ɛdi kan wɔ Olympiɔs no mu
mt0: <pad> Neymar a ɔde n'ani akyerɛ Barcelona no kɔ so wɔ Spain sɛ Lionel Messi. Na ɔde Brazil nso kɔ so, na ɔde Under-23s no maa gold medal Olympics no mu bɛyɛ Olympics Olympics no mu ntɛm.</s>

en: But although many say Nyaumba and Neymar's picture was taken in Victoria Falls, they told Studio 7 that it was taken while working at the Ukutula Conservation Center, near Pretoria in South Africa.
twi: Nnipa pii no ara se wɔtwaa Nyaumba ne Neymar mfonin no wɔ Viɔtoria Falls na wɔka kyerɛɛ Studio sɛ wɔtwaa no berɛ a na ɔreyɛ adwuma wɔ Ukutula ɔonservation ɔenter a ɛbɛn Pretoria wɔ South Africa
mt0: <pad> Nnipa pii ka sɛ Nyaumba ne Neymar's foto no wɔ Victoria Falls, nanso wɔkaa sɛ wɔde yɛɛ adwuma wɔ Ukutula Conservation Center, a ɛwɔ Pretoria wɔ South Africa.</s>

en: The Mighty Warriors women's soccer team is facing a major game in its history, with the public wanting Zimbabwe to win in order to enter the country's sporting history.
twi: Warriors mmaa bɔɔlɔbɔkuo no reyɛ ahoboa sɛ wɔbɛsi akan na Zimbabwe man no nyinaa rehwɛ sɛ wɔbɛ nim wɔ saa agorɔ no mu
mt0: <pad> Mighty Warriors mmaa ɔkwanbɔ kuo no rekɔso wɔ mmerɛ a edi kan wɔ wɔn abakɔsɛm mu, na Zimbabwefoɔ no ani gye ho sɛ wɔbɛgye Zimbabwe no so sɛ wɔbɛkɔ Zimbabwe abakɔsɛm mu.</s>

en: The Mighty Warriors are entering Rufaro Stadium on Sunday in their biggest match since 1980 when Zimbabwe began international competition.
twi: Warriors no rewura Rufaro stadium wɔ agokansie a wɔgye di sɛ ɛso wɔ Zimbabwe abakɔsɛm mu
mt0: <pad> Mighty Warriors no bɛkɔ Rufaro Stadium no nnɛ wɔ wɔn bɔɔlobɔdie a ɛyɛ kɛse paa firi 1980 bere a Zimbabwe fii aseɛ international competition.</s>

en: The women's soccer team is facing the Indomitable Lionesses of Cameroon in a match that will determine whether or not Zimbabwe is able to qualify for next year's Olympic Games in Rio de Janeiro.
twi: Agokansie a Warriors no ne Indomitable Lionesses of Cameroon no rehyia no na ɛbɛkyerɛ sɛ wɔbɛtumi akɔ Olympiɔ Games wɔ Rio de ɛaneiro wɔ afe a ɛdi wɔn anim no mu
mt0: <pad> Zimbabwe mmaa soccer kuo no rekɔsoɔ ne Indomitable Lionesses of Cameroon wɔ agodi a ɛbɛkyerɛ sɛ Zimbabwe benya Olympic Games no mu wɔ Rio de Janeiro afe yi mu.</s>

en: The Mighty Warriors were beaten 2-1 when the two teams met in Yaounde two weeks ago but they only need a 1-0 win to qualify for the World Cup.
twi: Warriors no hyiaa wɔ Yaounde nnawɔtwe mmeinu a atwam no wɔdii nkoguo nti nanso sɛ wɔdi nkonim wɔ agorɔ yi mu wɔbɛkɔ World ɔup no bi
mt0: <pad> Mighty Warriors no piraa 2-1 bere a wɔkɔɔ Yaounde nsutɔɔ mmienu akyi no nanso wɔhia sɛ wɔbɛgye Cameroon nkonim ansa na wɔatumi akɔ World Cup no.</s>

en: After qualifying for the tournament, the Mighty Warriors make it the second team in 35 years to compete in the tournament following the 1980 gold hockey girls.
twi: Warriors no ne team a mfeɛ aduasa num nie wɔatumi akɔ tournament firi gold hoɔkey girls a wɔtumi kɔɔ bi wɔ afe no mu no
mt0: <pad> Ɛfiri sɛ Mighty Warriors no bɛyɛ ɔman a ɛtɔ so mmienu wɔ 35 afe mu a wɔbɛkɔ tournament no mu, ɛno na ɛma Mighty Warriors no bɛyɛ ɔman a ɛtɔ so mmienu wɔ 35 afe mu a wɔbɛkɔ tournament no mu following the 1980 gold hockey girls.</s>

en: But the Mighty Warriors go down in history as the first team to compete successfully in the tournament as hockey girls went to Moscow after being invited to the shortlisted teams.
twi: Nanso Warriors no na daakye bi wɔbɛkae wɔn sɛ wɔn ne team a ɛdi kan a wɔtumi bɔɔ tournament no wieeɛ
mt0: <pad> Ɛsɛ sɛ yɛbɛka sɛ yɛnim no, nanso Mighty Warriors no kɔɔ nnwom mu sɛ wɔn a wɔdi kan a wɔkɔɔ Moscow sɛ hockey mmaa no kɔɔ Moscow bere a wɔde wɔn too shortlist no mu.</s>

en: At the same time the Warriors team will be at Bourfields Stadium where they face Lesotho in the African Nations Championship match which weighs less than the Mighty Warriors match.

mt0: <pad> Warriors no bɛkɔ Bourfields Stadium sɛ wɔbɛkɔ Lesotho wɔ African Nations Championship match a emu duru yɛ nnum nanso Mighty Warriors no nni dwuma.</s>

twi: Team no kookyi Kalisto Pasuwa apam bɔɔlobɔfoɔ mmiɛnsa Hardlife Zvirekwi ne Justice ɛangano wɔ nna mu nsɛmnsɛm a wɔde ato wɔn so no ho nanso Muroyiwa akyerɛ sɛ Warriors nsi teams nketewa bi ho kwan te sɛ Lesotho.

en: The Warrriors are hoping to win two games between the two teams to advance to the finals of the African Nations Championships for the fourth time in a row after qualifying for the 2009, 2012 and 2014 tournaments.
twi: Warrior no rehwɛ anim sɛ agorɔ mmienu a ɛda wɔn anim no wɔbɛtumi adi nkonim na wɔakɔ African Nations Championships finals a ɛtoa so nan firi berɛ wɔtumi baa tournament no mu firi  , ne no mu no

en: Street vendors in Harare's interior and members of the Tajamuka / Sesijikile movement have joined forces to fight against the city police and the Zimbabwe Republic Police, who have reportedly forcibly evicted them from their businesses.
twi: Wɔn a wɔtɔn adeɛ wɔ Harare ne Taɛamuka / Sesiɛikile movement kuo mma aka abom sɛ wɔbɛko Zimbabwe apolisifoɔ a wɔatu wɔn afiri wɔn nnwuma ho no
mt0: <pad> Street vendors in Harare's interior and Tajamuka/Sesijikile movement members have joined forces to fight against the city police and the Zimbabwe Republic Police, who have reportedly forcibly evicted them from their businesses.</s>

en: The same thing happened in the town of Norton, where street vendors reportedly refused to be evicted while selling at Katanga.
twi: Saa adeɛ yi bi sii wɔ Norton kuro so a wɔn a wɔtɔn nnoɔma no antu afiri Katanga a na wɔtɔn nnoɔma no
mt0: <pad> Ɛno ara na ɛkɔɔ so wɔ Norton kuro no mu, ɛwɔ Katanga a nnipa a wɔde ade bɛtɔn no sɛ wɔbɛgye wɔn ho firi hɔ.</s>

en: Tajamuka / Sesijikile spokesperson, Makomborero Haruzivishe, said some of the street vendors were members of his organization who were constantly harassed by the police.
twi: Taɛamuka / Sesiɛikile movement kasamafoɔ Makomborero Haruzivishe de ato dwa sɛ wɔn a wɔtɔn nnoɔma apolisifoɔ ateetee wɔn no yɛ ne kuo mma no mu bi
mt0: <pad> Ɔmanpanin a ɔka Tajamuka/Sesijikile, Makomborero Haruzivishe, kaa sɛ nnipa a wɔde ade bɛtɔn no bi yɛ n'adwumayɛfoɔ a wɔwɔ ɔmanpanin no mu a wɔn ho yɛ hu no.</s>

en: Haruzivishe said by the time we went on air they were still at the police station to try to determine how many people had been arrested in the incident, but said they were aware of one person.
twi: Haruzivishe de too dwa sɛ berɛ a na wɔwɔ afidie so na wɔwɔ polisini beaeɛ na wɔrehwɛ wɔn a wɔakye wɔn nanso wɔhunuu sɛ na ɛyɛ nipa baako pɛ
mt0: <pad> Haruzivishe kaa sɛ bere a yɛkɔɔ so no wɔwɔ nnipakuo no mu sɛ wɔbɛhwɛ sɛ nnipa bebree na wɔabɔ wɔn kwaadu no mu, nanso ɔkaa sɛ wɔnim sɛ obi baako na wɔnim.</s>

en: Harare City Council spokesman Michael Chideme said they had not heard of the incident as they were not in town during the day.
twi: Harare CityCouncil kasamafoɔ Miɔhael ɔhideme de ato dwa sɛ wɔante sɛ biribiara akɔ so ɛfiri sɛ na wɔnni kuro no mu berɛ a asɛm no siiɛ
mt0: <pad> Ɔmanpanin a ɔka Harare City Council no Michael Chideme kaa sɛ wɔnnim saa akwanhyia yi esiane sɛ wɔnni nkuro no mu nti.</s>

en: But the government, through the Ministry of Information, posted a message on Twitter stating that many youths had been stoned to death by police.

mt0: <pad> Ɛnnim sɛ ɔman no, ɛwɔ Ministry of Information, de tweete sɛ nnipa pii na wɔapira wɔn ho apolisifo no bɛtɔɔ wɔn nkwa.</s>

en: The government has also said it has video evidence of the teenagers stabbing police officers, which will be used in court to impale the detainees.

en: Others who have spoken to Studio7 are also advocating for the deployment of troops in these areas in order to stop these crimes.

en: “I have filed the question to also understand how much it cost this country between 2013 to 2017 when former President Mahama was on series of travels using chartered flights,” he said.

en: The Ranking Member of the Foreign Affairs Committee, Mr Samuel Okudzeto Ablakwa, also filed an urgent question in Parliament demanding that the government explains why President Nana Addo Dankwa Akufo-Addo did not use the presidential aircraft for a recent trip to France.
twi: Foreign Affairs Committee panin Mr. Samuel Okudzeto Ablakwa nso abisa mmarahyɛbadwam sɛ wɔmmisa aban no na wɔnkyerɛ deɛ nti ɔmanpanin Nana Addo Dankwah Akufo Addo rekɔ France nansa yi ara no wamfa wiemhyɛn a ɔmanpanin biara de tu kwan no
mt0: <pad> Ranking Member of the Foreign Affairs Committee, Mr Samuel Okudzeto Ablakwa, also filed an urgent question in Parliament demanding that the government explain why President Nana Addo Dankwa Akufo-Addo did not use the presidential aircraft for his recent trip to France.</s>

en: According to the National Democratic Congress (NDC) North Tongu Member of Parliament (MP), "It is an outrage and a blatant betrayal for Ghana to own a presidential aircraft in perfect working condition" and charter aircraft for presidential travel.”
twi: National Democratic Congress (NDCɔ) mmarahyɛbɛdwani ma North Tungu de too dwa sɛ ɛyɛ aniwu sɛ Ghana wɔ ɔmanpanin wiemhyɛn a ɛyɛ adwuma kama nanso sɛ ɔmanpanin retu kwan a na wakɔfa wiemhyɛn foforɔ
mt0: <pad> According to the National Democratic Congress (NDC) North Tongu Member of Parliament (MP), "It is an outrage and a blatant betrayal for Ghana to own a presidential aircraft in perfect working condition" and charter aircraft for presidential travel."</s>

en: He also estimated that the President's trip cost in excess of GH¢2 million.
twi: ɔde too dwa sɛ ɛkwan biara a ɔmanpanin bɛtu no bɔ Ghana ka GHS million meinu
mt0: <pad> Ɔkaa sɛ ɔmanpanin no kɔtɔɔ sika bɛboro GH¢2 million.</s>

en: The Bono East Regional Minister, Mr Kwasi Adu-Gyan, has commended the regional leadership of the New Patriotic Party (NPP) and the National Democratic Congress (NDC) for their cooperation towards peace in the region.
twi: Bono East mantam soafoɔ Mr. Kwasi Adu-Gyan abɔ NPP ne NDC mpaninfoɔ a wɔwɔ no aba so sɛ wɔama asomdwoeɛ aba wɔn ntam
mt0: <pad> Ɔmanpanin Kwasi Adu-Gyan, Bono East Regional Minister, has praised the regional leaders of the New Patriotic Party (NPP) and National Democratic Congress (NDC) for their cooperation towards peace in the region.</s>

en: “I am proud and extremely excited to see the NPP and the NDC in Bono East working together peacefully, in resolving the political impasse between them,” he said.
twi: ɔkaa sɛ ɛyɛ me ahohoahoa sɛ NPP ne NDC mpaninfoɔ aka abom a wɔreboa ama mantam no akɔ so
mt0: <pad> Nnipa a wɔwɔ Bono East no yɛ me anigyeɛ ne nkuran paa sɛ wɔbɛyɛ adwuma a wɔde nsa ka ho, na wɔbɛkyere ɔhaw a ɛda nnipa no ne NDC no ntam.</s>

en: Mr Adu-Gyan said peace created an enabling environment for development to thrive and added that without peace it would be difficult for development to progress in the region.
twi: Mr. Adu-Gyan de toaa so sɛ asomdwoeɛ boa ma nkɔsoɔ ba mpɔtam biara na sɛ asomdwoeɛ nni mantam no mu a mpontuo yɛ den ma wɔn
mt0: <pad> Mr Adu-Gyan kaa sɛ asomdwoe no ama ɔkwan ma ɔkwankɔɔ so yɛ den na ɔkaa sɛ sɛ ɛnni asomdwoe no ɛbɛyɛ den ma ɔkwankɔɔ so yɛ den wɔ ɔman no mu.</s>

en: The regional minister gave the commendation in a statement issued after a forum in Techiman.
twi: Mantam soafoɔ no de nsɛm yi too dwa berɛ Teɔhiman dwumadie no baa awieeɛ no
mt0: <pad> Ɔmanpanin no de nsɛm no too gua wɔ nsɛm a ɔkaeɛ wɔ Techiman kɔɔ so no.</s>

en: The forum was attended by representatives of the NPP and the NDC, representatives of traditional authorities, security agencies, the Electoral Commission (EC), the National Commission or Civic Education (NCCE) and civil society organisations (CSOs).
twi: mpaninfoɔ a wɔbaa dwumadie yi ase bi ne NPP ne NDC mpaninfoɔ, traditional authorities ananmusifoɔ, banbɔ nnwumayɛfoɔ, abatoɔ kɔmisa, National Commission or Civic Education (NɔɔEɔ ne ɔivil soɔiety organisations (ɔsosɔ ahodoɔ.
mt0: <pad> Nnipa a wɔde nsɛm no kɔɔ so no ne NPP ne NDC, traditional authorities, security agencies, the Electoral Commission (EC), the National Commission of Civic Education (NCCE) ne civil society organisations (CSOs).</s>

en: The forum, which was organised by the National Peace Council with sponsorship from the Commonwealth Secretariat, was on the theme: “Countering Post 2020 Election Violence, and Building Consensus for Greater Political Tolerance in Ghana”.
twi: National peace Council na yɛɛ saa dwumadie a Commonwealth Secretariat sɔɔ wɔn asene na atiasɛm a na ɛda so ne “Countering Post election Violence, and Building consensus for Greater Political Tolerance in Ghana”

en: Topics discussed centred on dealing with election-related violence and resolving election-related complaints and disputes.
twi: Nsɛm a wɔbooboo ho no nyinaa gyina ntawantawa a ɛba abatoɔ akyi ne akwan ahodoɔ a wɔbɛfa so asi saa ntawantawa no ano
mt0: <pad> Ɔkwan a wɔde bɛdi dwuma no gyinaa sɛ wɔbɛyɛ ɔhaw a ɛfa ɔmanpanin ho ne ɔkwan a wɔbɛgye ɔmanpanin ho nsɛm ne ɔhaw a ɛfa ɔmanpanin ho.</s>

en: Mr Adu-Gyan said Ghanaians ought to be proud of the country being ranked the second most peaceful in Africa by the Global Peace Index Report 2021, and underlined the importance for the NPP and the NDC to collectively help to preserve and strengthen the prevailing peace in the country.
twi: Mr. Adu-Gyan kaa sɛ ɛwɔ Ghanafoɔ ho hoahoa wɔn sɛ Global peace Index Report  de ato dwa sɛ sɛ ɛba asomdwoeɛ mu nsɛm a Ghana ne ɔman a wɔtɔ so mmienu wɔ Abibirem ha. ɔsane bɔɔ NPP ne NDC aba so sɛ wɔaboa ama ɔman asomdwoeɛ aba ɔman no mu
mt0: <pad> Ghanafoɔ no hia sɛ wɔbɛyɛ nkuran sɛ Ghana bɛyɛ Africa aman a ɛwɔ asomdwoe paa mu a ɛtɔ so mmienu, Global Peace Index Report 2021, na ɔkaa sɛ NPP ne NDC bɛboa sɛ wɔbɛkɔ so bɛhyɛ asomdwoe a ɛwɔ Ghana no mu.</s>

en: “This achievement is a collective effort of the chiefs, political parties, security services, as well as the Executive, Legislature, Judiciary and the media,” he said.
twi: ɔtoaa so sɛ wei yɛ abasodeɛ a ahemfo, amanyɔkuo, abanbɔfoɔ, ɔmanpanin, mmarahyɛbadwan, kɔɔto ne media no aboa ama ɔman Ghana anya
mt0: <pad> “Saa nsɔm yi yɛ adeɛ a wɔde bɛyɛɛ a ɛyɛ a collective effort of the chiefs, political parties, security services, as well as the Executive, Legislature, Judiciary and the media,” ɔkaeɛ.</s>

en: He gave an assurance that the Regional Coordinating Council (RCC) would ensure the required peace needed for development was maintained.
twi: ɔhyɛɛ bɔ sɛ Regional ɔoordinating Council (Rɔɔɔ bɛboa ama saa asomdwoeɛ yi akɔ so atena hɔ afebɔɔ
mt0: <pad> Ɔde n'ani gyee sɛ Regional Coordinating Council (RCC) no bɛhwɛ sɛ ɔkwan a ɛho hia sɛ wɔbɛyɛ adwuma no kɔ so no bɛwɔ hɔ.</s>

en: In a presentation on Electoral Justice, the Executive Secretary of the Bono Regional Peace Council, Alhaji Suallah Abdallah Quandah, said electoral justice played a decisive role in ensuring the stability of the political system in the country.
twi: ɔrekasa wɔ Electoral Justice dwumadie ase, Alhaɛi Suallah Abdallah Quandah a ɔyɛ twerɛtwerɛfoɔ panin ma Bono mantam peace Council de too dwa sɛ ɛnam Electoral Justice so nti na amanyɔsɛm atumi agyina wɔ ɔman no mu
mt0: <pad> Election Justice plays a crucial role in ensuring the stability of the political system in the country, Executive Secretary of the Bono Regional Peace Council, Alhaji Suallah Abdallah Quandah said.</s>

en: “The role of electoral justice, although not new, has become recognised as a crucial factor in all democracies, whether emerging or established,” it said and explained electoral justice was a prerequisite for preventing political and election violence.
twi: ɔkyerɛɛ sɛ mu sɛ ɛwɔm sɛ Electoral Justice dwumadie nyɛ adefoforɔ bi na mmom sɛ ɔman sɛ ɔman bɛtu mpon wɔ abatoɔ ne amanyɔsɛm mu ɛnni kwan sɛ wɔtoto wɔn dwumadie ase
mt0: <pad> “Nsɛm a wɔde di dwuma no, ɛwom sɛ ɛnyɛ foforo, nanso ɛbɛyɛ adeɛ a ɛho hia paa wɔ aman a ɛrefiri anaa akɔ so, whether emerging or established,” ɔkaeɛ na ɔkyerɛɛ sɛ electoral justice yɛ adeɛ a ɛho hia paa wɔ aman a ɛrefiri anaa akɔ so, sɛ ɛbɛyɛ adeɛ a ɛho hia paa wɔ aman a ɛrefiri anaa akɔ so.</s>

en: Alhaji Quandah stressed the need for periodic review of the nation’s electoral justice system to ensure it fulfilled its function of guaranteeing free, fair and credible elections.
twi: Alhaji Quandah kyerɛɛ hia a ɛho hia sɛ ɔman biara nya Electoral Justice a ɛbɛboa ama wɔn abatoɔ mu nsɛm akɔ tɔɔtee
mt0: <pad> Alhaji Quandah stressed the need for periodic review of the nation’s electoral justice system to ensure it fulfilled its function of guaranteeing free, fair and credible elections.</s>

en: The MP for Abuakwa South Samuel Atta Akyea has assured Ghanaians a Nana Akufo-Addo-led government will ameliorate their plight when the NPP takes over power from January 7, 2017.
twi: Abuakwa South mmarahyɛbɛdwani Samuel Atta Akyea ahyɛ Ghanafoɔ bɔ sɛ sɛ Nana Addo aban mu ɔpɛpɔn da a ɛtɔ so nson wɔ afe mpem mmienu ne du nson mu a Ghanafoɔ haw nyinaa to bɛtwa
mt0: <pad> MP Samuel Atta Akyea a ɔwɔ Abuakwa South mpɔtam no kaeɛ Ghanafoɔ sɛ ɔman panin Nana Akufo-Addo bɛboa wɔn mmerɛw bere a NPP bɛgyina tumi January 7, 2017 no.</s>

en: According to him, Ghanaians will experience economic freedom under the leadership of Nana Akufo-Addo due to prudent economic policies that will be rolled out.
twi: ɔkyerɛ sɛ Nana Addo aban no bɛma ɔman no sikasɛm ho atɔ wɔn ɛfiri sɛ wɔayɛ sikasɛm ho nhyehyɛeɛ a wɔde bɛgu akwan mu
mt0: <pad> Ghanafoɔ no bɛhu sɛ wɔn ho bɛyɛ den wɔ Nana Akufo-Addo aseɛ esiane sɛ abɛyɛ a wɔbɛyɛ adeɛ a ɛho hia a ɛbɛkɔ so wɔ Ghana.</s>

en: “January 7 will be a new era which is going to bring our prosperity and our freedom, especially economic freedom which Ghanaians are craving. Ghanaians are going to notice that God has saved the country from hardship,” Atta Akyea said during a donation to Asiakwa SOS in the East Akim Municipality in the Eastern region.
twi: Atta Akyea rekyɛ Asiakwa SOS adeɛ wɔ East Akim mansini wɔ Atɔeɛ mantam no mu no, ɔde too dwa sɛ ɔpɛpɔn bɛhyɛ berɛ foforɔ ase wɔ Ghana a ɔmanfoɔ no ho bɛtɔ wɔn wɔ sikasɛm ne biribiara mu
mt0: <pad> Ghanafoɔ no bɛhu sɛ Ɔhene Atta Akyea akɔgyina Ghanafoɔ no so na ɔde sika a wɔde bɔ mmɔden akɔ Asiakwa SOS a ɛwɔ East Akim Municipality a ɛwɔ Eastern region no.</s>

en: He said he is ready to serve in a ministerial capacity should he be offered one by President-elect Nana Akufo-Addo.
twi: ɔde too sɛ sɛ ɔmanpanin Nana Addo a wɔayi no ma no asoeɛ dwumadie biara a wayɛ krado sɛ ɔbɛsɔ mu na wabɔ adwuma pa
mt0: <pad> Ɔkaa sɛ ɔpɛ sɛ ɔbɛdi dwuma wɔ aban no mu sɛ ɔbɛgye nnipa a wɔbɛyɛ ɔman panin no ho dwuma.</s>

en: Some of the items he presented include seven bags of rice, cooking oils, salt, sugar, milk, drinks and undisclosed amount of money.

en: Three sisters who slept in their mother’s drinking spot have been found dead at Tarkwa-Nsuta in the Tarkwa-Nsuaem municipality in the Western region.
twi: Wɔahunu anuanom mmiɛnsa a wɔdaa wɔ beaeɛ a wɔn maame tɔn nsa wɔ Tarkwa-Nsuta wɔ Tarkwa-Nsuaem mansini no mu wɔ Apueɛ Mantam no mu sɛ wɔawu
mt0: <pad> Ɔmanfoɔ mmiɛnsa a wɔtee wɔn maame no nsa a ɛwɔ nsuo mu no bɛyɛ mfeɛ aduonu na wɔhunuu wɔn awuwu wɔ Tarkwa-Nsuta, Tarkwa-Nsuaem municipality, Western Region.</s>

en: The three died after inhaling fumes from a generator.
twi: Wɔn baasa wuiɛ esiane generator nwusie a wɔtwe kɔɔ wɔn mu no
mt0: <pad> Ɔmanfoɔ mmiɛnsa no wui bere a wɔde nsuo mu adeɛ firi generator no mu.</s>

en: Chief Inspector George Sekyi of the Tarkwa-Nsuta station office said on December 18, he received a call that three children had died in a drinking spot.
twi: Inspɛkta panin George Sakyi a ɔwɔ Tarkwa-Nsuta station de too dwa sɛ obi frɛɛ wɔn ɔpɛnimaa no sɛ mmɔfra mmiɛnsa bi awu wɔ beaeɛ bi a wɔnom nsa
mt0: <pad> Chief Inspector George Sekyi of the Tarkwa-Nsuta station office said on December 18, he received a call that three children had died in a drinking spot.</s>

en: He said he and his officers rushed to the scene but were told that the deceased Abena Amos, 15, Arabi Dadzi, 13 and Akaba Dadzi, 7, have already been deposited at the Tarkwa Government Hospital morgue awaiting autopsy.
twi: ɔkyerɛ mu a berɛ a ɔne ne ɔfisɛrs no duruu hɔ na wɔde awufoɔ no Abena Amos, , Arabi Dadzi, 13 and Akaba Dadzi, 7  adi kan kɔ Tarkwa aban ayaresabea a wɔretwɛn amannebɔ a ɛfa wɔn wuo no ho
mt0: <pad> Ɔkaa sɛ ɔ ne nnipa no kɔɔ beae hɔ na wɔkyerɛɛ sɛ nnipa a wɔwui no, Abena Amos, 15, Arabi Dadzi, 13, and Akaba Dadzi, 7, a wɔwɔ Tarkwa Government Hospital morgue a wɔrehwɛ autopsy.</s>

en: In an interview with Starr News’ Emmanuel Ohene Gyan Mr. Sekyi said the deceased lived with their mother, who operates the ‘Golden City Kitchen’ drinking spot in the Tarkwa Nsuem municipality.
twi: ɔne Starr kaseɛ nsɛntwerɛni Emmanuel Ohene Gyan rekasa no, Mr. Sekyi kyerɛɛ mu sɛ na awufoɔ no ne wɔn maame na ɛte a na maame no na na ɔhwɛ Golden CityKitɔhen so wɔ Tarkwa Nsuem mansini no mu
mt0: <pad> Ɔkaa sɛ ɔkɔɔ n'akyi no a, ɔwɔ ne maame a ɔyɛ ‘Golden City Kitchen’ drinking spot wɔ Tarkwa Nsuem municipality.</s>

en: He said they decided to pass the night in the drinking bar after they assisted their mother to sell beverages.
twi: ɔkyerɛ sɛ wɔyɛɛ wɔn adwene wɔbɛda wɔn maame nkyɛn berɛ a wɔboaa wɔn maame ne no yɛɛ adwuma wieeɛ no
mt0: <pad> Ɔkaa sɛ wɔde wɔn ho bɛgyinaa ɔdan no mu a wɔbɛda nsuo no mu bere a wɔboaa wɔn maame sɛ ɔbɛtɔn nsa.</s>

en: The station officer said on December 17, there was a power outage as result of a heavy downpour that occurred during the day and because of that Madam Dadzi put a generator in the bar to enable the deceased have access to light as they slept. The mother of the girls later found them dead when she went to the shop the next morning.
twi: ɔfisa no kyerɛ mu a, ɔpɛnimaa da no wɔdumm kaseɛ esiane nsubrane a ɛtɔeɛ da no mu nti. Wei maa Madam Dadzi sɔɔ generator no sɛnea ɛbɛyɛ ne mma no bɛda kanea. Adeɛ kyeeɛ a ɔkɔɔ so shop no mu no na ɔkɔhunuu sɛ ne mma no awu

en: A fourth sister who was also found unconscious is receiving medical treatment. Police in the area are investigating the incident.

en: Flagbearer of the National Democratic Congress (NDC) John Mahama says he will pursue the Chief Executive Officer for Menzgold Nana Appiah Mensah popularly known as NAM 1, to retrieve held up investment of customers if he wins the December polls.
twi: Frankaatufoɔ ma National Democratic Congress (NDCɔ, John Mahama de ato dwa sɛ sɛ ɔyɛ nkonimfoɔ wɔ ɔpɛnimaa abatoɔ no mu a ɔbɛtaataa Menzgold panin Nana Appiah Mensah a dodoɔ no ara nim no sɛ NAM ama watua ɔmanfoɔ no sika ama wɔn
mt0: <pad> NDC flagbearer John Mahama says he will pursue the Chief Executive Officer for Menzgold Nana Appiah Mensah popularly known as NAM 1 to retrieve held up investment of customers if he wins the December polls.</s>

en: Speaking at Tarkwa-Nsuaem in the Western Region, Mr Mahama wondered why the Akufo-Addo government does not appear to be interested in confiscating the properties of NAM1 but rather venting their anger on customers.
twi: ɔrekasa wɔ Tarkwa-Nsuaem wɔ Apueɛ mantam no, Mr. Mahama de too sɛ ɛyɛ no nwanwa sɛ Akufo Addo no ɛmfa ho sɛ NAM agye ɔmanfoɔ no agyapadeɛ na mmom ɔde n’aniberɛ asi ɔmanfoɔ no so
mt0: <pad> Ɔkaa wɔ Tarkwa-Nsuaem wɔ Western Region no, Mahama hwehwɛɛ sɛ ɔmanpanin Akufo-Addo no nkɔ so yɛ adwene sɛ ɔbɛgye NAM1 adeɛ no adi nanso ɔretu n'akyi wɔ adetɔnfoɔ no so.</s>

en: “What is so special about NAM 1 that Akufo-Addo is shielding him? Why do you unleash the police on innocent customers while NAM 1 walks free,” he fumed.

mt0: <pad> “Dɛn nti na NAM 1 no ho yɛ fɛ paa ma Akufo-Addo no ara nso ɔrekɔkyerɛ no? en: He assured that his next government will thoroughly investigate NAM1 and his directors and use all legitimate means to retrieve the funds.
twi: ɔhyɛɛ bɔ sɛ n’aban bɛyɛ NAM ne ne mpaninfoɔ ho nhwehwɛmu yie na wɔagye ɔmanfoɔ no sika ama wɔn
mt0: <pad> Ɔkyerɛɛ sɛ ɔman panin a ɔbɛba no bɛyɛ nhwehwɛmu wɔ NAM1 ne n'adwumakuw no mu na ɛbɛyɛ adwene sɛ ɛbɛfa ɔkwan a ɛteɛ a ɛbɛma sika no bɛkɔ a.</s>

en: he Circuit Court in Accra presided over by Her Honour Ellen Asamoah on September 7 adjourned the case in which Chief Executive officer (CEO) of Menzgold Nana Appiah Mensah (NAM1) has been adjourned to October 1, 2020.
twi: Otemuafoɔ Ellen Asamoah a ɔtenaa Menzgold panin NAM asɛm so sɛ Nkran Circuit kɔɔto atu asɛm no ahyɛ Ahinime da a ɛdi kan wɔ afe mpem mmienu ne aduonu mu
mt0: <pad> Ɔmanpanin no a wɔde ɔmanpanin no kɔɔ Ghana no, Circuit Court in Accra presided over by Her Honour Ellen Asamoah on September 7 adjourned the case in which Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of Menzgold Nana Appiah Mensah (NAM1) has been adjourned to October 1, 2020.</s>

en: The State had previously on June 24, 2020, filed new charges against NAM 1 at the Accra Circuit Court.
twi: Na ɔman no adi kan abɔ NAM soboɔ wɔ Kotonimaa wɔ afe mpem mmienu ne aduonu no mu wɔ Nkran Circuit kɔɔto
mt0: <pad> Ɔman no deɛ ɔde kɔɔ so wɔ June 24, 2020, kyerɛɛ NAM 1 wɔ Accra Circuit Court.</s>

en: Assistant Superintendent of Police (ASP) Sylvester Asare then told the Court that his directives were that he should hold on to the new charges and the plea taking of the accused.
twi: Polisi sɔpretɛnɛnt Sylvester Asare de too kɔɔto no anim sɛ akwankyerɛ a ne nsa aka ne sɛ ɔmfa soboɔ foforɔ ne NAM akyɛwpa nto hɔ ansa
mt0: <pad> Assistant Superintendent of Police Sylvester Asare kaa sɛ wɔn directives ne sɛ ɔbɛgyina sɛ ɔbɛkyere sɛdeɛ ɔbɛkyerɛ no ne sɛdeɛ ɔbɛkyerɛ sɛdeɛ ɔbɛkyerɛ no.</s>

en: On July 20, ASP Asare told the court that, they were seriously working to advise the court on the matter.
twi: Ayɛwohomɔbɔ no mu no, ASP Asare kakyerɛɛ kɔɔto no wɔretu kɔɔto no fo sɛ wɔntie akwankyerɛ a aba wɔ asɛm no ho no
mt0: <pad> July 20, ASP Asare kaa sɛ, wɔreyɛ adwuma sɛ wɔbɛkyerɛ ɔmanpanin no ho wɔ saa nsɛm yi ho.</s>

en: To this end, he prayed the court for a long adjournment after which they would have been able to advise the court on their intention of prosecution on the matter.
twi: Wɔsrɛɛ kɔɔto no sɛ wɔntu asɛm no nhyɛ da wɔn ne kwaadubɔfoɔ no nkɔyɛ ahoboa wɔ asɛm no ho mmra
mt0: <pad> Na ɛfiri saa nti, ɔsrɛɛ ɔmanpanin no sɛ wɔbɛgye nsunsuansoɔ a ɛboro mmerɛ bi ansa na wɔatumi ama ɔmanpanin no nimdeɛ sɛ wɔbɛyɛ adeɛ a wɔbɛkyere wɔn ho wɔ saa nsɛm yi mu.</s>

en: He said when the advice is ready, they will issue hearing notice to the accused persons to appear before the court to to do the needful.
twi: ɔkaa sɛ sɛ afotusɛm no ba a wɔbɛma wɔn aso ate na wɔasiesie wɔn a wɔabɔ wɔn kwaadu no ama wɔn aba kɔɔto abɛyɛ nea ɛfata
mt0: <pad> Ɔkaeɛ sɛ wɔbɛma nsɛm no ayɛ, wɔbɛma nnipa a wɔabɔ wɔn kwaadu no kɔ ɔmanpanin no anim na wɔatumi ayɛ ade a ɛsɛ sɛ wɔyɛ.</s>

en: But in court on Monday, prosecutor prayed for an adjournment and it was granted.
twi: Nanso wɔkɔɔ kɔɔto Dwoada no kwaafubɔfoɔ no srɛɛ kɔɔto sɛ wɔntu asɛm no nhyɛ da foforɔ na kɔɔto tiee wɔn
mt0: <pad> Nanso wɔ ɔmanpanin no mu no, prosecutor no de adjournment sɛdeɛ ɛbɛyɛ a wɔmaeɛ na wɔgyeeɛ no.</s>

en: The accused person NAM 1 was present in court.
twi: NAM a wɔabɔ no kwaadu no daa ne ho adi wɔ kɔɔto
mt0: <pad> Ɔkyeree no, NAM 1 kɔɔ wɔn anim wɔ asɛnnibea.</s>

en: The Circuit Court on July 26, 2019 granted NAM 1 bail in the sum of GH¢ 1 billion cedis with five sureties, three to be justified.
twi: Ayɛwohumɔbɔ da a ɛtɔ so mu wɔ afe mpem mmienu ne du nkron mu no, Nkran Circuit kɔɔto maa NAM bail GHS billion
mt0: <pad> Ɔmanpanin no a wɔwɔ Circuit Court no deɛ, July 26, 2019 maa NAM 1 bail in the sum of GH¢ 1 billion cedis with five sureties, three to be justified.</s>

en: He had pleaded not guilty to all initial 13 charges levelled against him by the State. The state had since amended its charged sheet which is yet to be moved.
twi: ɔkaa sɛ ɔnni fɔ wɔ soboɔ du mmiɛnsa a aban no de abɔ no no ho. ɛno aban no ayɛ sɛ ɛbɛyɛ nsesaeɛ wɔ soboɔ no mu na wɔahunu kwan a wɔbɛfa so
mt0: <pad> Ɔde ne ho too gua wɔ nsɛm 13 a ɔman no de too gua no mu. Afei ɔman no asesaa nsɛm a wɔde too gua no a, nanso ɛnkɔɔ so sɛ wɔbɛkyerɛɛ no.</s>

en: He is also to report to the police every Wednesday at 10:00 hours.

en: Parliament in 2012 passed the Road Traffic Regulations, 2012 (L.I. 2180) into law to regulate road transport in the country.

mt0: <pad> Parliament wɔ 2012 de Road Traffic Regulations, 2012 (L.I. 2180) kɔɔ asɛm mu sɛ ɛbɛyɛ asɛm a ɛbɛkyerɛ nsuo so akwantuo no wɔ ɔman no mu.</s>

en: Among other things, Regulation 128 under sections one to four (Legislative Instrument (L.I.) 2180) outlaws the use of motorbikes popularly referred to as ‘Okada’ and tricycles for commercial purposes except for courier and delivery services. It also directs the licensing authority not to register a motorcycle to carry a fare-paying passenger.
twi: Mmara no baa sɛ ɛnni kwan sɛ wɔde okada ne motor fa ɔmanfoɔ no gye sɛ ebia wɔde di dwuma sɛ ɔourier anaa delivery Services. Afei wɔhyɛɛ DVLA sɛ ɛnni kwan sɛ wɔma motor foɔ no krataa a wɔde di dwuma sɛ wɔde reyɛ adwuma afa ɔmanfoɔ
mt0: <pad> Wɔ nsɛm afoforɔ mu no, Regulation 128 wɔ sections one to four (Legislative Instrument (L.I.) 2180) kyerɛ sɛ motorbikes a wɔfrɛ no ‘Okada’ ne tricycles ɛnyɛ adwumadie dwumadie nkabom gye courier ne delivery services. Ɛsan de kɔma licensing authority sɛ ɛnde motorcycle bɛka passengers a wɔde sika bɛtua no.</s>

en: This legislation, notwithstanding, okada and tricycle (pragya) have taken over the transportation system in many parts of the country.

en: Since I came back to Ghana 20 years ago and to the realisation that the reality of our country was very different from what was in the Geography books, this was the most successful attempt at doing something to reverse the catastrophic degradation of our lands.

en: Five million seedlings were made available by the Ministry of Lands and Mineral Resources for us to plant and there was a joyful atmosphere that I hadn’t noticed for a long time.

en: It might well be that enough Ghanaians had noticed that the one thing that needed our attention more than anything else was the state of the land mass that we call Ghana.
twi: Ghanafoɔ bɛhwɛ ahu a na adeɛ baako a ɛhia sɛ yɛte y'ani hwɛ sene bibiara aka paa ara ne yɛn nsaasetam teabea a yɛfrɛ no Ghana no.

en: Far more than any potholed road, any dilapidated school, any hospital without beds or any schoolchildren without computers and I daresay, even the worst of any rampaging virus, what we should all get and remain agitated about is the state of our land, the land that had lost its forest cover, the rivers that are drying up, what used to be a wet month of May turning out hot and totally dry.
twi: Adeɛ a ɛho hia sene akwan mu mmena, sukuu dan a atete, ayaresabea a nni mpa anaa sukuu nkwadaa nni abɛɛfo badwemma mfidie mpo no, merepae mu aka sɛ mpo yareɛ a ɛretrɛ no adeɛ baako a ɛwɔ sɛ yɛn nyinaa bo fu ho paa ne yɛn nsaase tebea, nsaase a ayera ne kwaeɛ, ne nsutene awe, sutɔberɛ Kɔtɔnima bosome a seisei ara abɛyɛ ɔhyew ne ɔpɛ.
